Review Text

Beautiful scenery and the staff was really pleasant and helpful...my family had a great stay...the food was delicious and affordable  We didnt have to leave the hotel to get a good meal ..we will definitely come back soon

We had a sunday family brunch and the members of staff were nice and  friendly especially with my crying toddler, food was nice, and  the ambience superb.  I will surely be coming back for more lunch dates and will love to spend a night or two there

Hotel was superb,the staff were also very wonderful and prompt,talk about the food OMG was almost home made.i loved the location since its on the major road,i rexommend this hotel to the public to check it out.keep the good job up.

went out for drinks and light bites. cocktails were okay but slow in coming. the pizzas were not that great and the caesar salad mediocre.  not a bad place ambience wise  to have meetings but don’t hold your breath when waiting to be served.

I and my family had such a great time, service was the best i have gotten so far, nice ocean view and geat meals, prompt response,wonderful staffs. Really worth every penny, would surely be there coming easter.

I had to return 😀 Nothing amazes me more than their consistent upgrade when it comes to making My stay a wonderful experience. Was expecting the same sweet time I had last time, but I got more. Seems new to me every time I go there. I'll definitely be there again when next I visit Nigeria. I love Radisson blu

We stayed at this hotel from Feb 27th - March 5th. Check-In was very slow, paid with cash and they wouldn't accept USD bills dated 2009. (Very inconvenient- they should state this on their website) We finally got our room and it was on 1st floor. Sheets were dirty (hairs in the bed, stained sheets), the bathroom sink was leaking on bathroom floor (lucky no one slipped and fell). I called down to front desk and they moved us to a room on the second floor. This room was still run down and sheets were stained, towels were no longer white. They were all grey, so they should either replace or wash with bleach. So glad I packed my own towels etc. Went to breakfast the next morning at the restaurant in the hotel. Very little to choose from, and it was over $40 USD for two for a bit of

Nice modern looking hotel, near British Deputy High Commission offices. Pool is next to the lagoon so you can watch the boats passing by. Water lovely and warm. Room nicely appointed and bright. TV didn't work with remote (room 334) but no loss. Bath and separate shower which was good. Comfy bed and a/c was fine. Food in Lagoon Restaurant very nice, though service was a little confused. Great cocktails. Used 3 hour Express Laundry. Everything came back, even my cufflinks and collar studs I had left inside pockets.  Staff very helpful - a great place.

Having a nice stay at radission blue the food is great and so is the ambiance and staff. Angela and China at the front office were very friendly and helpful during my stay.The host at the restaurant were also very helpful. My room was kept clean and I enjoyed my stay.

This will be my second visit to the hotel and i must say it only gets better. My team and i had specific requests for this particular stay,not only were our expectations met, the staff went over and beyound our expectations every single day. The breakfast is top notch and there is plenty of variety to Choose from. The guest relations responsible ( Bukola) was amazing in attending our wishes. Fumne were also one of the biggest contributors to our every need. I / we can only fully recomend a stay at Radisson blue Anchorage, Lagos. Nigeria
Review Text

It was my first Time here and I loved it. Warm reception and friendly and very professional staff. Great food nice flavours and nice comfortable rooms. And beautiful artworks In the hotel.Nice place to be.

I just checked out of Radisson after spending 3 nights there for business and it was a wonderful experience, nice rooms needs a little lift, nice ambiance, nice comfortable meeting rooms, good breakfast. Also nice service from the spa. Location is a plus.

Radisson Blu has improved a lot compared to July 2018 I was there last before January 2019. So muc improvements with the food options and the taste.  The lobby to the swimming pool just connected to the stairway is now well decorated and so beautiful. Kudos to the new management.

bathroom needs an upgrade, new towels needed, carpet needs to be cleaned. At check in I was charged way and breakfast was not included meaning I had to pay extra for breakfast every morning, because reservation could not find my booking, and even though they still found it a bit later they said they could not apply it and needed to cancel it and had it booked manually giving me a much more expensive rate for the same room.

I have never actually stayed in the hotel itself since I live close by but I just love the outside area. Very pleasant staff, fast service and the food is always superb. The smallest finger food snacks are served as if you ordered the most expensive dish. Local food is very "homely" prepared. Lovely place for a quiet afternoon

Was there over the weekend and my stay was fantastic from check in to check out was fantastic. Very comfortable bed, nice buffet and highly effective staffs. The view of the lagoon is breathtaking. And nice to wake up to in the morning. Special thanks to the security team I really don’t think there is any hotel as safe as this in Lagos very security conscious.

Staying in Radison this week is like a dream. This hotel is exquisite and the rooms are just very comfy and exceptionalLy Neat. The meals are just so homely and inviting. I’m still awed by the unbelievable low prices charged by this new hotel.

There was No variety with Nigerian soups/foods and the meals were not tasty at all.  The House keepers didn't come to clean till mid afternoon daily.  Not so cheerful- looking staff.  Poor service generally.

Was here for business it was a good stay, the rooms are comfortable breakfast was good. I was upgraded  to the lagoon view by a nice receptionist and I must say the view was breath taking. Will come here again for leisure.

Review Title: Awesome place to be hands down
Review Text: Was in radisson blu over the Christmas period and I must say it was a wonderful experience. Rooms are tidy and spacious food was great the pool is beautiful and was nice to take a dip everyday and take a nice view of the lagoon. The staff are 100 percent and very polite. Have the snails at the surface bar. It's fantastic.
Review Text

Checkin was slow for my team mates. I had a good stay but the water closet for my bathroom had some streaks, food was not labelled causing me to eat something I am allergic to. Towels were not changed on a daily basis

Review Title: Waste of money/don’t believe the hype
Review Text: Rooms are old and need a remodel/ very noisy and can hear Everything on the outside/ money not well spent/ internet is very bad/ the customer service is slow to respond to correct any issues/ horrible

I stayed at this hotel over the Christmas period and had such a great experience . The view is beautiful, the hotel itself very clean and stylish. The staff made sure my guests and I were taken care of and catered to all our needs . The food amazing as well. I would return for sure when I come back to Lagos .

I was in Lagos for the Christmas Holidays and I stayed at the Radissonblu Anchorage hotel. The staff are very courteous and professional, The Breakfast is simply amazing. My room overlooked the Lagoon and I must say it’s a sight to behold. Thou I had to request for room cleaning on a particular day since no one had come , my request was attended to promptly. I would recommend you stay here if you are ever in Lagos

Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel Victoria island have Wonderful lagoon view, excellent customer services and they make very delicious meals. You get to meet wonderful people at the pool side while listening to karaoke.

Being a wheelchair girl in Lagos is certainly extremely challenging. There a lot of steps everywhere. However, the day I came to the Radisson, I was pleasantly surprised. From the main entrance to the poolside outdoor area, there were adequate ramps all over the place. I felt included; like someone really put thought into the decor and made sure differently abled people's needs were catered to.  I don't know if they have wheelchair accessible rooms yet but I'm eager to find out. Will definitely be getting a drink at the Blu soon!

I enjoyed the welcome message for me and my husband coming into the room... The hotel had an amazing smell which I still can't get over. the breakfast was ok... The overall rating was very ok..my husband loved it

Having a splendid stay at Radissonblu. Had an amazing Christmas brunch. The lagoon view is breath taking always stay there and thank me later. And the staff are equally great and obviously professionals always willing to assist when asked.

Had a swell time with bae. Beautiful ambience with lagoon view. I sure had a memorable experience. This hotel is your holiday destination any day. Hotel is situated on the ozumba mbadiwe street Victoria island, Lagos. Thank me later

I had a great experience during my visit. From the customer care officers to the security men. The rooms were excellent too and the food was amazing. Would definitely make this visit again to Radisson blu.
Review Text

Visited here some weeks ago with a friend and the experience was worth the while. Especially the welcoming and friendly atmosphere. The staff there were awesome. Would definitely visit again whenever I’m in that part of the world. Kudos guys !!

It was a great experience. Check in/out was swift .breakfast options were great and staff were professional and helpful. It was difficult getting a parking space when we arrived. Overall, experience was great

Stayed here several times and seen the room rates keep going up. As usual the staff were friendly and treated our group well. However, the showers need to be improved as it takes a considerable time to get water hot enough. Also, parking space is limited now. Will definitely stay here again.

Review Title: Nice Hotel - some improvement to services required
Review Text: The room was very nice witha view of the lagoon, howeverthe mini bar was empty.  There was some delay in receiving some clothing items that I asked to be pressed.  The staff are very excellent though. Very friendly and the hotel is well taken care of.  The breakfast is also very nice with a lot of variety

I arrived on the evening of Tues 11th Dec.  I was handed the key card to my room which turned out to be a smoking room when a non-smoker room was requested.  Back to reception who very kindly upgraded me to a suite.  My first reaction was delight.  There I experienced broken internal door, cracked mirror in backroom, stale chocolate in the mini bar and chipped furniture.  The suite is in desperate need of tlc.  It looks old and tired.  Oh aircon not working properly.  Yesterday I moved to a normal non-smoking room (wasn't previously available despite confirmation res #).  Late meetings last night.  Back to my room shower not draining, chipped furniture with water stains on table.  Internet unstable, call to Radisson One Touch Service from met with unfriendly approach advising I

My stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel was exciting, momentous and rewarding. Great environment for Business meetings. Breakfast at the hotel was wonderful covering all types of dishes ranging from local to continental  cuisines. Staff and personnel were quite handy, calling on phone from time to time to find out how I was faring and seeking to know if there was anything more they could do to make my stay more exciting. I will surely visit again on my next trip. Thank you all for having me. Merry Christmas and a happy and prosperous New Year in advance,

Good infrastructure, but a long way from providing a good customer journey..Business Louge is a real joke.. nothing there other than food you would be really concerned about eating !,,Could not even have a Coke or a Soda can there.. who are you kiddie about having a Business Lounge?..

Review Title: very good place to stay in Lagos
Review Text: Very nice hotel in good location. nice pool, good services, big rooms, nice view from the room. very good sleeping, good isolations and control on air condition...good concierge services and drivers ...

Beautiful hotel at natural location.wake up in the morning and be looking at the lagoon was quite an experience. The breakfast was delicious and with various selections but the system of breakfast for one is not acceptable for the hotel is acceptable.i was made to pay for my son

I keep coming back to this hotel just for its people and the awesome Surface Bar & Grill.But the condition of rooms have deteriorated:1.No hot water in shower2. Bath Tub chipped out at 4 places3. Dirt behind the bed4. Weird smelling corridorsIt is time the management took a look at the maintenance of the rooms. House Keeping is not bad but the rooms have dilapidated, ageing looks.I would like to come back to this hotel but the property has to show improvements.That being said, the staff are simply fantastic and they make the stay worthwhile.
Review Text

Overall a good experience and had the potential to be excellent. I experienced a theft which I did not notice until I had gotten back home. Reception staff were not very efficient and were not very helpful or enthusiastic.

I found my experience a bit poor as I expected a cleaner room and better service. I know it’s not a five star hotel, however they definitely need to do better. The room was fairly clean although I wiped down the light switch as it was teaming with dirty hand prints; the toilet was left unflushed with toilet paper in it, and the base of the bed had unknown stains...(see pictures). I asked for face towels as they had none in the room and 4 hours later I still didn’t get the towels. Then when i went  to inspect my bed before sleeping, the sheets had dirt stains. My colleague who arrived later in the night waited for the bus at the airport for over 45 mins but the bus never came. And when I tried to call the concierge desk I couldn’t get through for more than 20 minutes. Front desk

Review Title: Cleanliness and Front Desk Staff Issues
Review Text: Room cleanliness was cursory at best. Edges and corners, especially in the bathroom room were neglected. Dead cockroach was found in the middle of the floor on Day 2 of my stay. Front desk was friendly on check-in but refused to provide a copy of my bill at check-out citing company policy, because it had been prepaid in advance via a travel agent. I simply wanted written evidence of a zero balance at check-out which was never received and the hotel's explanation was nonsensical.

A nice hotel, well located.  The staff is very nice and friendly.  One strange thing is, your key only allows you into the wing were your room is.  So I was on the 3rd floor, and the fitness center is a floor below the lobby level.  When you leave, you cannot enter the lobby floor wing to get back to the elevators, but have to climb back to the 3rd floor.  Or go outside and walk through the patio bar.

My second stay at Radisson I came first time few years ago then the hotel closed environnement is nice. Rooms are clean but carpets need to be removed as there are some stains everywhere. Beds are comfortable. Wifi is very fast everywhere, free, and no code ! breakfast is ok, lots of choice. quality is ok. Music sometimes too loud in the morning at breakfast Menu at the bar in the evening need to be improved. Choice is limited and too many calories dishes  Outside the terrace is nice but a very bad smell of petrol because the generators are not too far the gym is too small unfortunately

I have been to hotels in Nigeria and can attest that Radisson Blu Victoria Island is second to none with international standard, from the security at the gate to the warm reception of the portals and exquisite restaurants, speedy internet facility, to mention just but a few. Staying over in Radisson is like home away from home, Security well guaranteed.

Review Title: A memorable stay at Radisson Blu
Review Text: I had a great time, and the staff were courteous. Checking in took a bit of time due to the number of people checking in about the same time. After that, every other thing was seamless, and I had an enjoyable stay!

Overall good experience.  Rooms pretty clean. Internet pretty reliable. Restaurant food is good.  I had a great veggie burger!  Issue with the dress code for the main restaurant that is considered "fine dining" however it is buffet style.  A major issue with breathing in gasoline fumes during my swim or sitting on the terrace.

This was an excellent choice for my first trip to Lagos. The hotel is towards one end in Victoria Island and is right on the water.  It is a true 5* with great amenities as well as a wonderful complement of staff who proactively checked daily to see if there was more they could be doing to make my stay more comfortable.   I got a room on the ground floor. It was spacious and overlooked the water. The cleaning crew ensured it was always refreshed and crisp when I returned to the hotel after a long day. They have a number of restaurants. Breakfast was really good. It was a breakfast buffet with your normal international offering augmented with some local dishes. Lunch was a mostly local dish affair but there was an a’la carte menu should your taste for hot spicy food resemble

What disappointed me is the room, the hallway and general condition of the hotel: it needs a good update. The rooms are older although clean. The door accessing the hallway from the main lobby was noisy and woke me up. Small detail, but no iron in the room which puzzled me. Now, the worst part is the fitness room (health club/centre): small, old, hot and stinky, and very limited equipment. Please update this asap. The bar and restaurant though are very nice and food very good. Staff was very good with me during my stay. Speaking of no iron, they ironed my shirt and pants for free that morning to apologize - that is great customer service. Security is taken very carefully with thorough screening at the entrance. I had a view of the Lagoon, but also the background music from the
Review Text

the hotel is located on the busy island road but can be  man over to any meeting points within the island in just a drive or walk away . good selection of room views and almost all rooms have a different room setting so a long staying guest does not feel stocked in a room for a long time , warm and friendly reception, great combination of the swimming pool and sea view nice open grill by the pool side

The Blu was a very nice hotel with all the amenities you would expect including a decent restaurant with very good Nigerian food (warning, they like it spicy!), a very pleasant bar and seating area over the water and a good gym.  The staff were extremely nice and helpful.  For an American visiting Lagos for the first time I was somewhat concerned with security and the hotel is secure and I never had any concerns.  Ask for a water view room as I was woken up twice at 4am by trucks (I think fuel for the generator) on the street side.  I experienced a few 20 second power outages but the hotel generator kept the power on reliably.

Review Title: Terrible night at Radisson Blu V.I.
Review Text: I’m currently staying at the Radisson blu, V.I., Lagos. This hotel is supposed to be a 4**** hotel. One would normally expect some consideration for the guests.   It is October 25, 2 AM and the hotel is renovating one of the conference room and the corridor situated on the ground floor. I called the reception 5 times and each time I got the same reply: we will get them to stop and 5 Minutes later they start again their hammering job. I went down to the reception and talked to the front manager. It seems hat finally the have stopped.   In addition, every morning at 5:30, they start the music near the pool bar. No customer by the pool nor at the surface bar. One would wonder why they would turn on the radio so early in the morning. The only reason I could think of is maybe to keep

Beautiful room, nice environment, well maintained facilities, friendly staff, great ambience. Lagoon front views are to die for. I highly recommend it for business professionals. Its very close to nice spots on the Island.

I was blown away by the service and warm welcome by the staff. It is a breath of fresh air from the surrounding area (as I was here for business). The breakfast was incredible! I plan to be back very soon.

Fairly new hotel and located on the lagoon/river, with nice views especially at night. The rooms are a decent size and being new, in very good condition. Reminding myself that I'm in Nigeria, there are some things to be improved: -as per one of the photos (condiments in the bathroom) the small body lotion was used by someone else and left for me.....understanding it could be an oversight as the cleaner may have assumed "it is closed, it must be unused" a simple paper-seal could have prevented it. -the AC in the room cannot be set lower than 23.5'C. AC's in Nigeria are average at best and this setting did not feel comfortable to me, it felt warm and humid. -there are no USB chargers/inlets. In tjis day and age where most plug points provide for.it, is dissapointing. - there is a

The hotel is in a good location for Victoria Island. As a first-time visitor to Nigeria, my paramount concern was security. The hotel is very secure with a gated entrance and guards etc. The hotel itself is well appointed with a nice atrium and bar area inside. At the rear of the hotel overlooking the waterway is a large terrace and bar where you can get drinks and meals etc.. also on an evening there is live music. Whilst the side of the hotel that faces the waterway may have the best views, it also has the music from the band to consider. My room was on the 3rd floor which gave access to the business lounge which was socked with light snacks and drinks. Rooms are large, modern and well appointed. Overall a very pleasant stay and somewhere I will stop again. All the staff

My mother and I stayed at the Radisson Blu on a recent business trip I had to Nigeria. We stayed 6 days and greatly enjoyed this property. The staff was nice, and the restaurant was good. We appreciated the beautiful pool and outdoor lounge area. Everyone we encountered was kind and helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Amazing hotel and friendly staff made our business trip so easy and enjoyable. The amenities avail were great. Food and service was good.Will definitely be back and use this hilotel for future trips to Nigeria

Too expensive for the service and the commodities...Administration is not at the expected level of such a brand.Very noisy and the bedrooms are really not at the level...lights are not working...towels have holes...really disgusting
Review Text

Good rooms, nice facilities and good view. Good location and security. Well up to (and in some areas, exceeding) Radisson’s high standards. Would request that one universal power point be provided near the bedside.

Spent some dates in this hotel and it was was fantastic. The ambience, cleanliness, wonderful reception and friendly staff. The food was also great. Location excellent. Highly recommended for business or holiday.

Decent rooms and a good location. My biggest issue was that piped music plays through the night. I found it to be too loud and did not get even one night of restful sleep. The manager agreed it was a problem,  but despite assurances nothing was done.

Everything in Radisson Blu hotel was at the expected high standards of Radisson. Clean and quiet rooms with proper air-conditioning. The staff was always polite and professional and any queries were satisfied quickly and properly. The bar and the restaurant in the lobby are at the same high standards.

Good food, excellent position, super friendly staff! I used this hotel 3 times in the last 18 months, and will return again when I have to visit Lagos! The pool and restaurants are worth visiting, and te security excellent!

First and foremost, I was impressed by the service at the Radisson, the staff are friendly, helpful and customer orientated. The hotel is well located on VI in close proximity to a number of commercial enterprises. Security is taken seriously both on the gate and inside the hotel itself. The hotel is relatively well maintained with spacious rooms, decent showers, sizeable comfortable beds and large flat screen TVs. The TV programming could to with being a bit better as it looks like the number of channels have been radically cut back. The stock of towels also need a little replenish as they are getting a bit tired. Go for the rooms looking over the quieter creek rather than the car park at the front. Pack some ear plugs as the AC is strong and efficient but emits an industrial

The hotel has fairly good security and friendly personnel at the reception area.  The hotel offers a great view of the lagoon, and guests can enjoy a good and relaxed atmosphere at the restaurant facing the lagoon.  The temperature in the rooms was always chilled and it is not so easy to control it.  It is strange that the hotel some times struggle to offer iron for guests.At the restaurant and breakfast area the staff can be tardy

Enjoyed my water view room, the ambience, attention to details, helpful staff especially China in the front desk.  Overall I enjoyed my stay.  - Efficient, friendly and helpful staff.  - Great Sunday buffet  - Conducive meeting room

Everything worked! I was actually surprised.  The room, the food, the WiFi, the ambience. It all worked. Even when the light went out for a moment, it still worked 😊. Well done Radisson. I really recommend it!!

The bed was very comfortable and the room was cozy.  Staff were very friendly and helpful, Chima, Wilson and Wellington in particular. The food was good and came in a wide variety. The live band in the Voyager Restaurant can be better.
Review Text

My first ever visit to Nigeria. Had my apprehensions prior to arrival, based on inputs and what i had heard from colleagues. Smooth exit from the airport and eventless arrival into the Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel.  Front desk was eager to assist and complete my check in process. Murphys Law exists. Things do go wrong. my credit card refused to work. And finally i had to make a cash down payment as deposit. Had the problem subsequently sorted out in the afternoon.   The rooms are spacious and have decent facilities. Power cuts and black outs (even for a few moments) happens all the time. Strangely this is the norm across the city of Lagos. decent wifi connection. Comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom could have some rethink. there is no health faucet in the toilet. The

I was back at the Radisson Blu for one night last week and it has become very expensive. The service was pretty good and the rooms are adequate. Breakfast isn't bad either. The location is very convenient and I always enjoy the deck on the water. However, at $456 for a Monday night there are far better options in Lagos.

Review Title: The hotel is quiet, clean, and the breakfast is excellent
Review Text: It was a business trip to Nigeria and I enjoyed staying at this hotel, the room was clean and the breakfast was good,The only problem is the laundry service , They were bad, they were damaged my pants ,So the spot is still on it, after paying a big amount .

I had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. It is clean, well situated with a nice view and friendly staff. I will most certainly be back at the hotel, when I am back in Lagos and would highly recommend the hotel for business trips.

Review Title: Very secure hotel with spacious rooms
Review Text: Located on Victoria Island, and close to the business area, this is a good hotel to stay at.  Rooms are spacious, and clean.  The hotel has both a buffet restaurant, and an a la carte restaurant.  The bar is small, but nice, and has a good selection of drinks.  Safety and security are good, with secure entry to the hotel grounds.

The service was good, customer service was fine, restaurant was ok. The meals were fresh and tasty.  The room temperature were chilling most times, the internet connection was on-point. I like to suggest that other room flooring types be considered for ease of cleaning and maintenance.

Nice hotel, ambience is great, the pool side is a nice relaxation spot with a view of the Lagos lagoon and the food is great. The presence of an in-house Hans & Renee (ice cream cafe) is a major plus :-)   Parking space is a bit limited and the waiters can be a tad bit distracted at times. The gym is also kinda small but overall it's a nice hotel

So far this is the best hotel I have stayed in while in Lagos. It has warm and courteous staff, a lovely view of the lagoon and nice mix of food. The rooms were very spacious, the most I have so far experienced among the Radisson Blu hotels that I have stayed in elsewhere in the world...and they were very clean too. dmugushu@yahoo.com

Review Title: An amazing view; outmatched only by the service quality and delivery
Review Text: Despite the unplanned business we needed to take care of; we had an amazing stay.The lagoon view is breath taking, and the services always spectacular and on point, all the time during our stay. And you really need to try that jollof rice! Definitely coming back, since we need to make a 100% leisure trip.

Very nice place to stay in Lagos, feel different than in Lagos as if you are in Europe. Its proximity to sea is the best location wise. People are nice, though breakfast has very little options for Veg, but it is not bad at all.Good value for money
Review Text

Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel is the best choice for corporate travelers. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Excellent breakfast spread. Highly recommend the surface bar which has breathtaking views of the lagoon and extraordinary service by the wait staff. I recommend Mr. Promise for his excellent trolley cocktails. Will definitely pay a visit again.

The lagoon view was fantastic from the swimming pool and the surface bar. Good dinner and drinks. But beware you cannot wear shorts to breakfast by the pool it is not allowed apparently. Room were good with balcony. Amenities in rooms can be approved. Most of the staff was very helpful but there are always exceptions.

Decent hotel - just feels like it needs a little attention in places like the corridors and rooms. The outdoor bar area is great though. The pool is small and the gym is ok. There’s a nice ice cream parlour on site which is fab.

I stayed in May for two nights. sleep quality was good, safe and clean. every day you have 2 bottles of drinking water free - you will need clean water in Nigeria.  however, some issues regarding payment and special requests  I asked for paying usd, they do accept usd however they only accept it if its date newer then 2012. it is not officially mentioned any where else before entered to the hotel? If you have older ones - forget them - they not valid for hotel, you may have shortage in cash?  Second day, I had to leave early for my flight and I asked for early breakfast at 05:00 PM, I informed reception the previous evening. they said "no issue, it will be ready". when I went down for my breakfast at 04:50, no one was aware about my request, I had to wait about 30-40 minute.  be

I would recommend this hotel for prospective traveler or tourist. location is excellent with a lovely view of the lagoon, the interiors are lovely and the services are very exceptional. One of the best hotel on the island.

I stayed in the Radisson for two weeks on a crazy busy work schedule, the reception staff supported in managing all my appointments and visitors flawless. The restaurant and bar staff made me feel good and security staff were super professional and sometimes open for a well meant joke and conversation. It was a delight to stay at the Radisson, thanks to the wonderful staff!  Gert Jan

Review Title: Raddison makes me sing the Blues
Review Text: Noisy floor Nousy aircon Slow service Great view and best part was leaving I dreaded bed time as I knew because of noise every night would be a long night!! Ordered a club sandwich 1st night. It took more than an hour to be delivered and was cold when it got there - mixup in the kitchen at 21:45  I left an exhausted man after 3 nights of no sleep

The Radisson Blu Anchorage is simply a good hotel.  It is by all means the best hotel I have used in Lagos.   Location is great, staff is adorable and unbelievably helpful (I got to test them on 2 occurrences and they were just great), rooms are spacious and very clean, food is great.  The  laundry service sent back what I estimate to be the cleanest laundry I got in a hotel in West Africa.  Thank you Radisson Anchorage.

Location is excellent, decoration excellent, it’s one of the nicest Radisson hotels I ever visited. The remark below has nothing to do with the building, location or quality of the hotel it’s about the quality of hospitality at the front desk;  The blooper; The normally excellent experience became the most horrible hospitality service you can get.  It begins at reception where they did not acknowledge a booking from booking.com for 2 days. So simply they tell you “sorry you have only booked for one night” and the argument “it’s the mistake of booking.com not us.   For me you are the hotel making rooms available. Come up with an solution, that’s called being hospital to your customers.    At that same reception not any action to book another room or offer any other option like an

Fantastic experience at Radissonblu; from check-in to check-out. Great staff at the reception, restaurant, room service, housekeeping etc. Improvement opportunity is to change the rug in 319, and the towels need to be checked before dispensing; I saw an old, thready towel in my room which was changed as soon as I mentioned to staff that it's far below Radissonblu quality.
Review Text

Lovely view, but need to work on your service, was there for over 30 mins, no one attended to me had to go ask for a waiter to come serve me still no body came over 3 differrent times.you have a good space but service is poor.
Author Location: San Juan de Los Lagos, Mexico

Review Text: Started here for 2 nights and found this place to be better than the rest. My points below :  - Rooms were neat and clean. The hallway though did not seem that clean. - Staff is courteous and helpful. - Food is great. Though during busy hours it can take a while to get your order. - They have a great restaurant outside where a live band plays. - The only thing they can work upon is making sure the food is delivered on time and that they pay close attention to room cleaning and hallway cleanliness.  Will surely stay here again, highly recommended.  Cheers

I went in business trip, and this hotel have an amazing view for the city, yes it’s a caotic city but you to experience it. The bedrooms are very clean and quality service is very good. I felt very comfortable during the stay. The bar and gym are also some of the things that I want to highlight because it’s true. The food is very good

The Room was clean and the Hotel Facility as a whole was great. The Shower worked and there was running Hot Water. The Air Conditioning was great and the Wi-Fi Services worked exceptionally. Breakfast was wow and the Staff were very friendly and helpful

My 2nd stay in two month - how can my perception be 180 degrees different. I am serious, this has been horrible.  Check in: disaster. Slow, not caring, ignorance to loyalty program.  Outside bar: very nice place to sit. But if things go wrong there is NO ONE who cares. No management to de escalate. Super poorly managed. Btw. Never ever order a simple glass of wine. You’ll see what happens if you do.  Rooms: close to filthy.  How can you clean a room and provide NO towels ? And than don’t deliver within a 15 min timeframe when asked?? It actually got worse the second night, but I don’t want to bother here. If you care, never walk bare feet in those rooms. Have a look at the photo. The AC is dripping, and the operating device totally outdated.  Breakfast: really nice.  Check out:

I’m a frequent visitor at Radisson Blu Anchorage and every trip relieves memories of the first. From the calm soothing view of the Atlantic to the efficiency and prompt response of staff to my needs. Would specially commend Virginia at the front desk, she makes bookings and check in easy breezy. The efo ole Egusi soup is really tasty. Make sure to request for the Lagoon view room, a bit pricier than the regular rooms but you’ll be glad you did. They also have an amazing rate during weekends and are very open with the late check out option Incase you have an evening flight. Security is very tight so there’s no worry about stray in’s. There’s an affordable Nail Bar and Salon in the basement too. Altogether and in one word, SUPERB! Thank me later....  Chinenye.

This hotel is unique and has a style. What I noticed here was that everyone was nice, including the staffs and lodgers were actually living like neighbours. It is a family friendly place and of course good for business people who has activities to accomplish in Lagos. The meals are standard and generally, the atmosphere is relaxing In a serene and calm location.

We are currently spending 3 days in the Radisson Blu. I think the most impressive thing for me is how helpful all the staff are. From ironing my outfit at no charge because there were no ironing boards available, - to changing a menu item at the Terrance restaurant for me, nothing has been too much trouble for the team.   The rooms are comfortable and clean. The shower and I have an argument each morning so I’ve started using the bath. I’m not prepared to worry about infrastructure in Africa that can’t be changed at short notice. This is all round really awesome  - and I travel quite a bit.  Good business centre as well.   We used the hotel driver yesterday - now, that could get pricey. But then one has a dedicated driver in a jag. Today we’ve opted for Uber. Everyone says they

My trip to Lagos is highly memorable.  One of the main reasons is staying at this hotel.  Totally impressed by the warm & hospitality of Radisson Blu Anchorage. Throughout my stay, the staff went the extra mile to ensure that its guests are well taken care of. They did it with sincerity and passion.    I wish to commend the following staff - Chikodi, Adedayo, Vivian and Virginia. Excellent attitude.  The 2 ladies are always cheerful, serving clients with gentle smiles.  The 2 gentlemen are full of motivation, energy and in high spirit.  They handled their roles and responsibilities with pride and efficiency.  This clearly reflects the outstanding management of this hotel.  I would also believe that the training & development of Radisson Blu Anchorage is highly effective.  I am

The property is situated on Victoria Island and is at least an hour on a good day from the airport.  The reception on arrival was fantastic, it was a great start to my stay until I got to my room. As it was very busy, the room I was allocated was poor, with tired furniture, stains and no towels. I asked to move and was given a slightly better room and a promise to be moved to a better room on the upper floors, which was fair enough.  The next day, true to their word, I was allocated a much better room on the upper floor, which had a nice view of the lagoon and was much brighter and cleaner.  Breakfast was fine, but the variety could be better, Food and service at the Surface grill  was excellent.  Security is very good and the staff were always pleasant.
Review Text

Lovely view, but need to work on your service, was there for over 30 mins, no one attended to me had to go ask for a waiter to come serve me still no body came over 3 differrent times.you have a good space but service is poor.
Author Location: San Juan de Los Lagos, Mexico

Review Text

Whilst a safe hotel very poor customer service and a limited menu. The check in process was also poor and was charged extra for early check in even though I was also checking out earlier. So just felt like I was being exploited.

We are definitely going to spend our next vacation in any of the Radisson blue hotel. We love the beautiful ambience, the food. Oh we love the stake. We also love the fact that they cater for Muslims who are fasting to have their sahur.

My stay was very pleasant and I was well attended to. I’m pleased to recommend the hotel to other people. The overall reception towards us was warm and we had real value for money.  I would love to come back soon.

Review Title: Pleasantly surprised by the great hotel and service
Review Text: Friendly, helpful staff.  Great food and service.  Lovely view over the lagoon.  Comfortable bed and peaceful atmosphere which meant a good night's sleep each night.  If I am back in Lagos, I will be sure to stay here again.

I had a wonderdul time at the hotel and really enjoyed my stay. The services were too notch, cleanliness was in point and the meals were also great. The surroundings was really beautiful and the location was also lovely as I was impressed with it's calmness. Hopefully I will still visit when I have the opportunity to do so in the future

My experience was refreshing and I did enjoy myself so much. At a point, I was wishing to remain in the hotel and not go back.  That is how much I enjoyed staying there, and my room was like a safe haven. All in all, it was wonderful.

This is my 5th stay at RBA.   I have also stayed at Eko, 4 points and the intercontinental once each... but I keep coming back here.  That says it all.  Rooms are nice, location is convenient, waterside view is very nice, food is tasty and safe (although I would like the menu to change a little more frequently).   Any questions, feel free to ask.

My stay at the hotel was short but I beg to relish every single moment spent. The room is spacious and has most basic items and amenities available. Having breakfast at the seaside/lagoon whichever it is was really good. The food was delicious 😋. Would I visit again.. Yes! Yes!! Yes!!!

Review Title: Review of services received at Radisson Blu Anchorage
Review Text: It was a business visit, so I did not have much time to really go round the whole facility, but the services rendered where great except during lunch break where the Muslim faithfuls did could not have lunch because of Ramadan so they asked for their meals to be packed which is a norm in most hotels, arrangements are always made for such situations but the staff kept saying there was nothing they could do. That was quite disappointing because I expected a place as great as Radisson should have such covered. It took a lot of effort on my end to solve the problem,that I would say was the only challenge I faced. Overall the services where excellent.

Business stay in this beautiful location area. Good food in buffet restaurant. Fish, meat and for vegan too. Breackfast with all you can ask.  A bit slow service on pool bar restaurant but with a nice lagoon wiew. Well equipped fitness center. Moquette in corridor and room need a renuval. Very professional personnel in front desk, in restaurant but generally all hotel stuff very friendly.Great ice-cream shop located in courtyard garden.
Review Text

Hotel is located in Victoria Island near the lagoon where you can have great view from your bed. Great service, great food. Personnel were awesome, kind and helpful. Would suggest the hotel without a doubt.

This was by far one of the worst hotel experiences I have had. I have stayed in Lagos hotels many times and this was very poor. Cleanliness and ability to check in was a nightmare. Gym was disgusting.

Very impressed with the staff. They are delegent, amiable, always ready to assist and very welcoming. They made my stay enjoyable. The stand alone room we rented for our business event more than met all our expectations. The carpet in some of the rooms may need to be changed and the breakfast menu a greater variety of fruits but overall my group had an excellent stay and the hotel staff was wonderful especially the reception.

I am always at the Radisson and it gets better. Their services improves after every visit. From check in to check out the stay is enjoyable. The spa, gym, pool it's a place to be wether for business or just a family vacation.

Awesome and friendly staff and very enjoyable stay. From the express check in we got as a group neat rooms and nice view of the pool and the breakfast has been constantly good. Will definitely tell people about radisson vi

it's a very expensive Hotel due to safety concerns but rooms are spacious and having lagoon view  good food but very limited choice for vegetarians buffet is at 9900 nira per person which is good option. courteous and helpful staff

The room view was great and the rooms were clean. With the exception of a few staff, the customer service was generally poor especially of the security and the restaurant staff. Overall I may give it one more chance esp for the view!

Very warm welcoming staffs(Chima).Hospitality of a kind in its uniqueness.  Very comfortable bed. Beautiful pool view and nice comfortable and  Clean room. Always and again. Came in as a group but will visit again with my family and friends

Radisson Blu is a great hotel if you are flying in for a visit. Great services at the front desk. A few challenges I encountered while visiting. Parking is a great challenge here. If there is an occasion at the hotel, You are at the mercy of the security looking for alternative parking for you. The food at the restaurant doesn’t have a lot to pick from they can do better with their menu. Overall it’s a great place and highly recommend.

Review Title: Good place in the heart of Victoria Island
Review Text: Stayed for two nights due to office work. If you have business in Victoria Island this is the place to stay.  Overall nice and unique decorations - really brings out the African culture.  The restaurant is also very nice, with lovely view of the bay.
Review Text

A centrally located hotel in Lagos which has an abundance of friendly staff employed to take care of the guests. Vivian, Abel and Annie are a few names that come to mind instantly, they always had a smile on their face and made breakfast memorable each day i went into that space.  The bars are nice and to make things interesting we have a mobile bar that serves excellent cocktails, my favorite is the Coconut ones they serve.   The hotel room was decent, clean and comfortable beds with the usual TV, facilities, toiletries and bottled water daily. I enjoyed my short stay thoroughly and would recommend for either business or a relaxing break.

The hotel charges top dollar, so the state of the corridors is not acceptable - something is now being done, but the odor and damp in the corridor should never have got to this stage. Check in and check out was very good. I appreciated the attentiveness of the bar staff. Internet connectivity was difficult at times, but it always is in this country.

Review Title: Beautiful place to relax and unwind
Review Text: I was first introduced to radission blu by a family friend and i have been hooked since then. The lagoon view is beautiful. The food is great and my favorite  drink is the kevin signature the staff are all polite friendly and courteous. The rooms and nicely sized and neat. The lobby needs an uplift other than that radission is a beautiful place.

Review Title: Good hotel benefiting from increasing waterway access
Review Text: Modern, secure hotel run by friendly and efficient staff. Ample areas to meet and discuss business. Good restaurants and evening barbecues and appropriate music. Good internet and business facilities. Airy and tasteful common areas. Benefitting from increasing waterway connections from its own pontoon dock .recommended and will use again.

The meals at the restaurant were perfectly done. One thing that impressed me was the spontaneity of reloading the meals. There was a large crowd present but there was no gap in feeding needs. However, I had a very uncomfortable experience as sometime along the line, the air conditioning system failed. It was cooler in the lounge than in the restaurant and I started sweating so seriously I had to use the lavatory.

Had a good experience overall at the Radisson Blu. Great service, very professional. The restaurant/bar met expectations. The location by the water was nice. Rooms were quiet, private, and great. Only complaint was some pollution/smoke coming from outside near the water made it unappealing to be near the pool area.

With its brilliant ocean view rooms, excellent facilities & luxurious ambience, a night at a Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel, VI suite was my choice for a birthday treat for myself in the company of a few friends.  From the Duty manager to the Reception staff, Housekeeping, Bar & Room service, Concierge, everyone exuded warmth & did all they could to make it a truly memorable stay. I was given an upgrade to this amazing exclusive suite fit for a Queen which was decorated with petals. The staff checked on us to make sure we were comfortable & had all we needed,   allowed me a late check out etc etc ...they blew my mind with their hospitality!  Thank you Radisson Blu...will I be back? You bet! Do I recommend? Absolutely!

Review Title: Not the place for chicken suya!
Review Text: Quite an interesting Sunday evening!  We took ice cream at Hans and Rene, then decided to have snacks and drinks in the hotel. A truly unpleasant experience! We ordered chicken suya. It arrived cold. They returned it, probably having microwaved it as the plate was very hot (almost dropped it). It seemed the chicken has been doused in some sort of jerk seasoning and black pepper. Just awful! We complained to the manager that this was inedible and that we wouldn’t pay for it. The burgers we ordered were okish, and the drinks (can’t go wrong) fine. My husband’s fruit salad never arrived, even after reminding them 30 mins later. The manager said he wouldn’t refund us 4,500 naira (about £9) and offered us stewed chicken as take away, which was a pretty ridiculous offer to a customer,

It was a good experience, especially the lagoon view has a relaxing feeling. Your teams are very prompt and always on the look out to assist. Although, we did not swim at the swimming pool nor went on a boat ride, these are must-experience activities during our next visit, I love the design and location. Thank you!

Review Title: Excellent week @ The Radisson Victoria Island
Review Text: My experience at the Radisson Victoria Island. The staff was very warm and responsive from check in to check out. This is probably the most welcoming staff I have seen in about a dozen different countries where I have lodged in the last 5 years. Chima, Vivian Beatrice among others were memorable in their genuine warmth & professionalism. In the few instances where I had a situation that needed resolution, the staff was quick/professional in response.
Review Text

The first time I was attending radiason swimming pool was on 2015: there were 3 sun umbrella. Then, one umbrella was broken, and later also the second one was broken and finally the third one. And they ask you also to pay to stay in the swimming pool same amount of the beginning. When you ask when they replace the sun umbrella, they joke with you, saying next months... We are expat but not stupid people able just to open the wallet. Scandalous!

When you get into the lobby the 1st feeling you experience is that of pyre cleanliness...food is superb! The hotel keeps getting better and better with time. During the visit please pass by the View bar and ask for "Kelvin's cocktail" one of the best I've had in a while...the consistency in taste was the same for 2 days in a row...Highly recommended!  The place to be when in Victoria Island🖒

I came in for a business meeting/ Easter break and I must say the stay was lovely. From check-in to the rooms to breakfast the pool view to check out, everything was fantastic after having long meetings I come down to relax by the pool which gets cool in the evening. The food is good taste like home food. And the staffs are very professional I must commend all of them.

Awesome place to hold your business meetings nice reception attentive service servers at breakfast breakfast is good with nice options and fruits, chester was helpful at check in will come here again .

Fist time in radisson and it exceeded my expectations wonder reception nice view tasty food, name it came in for the Easter celebration and I loved it. Nice rooms comfortable bed, and possibility of late check out free of charge. Was very impressed.

I came in for the Easter break and it was fantastic a weekend of beautiful views nice food music and staffs will surely come back. Chima was particularly nice and always helpful.the pool is beautiful even though I didn’t swim nice to relax just beside it as it get cooler .

My stay is always wonderful at the blu , the view at the terrace is fantastic gets a lil bit hot though. The rooms and neatly arrange and spacious nice size for the price, especially if u get the lagoon view it has a calming effect on you. The meals are tasty and nice but what wins for me is the staff they are friendly polite and very very professional I guess they get extra training for that cause I haven’t seen that in any other hotel in Lagos. Security is superb they even have a bag scanner which means they do not joke with the safety of the guest.

Lovely serene environment that makes you want to just chill and relax.....Excellent customer service from the reception onto the staff in general....Radisson Blu is always my number one spot for a cool weekend getaway with wify.

Radisson blu is my number one choice  in Lagos the view is exquisite the food is fantastic and trust me when I say it's homely everyone is professional, and genuinely  enquire about your stay to see if you need anything to improve the quality of your stay. Chima is very professional and solves issues quickly. Will recommend  radissonblu  vi to travellers looking for a nice clean and serene  place to stay.

Radisson blu is home away from home whenever I am in Lagos for business or leisure. From the reception you get a warm welcome they are very polite and professional,the lagoon view is very relaxing. The rooms are spacious and neat. I recommend this hotel for everyone visiting Lagos I have come here so many times it now feels like home. Chima, Maureen, chikordi, Sheila are always helpful when ever I am around.
Review Text

I stayed in this hotel for  3 Months with my colleagues and we felt like we were at home! The all staff was extremely friendly, helpful and generous.  Our rooms was very clean with a lovely view of the lagoon. There was constant hot water and the room was cleaned to a good standard. Also very useful to have the use of the kettle and fridge. The back up generator started quickly when required.  The gym is has the minimum required to do a complete workout with cardio, machine and free weights. Will be even better when the steam room is fixed. The pool are is clean and a great view to the lagoon.  The food is good; breakfast buffet is excellent and relaxing at the Lagoon bar in the evening is recommended.There is a good selection of local or international food.  Secure as well so

Thank you to the staff and management of the Radisson Blu for making my stay so enjoyable. The staff were always helpful and friendly and nothing I asked for was too much for them to do. The food was of the highest standards and room spacious and very comfortable and it makes you relaxing after long tiring day. I would highly recommend Radisson Blu as the best places to stay in Lagos. Thank you Mr Wellington for taking the time to meet with us your guest you are an amazing leader and that shows as it definitely filtered down to your staff.

Great hotel, excellent location with amazing view of Lagos Lagoon. Outstanding customer service and many more. Nice swimming pool just by the lagoon.  For business travelers flexible late checkout is available. Had an upgrade in  my first stay and the experience with the lady that attended to me at the Reception (Chima) was amazing and indeed memorable.  First time stay and surely will not be the last iSA. Keep it up👌👌👌

Review Title: The Best I Have Stayed At
Review Text: Without doubt one of the favorite hotels I stayed during my time in Lagos! Upon arrival I was warmly welcomed by the staff and general manager, The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and generous.   The restaurant very flexible (appreciate this!) and the restaurant supervisor deserves a special thanks. I had too many great evenings here, which obviously also added up to the experience.   Note, this is 5-star hotel, it is the one truly deserves it. Great location, really pleasant and clean rooms, Atmosphere is so special that it really felt like home to me. A true sample of excellent hospitality!   Thanks for making my visit to Lagos that much better!

Review Title: Quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, anywhere in the world.
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel for 11 days, with my colleagues and I choosing it for its location near to offices we were visiting. And its a Radisson Blu, so you can't go wrong, can you? Oh yes.  My room was non-smoking, but with the obvious underlying scent of cigarette smoke below the cloying air freshener on arrival. This would explain the various burn marks on the furniture as well.  That's OK, I can look past that, as long as the room is clean and comfortable... Well, part of the room the carpet looked as if someone had been murdered there, and they hadn't been 100% successful in cleaning it up. One of my colleagues had some "foreign substance" lodged on the wall next to his WC. Next day it hadn't been cleaned. He put a post-it note on the wall with a big arrow pointing to it.

Review Title: Space for your eyes after a weary day in Lagos
Review Text: After the trafic and the hustle in the streets of Lagos, you come back to a clean room, welcoming staff but most of all, the greatest view to calm you down and put a smile back to your face.  You shouldn't expect much of trade craft but you don't need it as it is compensated by by the willingness of the staff to help you any way they can.  I took it when easy when they had to come back to give me my room towels and found a don't disturb sign that they called me instead, woke me up, to tell me that they needed to give me the towels but can't because if the sign. It was irritating but genuinely they wanted to help.  I won't go for bigger brands and trade it for this hotel that washes my day away.

An oasis of calm. Very welcoming staff especially Maureen when we arrived. Good friendly service from all the staff and an excellent fully equipped suite overlooking the creek. Expensive in comparison to UK but I guess that's the going rate.

Radisson Blu Hotel is a great place to be. The hotel is beautiful and they have got fabulous art work and design all over the place. Vanessa at the bar is wonderful, you can tell by her services that she is passionate about her job. Maureen, Sheila and Chima were really helpful during my stay. Everyone is so nice and professional. I won't forget the meal especially the pepper soup.  if u wanna have the best meal in Nigeria, Please visit Radisson

Radison Blu hotel is a great place to be. I love the view and the atmosphere, staff are always welcoming and very friendly. The rooms are great and clean. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone coming to Lagos! Especially a staff member called Chima and Sheila, they were amazing and always ready to help!

I requested for iron  but the laundry attendant offered to iron my clothes for free and promised to return it in 20mins which he did. I was highly impressed and satisfied  Restaurant service was good,friendly and welcoming. The lady called patience at the restaurant was really patient with me and she is nice. Promise the restaurant staff with the trolley is always smiling. Sheila as well is pleasant  Overall Radisson is excellent
Review Text

The service at Radisson is always Awesome. I always stay at Radisson and bring clients there as well because they are so professional. Wellington, Funmi and Sheila are amazing and always willing to help solve issues fast. Radisson is the best Hotel in Lagos as far as I am concerned

This hotel has a great view - waterfront, good location and good ambience but fall short of customer service and hospitality. I booked four night business class reservation, when I arrived at the hotel they offer three night business class and one night standard room. the offer was rejected - two hours later I'm still without a room. Not a happy customer :(

I have used this hotel twice and both times I had to struggle to secure accommodation for my clients despite the fact that a reservation was made. Another issue I had with them is the issue of few double beds. This option sometimes comes handy, especially during the tight budget. Apart from those, the people are professional and caring while the rooms are large. I have enjoyed a lot of cocktail gigs at their waterfront, use one or more of their multiple events halls

I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms were neat and cozy. The food was nice. The staff were very polite and professional, and they don’t embarrass their guests by begging, as I have witnessed at some other hotels of the same standard.

Everything is superb  I love all the staffs they are all friendly and professional especially the front line staffs Security is much better and stricter now which is very good Maureen and Sheila were exceptional  Radisson Blu keep the flags up

I've been visiting Lagos quite frequently over the past few years and stayed in a few hotels around the island. I have to say its a shame that i never stepped into the Radisson all this time, its an excellent hotel with professional service.  Smooth Check In/Out  Delicious Breakfast Spread with variety of food plus the great atmosphere at the Lagoon Bar.  Great Location, many thanks to Deputy Manager who was so helpful and kind to make my stay more comfortable.  I certainly recommend the hotel and would stay there again and again.

This is a great business hotel. Nice Restaurant and bars, the pool bar is spacious and has great service.  Rooms are good and clean, a nice retreat after a long working day.  Would love to stay at this hotel again.   The staff are really nice, Bola and Vivian at the breakfast room were super.

Review Title: The poorest Radisson Blue I have stayed in
Review Text: I have had the displeasure of staying at the Radisson Blu Anchorage in Lagos twice and both times my experience has been less than happy.  It seems the RB is exploiting the fact that there are not many options available in Lagos and is charging very high rates  (over $350/night),with very average output.  1. The carpets in the corridors and rooms are dirty with stains etc. 2. The corridors have a permanent musty, unpleasant smell 3. towels in the bathrooms are old and have threads coming out 4. the equipment in the gym is old, broken and the weights area is terribly inadequate 5. The in-room dining menu had a mistake which resulted in me not getting the complete food order  Pros: Clean rooms and bathrooms Location and view (lagoon view) is lovely Great swimming pool and outside

i would recommend this hotel to anyone. best breakfast , first class  , friendly and helpful staff , great bar on the pool deck, really clean rooms . Should i be in Lagos again i would definitely stay at Radisson Blu again

Just had the pleasure to stay 6 weeks on the Radisson, it’s well situated at Victoria Island and has its own jetty/bridge. The hotel staff is friendly to the extent of over friendly so it becomes too much after a couple of days, the rooms are nice and spacious, and I was lucky to get one with sea view (lagoon view). The service level is a bit on and off, and you have rather often to chase up people to get something done, that be a waiter, room service, house keeping etc. and check out time can easily take 20min even when you are alone in the reception. Last but not least, the food is a tad expensive and unfortunately not worth the money. So unfortunately mixed feelings about the hotel.  Would I come back...  Hmmmmm, for sure for a beer on the terrace facing the lagoon but to
