Review Text

Best hotel in Lagos  Nice staff, international atmosphere, based in VI (the place to be) close to restaurants and clubs. Its not Europe (hotel is fine) So you have to drive to Where you want to go.  Bo Holm

Review Title: Truly pleasant and friendly hotel staff
Review Text: Made 8 trips to this hotel last year and in all cases it was a pleasant and blissful experience. Of particular is the friendly disposition of staff.  The food and bar are also truly splendid.....plus nothing beats waking up to the stunning view of the Lagoon.

I love radisson blu, I come here every weekend and I love the view the complimentary late check out is something you get only in Radisson. I love the food and the dj that plays every weekend nice place to relax.

Ive stayed in a few places on VI and this as become my current go to (over Eko, four points, federal palace and intercontinental). I stay here every few months on business and its always consistently good. From a work point of view it’s well located on VI for most places and the broadband is decent enough and works on all devices. No silly log in daily to get a code or anything.  No iron or ironing board in the room but they’ll always bring you one.  Service is exemplary with everyone at the hotel friendly, helpful and approachable.  Points off only for food order can be slow (though improved), TVs in the standard rooms are bit outdated now and don’t have HDMI input and gym small.  Rooms are a good size though and air con, shower etc all decent

Review Title: Radison blu home away from home
Review Text: Radisson is a beautiful place , been coming here for one year now and the experience gets better. The sea view is beautiful to wake up to, the food has improved, the staff are very polite and helpful always feels like home.

I came in for the Christmas brunch with my family, the food was fantastic  The ambience was everything. The room was beautiful, spacious and cosy spent just one night with my family will recommend Radisson blu to everybody.

Room view of the water, lovely view to wakeup to. Nice ambience .  Good service, meals are good but not fantastic. Love their pepper snail with chips. And also their strawberry smoothie is the bum!  Nice outdoor lounge by the waterside

Always in Radisson because of the warm welcome we get from the reception to breakfast to room service, everybody is professional and hospitable. Will recommend here to anybody because they have your safety and comfort at heart.

I am always at the Radisson anytime I come to Lagos. The place is fantastic  and all the staff are soo professional it’s a home away from home and I particularly love the view from the lagoon view rooms. And the staff at the reception are always ready to help out I particularly remember chima, Sheila and vannessa from the bar.

Satisfactory reception based on location. However, there is a lot to improve on the House keeping as the room seems to have a funny smell on entering. Also there is no shower curtain, no extra  towel for flexibility.
Review Text

I had a lovely  stay in Radisson, the staffs were very friendly and always willing to help, All my colleagues couldn't stop talking about how friendly and professional they were.it was almost as if i was in a foreign  country. They had a lot of varieties in the buffet and the food was amazing and I was even upgraded to the business class room. Please keep up the good work. There was a particular lady by name sheila that kept checking on how all my colleagues and I were doing and she was very friendly,helpful and attentive. Please keep it up because we will be back to have more seminars in ur meeting rooms and occupy more rooms Keep it up because u people are making me so happy.

I spent this week at the Raddison hotel in Lagos for business. The service f the staff from the start to finish has been exemplary, from check in, to the concierge and security staff. An all around good hotel with good food and nice rooms. A definite recommend!

...that this place is awesome?  Super friendly staff, helpful with luggage and room service.  Restaurant service is a bit slow, but great food and atmosphere.  Secure as well so you feel safe with every night’s rest.

The Lagoon Bar is very beautiful and the service is very fast and staffs are very friendly and professional infact they have excellent  customer service,you always feel at home in Radisson the security is very tight and the Managers Sheila and Funmi were very nice to me. Radisson is a place to be. Thank you all for everything, I promise to be back soon

Cool and serine environment ,awesome  customer service.  Wonderful  buffet. The ambiance  is wonderful. Wi-fi is very fast.  All round pleased with my  stay. Indeed a 5star hotel. Neat rooms. I love the lobby  the art works that adorn the walls are exciting

I was in this hotel to celebrate my birthday with my friends and I was amazed at the kind of excellent services I received. First, I got upgraded to the lagoon view room at no cost, got a surprise cake and wine in my room and room decorated with petals. I was scared of being asked to pay, I called the reception and the lady said the hotel is part of your celebration and I screamed because I have never received this kind ofaddtional services before. Its a lasting memory for me. The desk staff are very friendly, the bar outside excellent especially the seat out also the security checks is also a plus. You are scanned every minute you enter the hotel. My Friends have not stopped talking about their experiences. I will surely visit again.

I was here on Friday to hang out with my friends. It was a night of entertainment with DJ bobby! The service was absolutely fine, friendly staff. I also love their security checks at the entrance. I will visit more often

Its one of the best hotels in Lagos. Good value for money. It is located in the busy Victoria Island and you would like the Ocean view. But be mindful of the chaotic Lagos traffic, which can erupt spontaneously.

For me, as business and luxury traveler, I believe that service makes the difference between a very nice hotel and a memorable hotel. And what truly constitute a great luxury hotel service is what you get at Radisson Blu hotel in Lagos NIGERIA.  Here is why. You’ll get to see the ever ready and available Hotel Manager who is on the premises and not sequestered in her office or focused on office paper work stuff.   She is always out on the floor greeting guests and putting a face on hotel operations. The staff are all Connected, and committed.   Additionally, both management and front-line staffers demonstrate emotional intelligence. They have intuitive people sense, empathy, and genuineness. They have what I call "hospitality personality," which goes further than cheerfulness.

This Radisson branch is a good representation of the brand here in Lagos. A subtle ambience with professional customer service. Daniel at the Voyage Restaurant and Toyo at the Reception were exceptionally great, made me feel so welcome.  Great dish at the Voyage and Breakfast looked great (I skipped) with loads of varieties . By all standards, this is a great hotel but am not sure I will be back due to the competition in Lagos with boutique hotels who offer same services but moderately priced.
Review Text

I visit Radisson whenever I am in Nigeria and trust me From Front Line staffs down to security they are all so good. From my room I could see both the pool and Lagoon. The room was beautiful.  I have told all my friends they should visit Radisson whenever they are in Nigeria. I want to say Thank you to Augustina,Sheila and Maureen they made my stay worthwhile , They were so nice and professional. Thank you Radisson Team for everything

The hotel has a lovely smell. Once you step in, you feel like u are at home because everyone is so welcoming,in fact it's just home away from home and I would really recommend Vanessa for promotion because she was very amazing and professional and the fair lady at the desk was also nice as well I think her name is chela.

Staffs were friendly especially at check in. i love Radisson because of the lagoon view, you can actually sit and chat with friends while listening to music at the Lagoon bar, the staffs were all willingly to help solve ur problem and service is really quick. There was one particular lady that was very helpful and smiles a lot, her name is Sheila. Double thumbs up to you all

The hotel has a nice ambience and all staffs are friendly. Radisson is my home whenever I am in Lagos, services was prompt and the lagoon front is beautiful  The staffs are very professional and friendly especially Maureen, Sheila, Tony.

I am a very busy person and i hardly have time to eat breakfast but suprisingly i was served breakfast in my room for free because i was in a buisness class room. Also the security in the hotel is very tight, bags were were bn scanned and also you have to work through the body scanning machine. staffs were really amazing and the lagoon view is amazing especially at night. keep it up.i will always use Radisson anywere in the world.

Great place to stay for business or pleasure. Get a lagoon view room. Great view from the room. Better from the bar by the lagoon  Very friendly and welcoming staff. And well located for meetings in Ikoyi and Victoria Island

I heard so much about this hotel from my friends I decided to spend the Xmas holiday to give them a trial. To be Honest the staff are  very friendly, professional especially the front desk. Maureen is one lady I will not forget in a hurry and sheila as well. They were amazing. I stayed two nights and the third one was free. The pool side has this special attraction. Infact you will almost forget you have a room but you wouldnt want to leave. I really had value for my money, it worth the trip. Though i didnt use the pool and gym, mayb nextime i will explore more.

Arrived on 30th of Dec.till 4th of Jan.2018.we really  enjoyed to the fullest. The staff most especially the front desk staff was  very friendly & ready to assist.Breakfast should be improved, we ate the same food during our stay. No varieties compare to other hotel breakfast.The business class lounge should be stock with assorted drinks & finger food. Anytime I visit d business class lounge nothing to eat nor drink,only tea & coffee is available.Datz not good for a 5star hotel,compare to other Radisson blu abroad. I recommend a staff with name tag Maureen Double promotion, infact my wife was highly impressed with the she handled our complaint. She performed excellently. Well I recommend Radisson blu as a good hotel.Thanx Guest .

Arrived on Christmas day and had to wait over 2 hours for a room we had booked in August. It appeared as if the hotel was overwhelmed by being fully booked. The housekeeping was below par. Got a towel with strands of hair on two occasions. Toilet bowl and sink had stains. Water from the shower was lukewarm at night and early in the morning. I really expected much more attention to detail from such a beautiful and pricey (~$300 a night) hotel. I would have given an even lower rating if not for the front desk staff and security staff who were really pleasant and helpful. And also its location by the waterfront is quite nice.

Cons: Was sad to realise that the hotel doesn't offer free Wi-Fi at the lobby. At least even if it's for 20  mins especially for customers who are travelling into the country and would want to check an email, VOIP calls or even for emergency situations.  Buffet cuisine wasn't special. It was very pricy and not sumptuous. I'll recommend they look into it.  Pros: Receptionist was very friendly, courteous and professional. The lady with the name tag "Sheila" was soo chatty and helpful. I'll recommend they give her a raise.  Room:   We stayed at the Business Class suit. Pricy but worth it. We had access to the Business Class lounge and our complimentary breakfast was brought to the lounge so we didn't have to go all the way to the restaurant in the ground floor. Our room was very
Review Text

Review Title: Clearly positioned as a "social spot" and hangout with the needs of the actual in house guests a low priority
Review Text: Where do i start .... Was booked for a potentially long business stay - 6 weeks.  First observation - nasty, damp, fetid corridors leading to rooms. Opened the door to a musty, smelly room with poor lighting with quite a few bulbs not working ( maybe to hide the many little mysterious stains on the carpet, upholstery and bed covers). Tried to open windows to air the room and for some fresh air. Windows don't open unless by special request! Had to wait 45 mins for housekeeping to locate the special window opening tool and send someone up. Bathroom was in need of a thorough scrub. The room was too dark, dank and depressing to work in so headed to the executive lounge to work . Even worse . Looked dusty, dark and abandoned with same horrid damp smell . Gave up and went downstairs

Review Title: Good location but hotel needs maintenance
Review Text: The hotel is located in a very good location and the hotel staff are friendly. However, the hotel itself needs an upgrade. The furniture in the hotel lounge and rooms are all stained and worn out. The carpets in the halls are also stained and in teh non-smoking hall, you can still smell smoke. It seems the hotel's management has not invested anything into maintenance and it shows. Also the room service is absolutely horrible. They bring you left overs from the buffet in a way that is obvious and the food is always cold. Compared to other Radisson hotel's I've stayed in in Nairobi, Addis Ababa and Dakar, this one's standard is subpar.

Received the most DISGUSTING and inept service at this hotel, at the hands of one of the security guards, whose name I believe to be Zhinifa (who tried to cover his name tag, when I asked to file a report), Saliu (bar man) and a light skinned porter in a black suit. When asked for the GM, we were told they do not have one. Only to discover via LinkedIn that they do indeed have a GM, Kevin Kamau, who they refused to contact in order to file this report. Shoddy, rude, insanely disrespectful service to paying clients. You couldn’t pay me to return. Someone needs to conduct a hospitality training course at this hotel. If I could rate this place 0 stars, I would. The only saving grace was an incredibly polite security guard by the name of Ibrahim. Unfortunately, he was 1 good Apple

Review Title: Not the best Lagos has to offer
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel for the first time recently and was quite underwhelmed. I have stayed at other hotels in Lagos but none have made such a negative impression as the Radisson Blu. The carpeting and upholstery in the hotel is not clean and the bathrooms leave much to be desired. The dining options are also lackluster. I definitely would not recommend.

1. First the tv in my room was not working, the technician had to changed it three times before he got a working tv. 2. The corridors were filled with a very strong bad smell, this is very disgusting for an hotel of that status. 3. The restaurant carries a menu that they only have 10% of the items available, had to drive out to eat. 4. Checking was a horrible experience, the two front-end staffs in reception were just chatting away and keeping me waiting until I had to beg them before I was attended to. 5. The is a bad representative for the Carlson group of hotels 6. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the lake view by the restaurant and the pool.

I was on a business trip from university and had been booked into this hotel. I'd looked at some reviews which weren't good, but you know what, it's fine. Security good, food ok, people very friendly and whenever there were problems they got sorted.

Had a wonderful time at Radisson! I will always remember my time there! Beautiful scenery, great restaurant, lovely pool to dip in, staff were very friendly meet all my requests. Great place to stay at whenever you in Lagos!

Review Title: My Experience at Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel, Lagos
Review Text: Exceptional Teams Exceptional Services Exceptional Foods / Meals Lovely view from the hotel Effective transportation and well coordinated team of drivers. Exceptional physical and access controls.  Prevention of tail

1st visit to the Radisson Blu Anchorage, Lagos. The staff were all excellent; from the security team to the receptionists, restaurant staff, gym staff and cleaners; polite, professional and always willing to assist day or night. The room was very good. Lagoon view highly recommended.   There was constant hot water and the room was cleaned to a good standard (some minor issues connecting my laptop to the TV).  The Wi-Fi signal was also ok around the entire complex. Also very useful to have the use of the kettle and fridge (there are local shops available to stock up the fridge if required). The back up generator started quickly when required.  The gym is has the minimum required to do a complete workout with cardio, machine and free weights. Will be even better when the steam

Great food and service Staff are attentive and always friendly and professional Gym needs a little refurbishment  Live music could have been better had the artists sang more local music, this considering that most guests appreciated it when they did.
Review Text

Review Title: Is this really a Radisson Blu hotel?
Review Text: A complete disappointment for one of my favourite hotel brands.  Smelly rooms, smelly carpets throughout the hallways, flooding shower recesses, lack of hot water....  I was initially checked into a room which was not cleaned then my replacement room smelled of damp and mould.  This hotel needs a complete overhaul and although I see that previous reviewers have made all these points, management has not addressed these issues.  I will never stay here again.

Review Title: Very Nice Hotel in the Heart of Lagos
Review Text: It was very nice, Stayed at the Business Class Lounge. Had very nice views of Victoria Island. Wonderful room with good beddings. Very nice complimentary breakfast. Staff were very friendly and courteous . I will definitely come back.

Review Title: Visited the outside bar by the lagoon.
Review Text: with my son, we visited to enjoy a smoothie and tea at the deck bar by the lagoon.  the drinks were satisfactory and the prices reasonable particularly in comparison to Eko Hotels.  A major concern is the state of the sofa; very filthy, really grimy like a grease rag in an automobile workshop.  Why can't the management send the sofa covers to the laundry?  It is bad enough that the lagoon stinks like a sewage plant, the furniture in a brand name establishment such as Radisson Blu should not be in that state of neglect.

Cozy, beautiful ambience, the light will inspire you like you are in New York, the live band music plays subtly and the lagoon view with a pool flowing into it is breathtaking, the food and drink just pocket friendly and the staff are well trained, I love this place!!!!

Review Title: Lovely hotel in a busy area
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel for five nights from the 17th to 21st of July on Business. The hotel is very well kept, plenty of food to choose from at breakfast and has a lovely bar area. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Security is tight at this hotel, you are searched in and out and there is a metal detector to ensure you are extra safe. The rooms are large and comfortable. I enjoyed my stay here. Thoroughly recommend the Club anchor sandwiches and treat yourself to some Suya.

Yes, there was a problem with water being brown occasionally and room had some humidity scent on arrival, but things like this is difficult to fight in Nigeria. My hotel stay was really pleasant and staff was extremely polite and helpful, I could notice they went through some really good training which gave results. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lagos, it is really good.

Exceptional service at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Lagos. Excellent customer service, friendly staff, exceptional enviroment, amenities and great location. The breakfast selection had enough variety and quite tasty. The hotel and its environs have excellent cleanliness. I would have liked to have full dstv service to have a wide range of channel selection. Other than that, it was a wonderful experience.

Although i complained to senior management regarding my dissatisfaction with several items nothing was done to accommodate me. Poor room temperature, no towels upon check in waited several hours to receive one pool towel. Water in shower was brown 80% of the time.

Review Title: $500 hold on card never released back to me
Review Text: I regularly stay at the Radisson Blu Anchorage and am yet to have a stay that I would describe as acceptable.  Most recently, I stayed there a month ago. Because my travel agent failed to pay for my room, an advance of $500 hold was put on my card. However, on my second day there (17 Aug) my company confirmed that they had now paid for the room and that the $500 would be released.  Upon check out I paid a small amount for room service and was advised that the remaining amount would automatically be released back onto my card. This wasn't the case. After various follow ups the team at Anchorage has been most unhelpful and unresponsive.   The latest I have heard is that the funds have been released but they're unable to provide any proof of this whatsoever.   I am disappointed,

Usual friendly reception from the Check in Staff and very difficult to fault the hotel or staff they try their best to provide a good service in a challenging environment. A very pleasant and peaceful environment to return to after a hectic day in Lagos.
Review Text

Location of the hotel in VI is really convenient and nice, that would ensure your stay is a quiet on. I really appreciate the security level of the hotel, the well-kept cars to drive you around, the food and wifi connection which is excellent!  Overall, a nice stay compared to other hotels in VI

Review Title: Fabulous location, but some serious problems
Review Text: For CPAP users, its important to note that (in my room anyway) there are no electrical outlets on the bed side of the room. Either bring a battery or be prepared to string a cord across the room to the desk if you are a CPAP user.  The location of this hotel is special among Lagos Hotels. My project bought a ton of hotel nights over the past 3 years in Lagos at various hotels, and none of them had an outdoor seating area like the Radisson Blu by the Lagoon. Its really a perfect place to relax, have a drink, and take in good weather (when the weather is good in Lagos).  The rooms themselves are ok - a little small, the bathroom seems more like a hallway with the amenties than a room. For a couple of nights business stay, its fine. It feels a bit aging, but no deal killer.

lagos was just 1 of many stops for me xmas of 2016 . stayed here for 4 days. I made arrangements with the hotel staff by emails to be picked up from the airport . No 1 was there with a sign up with my name. Call hotel several times only to be transfer from person to person. was not prepared for all the extra phone charges when I got home. I had to take a taxi. hotel is nice but view is not. The river smell and is dirty. Spa was never open . Main reason I choose this hotel was for the spa.  Staff could not tell me why. this hotel is very loud . lots of locals come to party. one night a fight broke out over a parking spot.  Food and entertainment was good . so for this reason I gave them a poor rating rather then terrible

We travelled to Lagos for a Conference in April 2017. Check in for the group went very well. Most of the front desk staff bent over backwards to assist us. The managers on the other hand were never available. I had major issues about placing signage in the form of pull up banners in the reception, which had all been advised in advance.  Good security everywhere at the hotel.   The Conference room is located at the end of a passage that is used as a service way and one would think you would going into the service area. I pointed out that better signage is required as my guests did not know where to go. It really was quite complicated to run a conference at this hotel. Whilst the technician was very good, it was quite difficult to get hold of him when there were issues.  Lunch was

Review Title: Stay at Radisson Blu Anchorage Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed here at several occasions lately and also just now. As such a reasonable good basis for an assessment. For business the best reasons for staying here are probably the security, properly working Wifi and internet connection and a business lounge. Food is seldom something to brag about and services often painfully slow. Check in and out also often painfully slow.

Wonderful weekend getaway...everything was great, from the front desk to the bell hops, even the tech support guys were cordial and helpful. Shout out to Tolu at the front desk, she set the tone for the rest of our stay. Nice job guys. Can't wait for the next visit.

Easily one of the finer hotels is lagos. Generally locates in the north of the island it has access to shopping. Great pool and adequate gym. The bar anf food is a bit pricey but of good quality.  Very secure hotel as well

I was welcomed and well received.  Surprised at the upgrade which I really enjoyed.  Housekeeping was very responsive and replaced the kettle that was not working.  I requested additional tea and creamer which was immediately replaced.

Review Title: Comfortable but in need of refurbishment
Review Text: The hotel is nice and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. Kevin, the GM and his team make you feel right at home. The rooms are evidently in need for some modernization, to get rid of the old carpet in the rooms and tiling in the bathroom.

There was a lack of professionalism that I would expect of a Radisson Blu. My room was not ready despite the fact that I had booked 2 months in advance. I had to wait 2 hours for my room. I also ended up in a room with to double beds, even though the reservation was for one person.
Review Text

Just had a comfortable stay at the Radisson Blu in Lagos.  The room was large, the staff were friendly and helpful and as a result my stay was relaxing. My only negative was that although the gym is well equipped a number of the machines were broken or only partially functional; more maintenance is definitely required.

In the midst of the chaos of Lagos, Radisson Blu gives you a peace of mind and hospitality next to the lagoon, with good food and lots of smiles.  I stayed there in July 2017 for a night for a business trip.    The hotel gives you an opportunity to enjoy food and drinks on the terrace over the lagoon with a great view.  It also has a bakery in its garden, marked within the Top 5 restaurants in Lagos by TripAdvisor.   Rooms are spacious and clean with a lot of light, even though I stayed on a cloudy day.  The wireless worked very well.  With the gym included, I had all I needed within the hotel.

Bathroom drainage system was poorly maintained and caused flooding. The showered overflowed. The aircon is inadequate. The hand basin plug got stuck. the wait staff are slow and unresponsive. I was not impressed and will not return to stay at this hotel for my future business trips The passage leading to the room smells badly and I would recommend that the carpets get ripped out and replaced with tiles.The gym needs an upgrade as of the equipment is not functioning correctly. Overall the service is lacking and needs to be seriously looked. In my view a poorly maintained hotel.

Review Title: The absolute worst hotel customer service ever
Review Text: My friends and ! were at the Radisson Blu for an after work meal one Friday and the guys at the door wouldn't let us in. 3 Women in their 40s, one a mother of boys in their late teens!!! The doorman had the gull to say we should go bring our driver or any man to accompany us in, because their rules stated that escorted ladies should be denied entry. The front desk manager then came to say we could come in, like she was doing us a favor.  Never ever going back there!

Review Title: I have seen the construction of the hotel long time ago. What was my first impressions are The Warm Welcome received
Review Text: Guys if you visit Lagos go to Radisson and ask at the front desk for Virginia with her lovely smile and high quality service for a room with  River View and the when you have breakfast ask for Lydia the hostess who will nicely guide you . Then from this point Virginia and Yemi will fully take care of you. At the bar you should ask for the nice cocktails ask for Victor and Clementine

Review Title: This place is not bad at all!
Review Text: So, do you want in a business hotel?  Good service, good entertainment, good food, nice rooms and wifi that isn't hacked or cause your computer to be hacked.  And you know, the Radisson Blu met all of these requirements.  Most important, I remember the service -- everyone was smiling, willing to help, had answers, provided direction and actually reached out to guests to ask if they needed anything.  Excellent service.  We did a meeting as well at the hotel and all the people, including the security, were consistent in asking if our needs had been met and if there were anything else we required.  The food was fine -- nothing fantastic, but nothing awful and everything was clean.  The view over the lagoon was nice and you just had to look beyond all the flotsam and trash and

I stayed at the Radisonn on business, this is a very secure hotel I guess this is the reason my company offers no other hotels as an option. On arrival cars are searched at closed gates before allowing to proceed into the hotel complex. There is further guest/visitor search at the hotel door, this for me made it a safe place to stay in Lagos. Outside of the excellent security, the hotel is average at best. My room was large (get a Lagoon facing room for a good view) with plenty of storage, but it was very dated in  appearance, the bathroom decoration could have done with a refurb. the towels were old and stained. The wifi was very good in all areas around the hotel. Breakfast was passable but not great, local and european choices on offer. I had dinner on the terrace a couple of

It was a good and enjoyable time with my spouse. A weekend get away from the hassle of family life. I pretty much enjoyed my time there. I will recommend it for leisure and  business for corporate bodies who would like to use the place for conferences as there are lots  of rooms available.

Overall very nice hotel overlooking the lagoon. Nice staff too. The buffet dinner and breakfast also offered by the Hotel are excellent. The gym facilities and swimming pool are also better than those in some other hotels in which I've stayed.

It was very disappointing such that I cancelled my upcoming stay for the 30th of June.  Smelly room and stained bed linen!   I arrived and was shown to my room which had a really nasty musty smell which I highlighted to the porter. He mentioned he would get someone to provide air freshener which never happened. Also in the daylight I had a good look at the bedsheet and was disgusted at the state of the linen. It made my skin crawl.
Review Text

I stayed at the property for over two months and the staff were incredible. Thanks to Chizoba from reservations and a special thanks to Chima from the front desk. She was the most friendliest and kind soul and made my stay much more comfortable. She is a gem and I hope that radisson realizes it! The hotel is located centrally in VI close to the embassies and business area, with views of the lagoon. Excellent security which made me feel really safe, and a relaxed outdoor bar area. The breakfast wasn't all that nice, but the staff were very friendly. The rooms are very comfortable, apart from the fact that the carpets and upholstery are terribly dirty. Service at dinner/breakfast/outdoor area is very slow.

Room good, lovely waterside bar/restaurant. Business meeting rooms adequate. When I returned to my room to shower for dinner I found it had been emptied by housekeeping ! Took them an hour to find my kit. Everything, including my razor, had been put into storage. Apparently housekeeping thought I'd checked out ? Don't expect this sort of confusion in a hotel of this grade.

Review Title: Tired and not the usual Radisson standard
Review Text: I travelled to Lagos for work recently and stayed in the Radisson. This is a secure hotel and the best option it seems on the island. I understand this is Africa and so should visitors. The water that runs from the shower/bath is yellow. The towels are all old and don't match. The hallways smell of damp. The room is average size. Staff all very friendly and welcoming. Restaurants all good and gate guards professional. Just don't think you are getting the usual Radisson standard on the little things.

I have just returned from a business trip to Lagos. This was my very first trip to Nigeria.  Given this was a new county/ city for me; when considering a hotel, I decided upon the Radisson Blu Anchorage purely because  I have stayed at other Radisson hotels across the globe. having had  previously good experiences, this would be a logical choice.   Unfortunately I was   disappointed. The checking in, was professional and quick, the staff been friendly, sharing a smile with everyone, asking me how my flight was, genuinely inquiring of my wellbeing.  However when shown the Room this is where the whole experience turned sour. The Room (on the face of it) was clean airy and well laid out. On closer  inspection, damage to the walls was evident  due to rough handling of baggage and

If you happen to be in Lagos, make sure you dont miss Radisson Sunday brunch. It's a perfect way to spend your Sunday. The food is nice and you will enjoy the atmosphere as well. I'm sure I Will do it again

I stayed at this hotel again upon a visit to Lagos. It is the 3rd time I have stayed but nearly 4 years since my last stay. On the face of it the hotel looks great - food perfect, bar on water front and interior as you expect from Blu hotel. Unfortunately the rooms are poor - they are tired, in need of refurbishment and several things didn't work properly - TV, toilet, shower, pool etc I would expect a better standard at $300 a night. The gym is good but the carpets around the hotel - the bits you don't see are worn, stained and dirty. I would avoid and try another hotel in Victoria Island until it is smarted up!

One of the better hotels in Lagos, thank you. Don't settle for less keep lifting the bar.  It was good to see how you responded positively when the TV did not work, the potter was pro active to call maintainance.

I stayed at the Raddison Blu in Achorage Lagos twice in 2017 and both times I had to change rooms due to a problem with the basin and shower respectively.   The kettle in both my rooms on my recent trip didn't work. A colleague who joined me also had to change rooms because of air conditioning not working.   During both stays I had to phone reception 3 or more times as they forgot to send someone to resolve issues like to remove the previous guest's used tooth brushes left behind, not having towels and to get an in-room dining menu.  I'm very disappointed as this is unlike an Raddison Blu service I've experienced in other countries in Africa or Europe.

Located by the lagoon this is a good business class hotel if you have dealings in Victoria island.  Security measures are very good and areas around are better than any other location in Lagos. Staff is friendly and courteous.Vies of the lagos lagoon is very nice. Internet connection is not so fast but better than most places in Africa.

Review Title: Quality hotel but with some limitations
Review Text: I've stayed here on two occasions this year.  The hotel is convenient for Victoria Island businesses and is located by the creek, which adds character to it compared to many in Lagos.  The terrace bar is excellent and provides good quality bar food as well as live music most evenings, which makes it an ideal place to relax after a day's work.  Once the humidity gets too much, there is also a good bar inside (though a little dark and characterless).  The rooms are good with all the facilities you'd expect, but often the finishing touches are not quite there.  My net curtains looked like they'd been dragged through a hedge.  The decoration can be a bit rough and ready in places.  The towels are truly awful - too small and often an unattractive shade of grey.  The beds are large
Review Text

I booked this hotel because of the Radisson brand name, and boy was it a disappointment!   The good things - centrally located in Victoria Island, spacious room and very good WiFi.   But that was the good stuff. Everything else was awful. The hotel is poorly maintained - the wall mounted mirror fell off one day. Hot water in the bathroom is a matter of luck - varied between "better than lukewarm" and "cool" - but was never hot. Staff are not responsive - they say something will be done in 30 mins and then nothing happens until you follow up. Out of 5 days, housekeeping didn't bother replacing coffee sachets on 3 days!  And this could be trivial - but I found it annoying. I wanted to settle my bills the previous evening around 830 pm, for an early morning checkout. However, the

This was about my forth stay over 2 years and I am most likely to return. Location is great, by the Lagoon which I really like very much. Food is good though rather pricy. Staff are excellent. Great access to Many different places and locations in Victoria Island, Lagos Island and Ikoyi.

I had high expectations while booking this hotel but was disappointed with the infrastructure in the hotel. The Internet is cumber some to log into. The room looks regular like any other much cheaper hotel in Lagos. But shockingly the television is of the 80s.. with scratches all over and remote control that does not work. I waited for several minutes before they could come to change the disfunctional remote. The telephone also does not have tone. Very difficult to communicate. The safety box also does not work. It was very frustrating trying in vain to set it up,  though they had to chance it the next day when I didn't have any need for it.

I was first upgraded to a very large suite because they were overbooked which was nice, however, the door to the room was in the stairwell which I found very odd, wifi did not reach to the room (I was there for business), the phones worked sporadically, the room was freezing and I could not figure out how to alter it, and neither of the bedside lamps worked in an otherwise extremely dim room. Due to these issues I changed rooms to a standard room but when I arrived after work, my bag was not there as promised, nor were there any towels in the room at all (and all I wanted was to shower).   With all of these issues, the service was just not acceptable, though the staff are all nice. Unfortunately niceness doesn't make up for lack of amenities in the rooms.

Lovely location on the lagoon with a great bar. Lobby is very nicely designed and decorated.   Food is blah to blech to worse. Room had brown water coming from the tap and a nasty orange stain on the very old rug. Safe completely broken.

My stay in your hostel was very ok,but you need to change the floors from carpet to wooding floor or hard floors the carpet has to go inside the rooms and the hall ways. The carpet her bad in the rooms and hall ways.

I recommend a staff of radisson blu Lagos to higher grade. She made my stay memorable during my stay @ d hotel. Shez One of d best staff & Fantastic staff. Her name is Maureen Chinenye.she resolved an issue within 4 Mins. Will visit d hotel again during my visit to the area, coz of Maureen. Kudos to her.

Regular client of the hotel, can see every year that they struggle to maintain the quality of the hotel...stains on carpet were already there last year, cleanness, missing tiles in the pool, polluted and smelly lagoon, could not open sink in the bathroom,  erratic lifts, etc. Would not recommend unless upgrade. Other options are available in Lagos for less money. Provided feedback and got a bottle of wine and fruits but not sure they got my points.

We spent four days in Lagos recently and stayed at the Radisson Blu which we were expecting to be fairly good.  On arrival our room was not ready which was a little frustrating as we had been travelling for 19 hours and just wanted a shower and a rest but understood that with late check outs etc these things happen.  The room was adequate but seemed a little shabby, there was a coffee machine with no coffee capsules and when we requested these they never appeared.  The towels were not changed at all during our four day stay and we had to keep asking for extra soaps (only one was ever provided).  We ate a few times on the terrace which is a very nice area and the food was excellent.  On one evening of our stay we ordered steaks and after an hour asked where our food was, one

I have stayed at this hotel severally over the last one year and the experience just keeps getting better and better! The staff are very warm and ensure that any issues are addressed promptly.The GM will go to whatever lengths to take care of his guests and that kind of leadership really counts.its safe to says to say this is home away from home! Kudos to the team!
Review Text

We had a series of board meetings at the hotel. Facilities were great. Would recommend using the bar menu for food (club sandwiches, burgers, etc) and then perhaps going out for at least one meal. Staff were very accommodating and the experience was smoothly rolled out, including billing and room allocations.

After several trips to Lagos, I stayed there for the first time a few days ago. We all know that hotels in West Africa (and Lagos in particular) are crazily expensive but this one goes beyond any logic. For the price you pay (around 350$ per night) you would not expect to enter your room, realise there are no towels and then having to wait for 4 hours (and 5 kind reminders!) before I actually got them. Besides this, you are asked 50% of the price of the room (please make the calculation) for an early check in (2 hours!!!). After a long night flight and for the price you pay, a slightly higher flexibility would have been appreciated, considering that hotel was half-empty. Rooms are quite spacious and quiet (a big plus for Lagos!), bathrooms start to be outdated and will soon need

Excellent customer care, passionate and courteous staffing, comfortable ambiance, delicious meals, romantic pool, fascinating environment for both kids and adults, fast and speedy room services, accessible location, comfortable room cooling system, good value for money.

Review Title: Good hotel to stay even for long periods
Review Text: Overall a good experience for my two week stay in that hotel. Food menu in the restaurant is very limited, hence make sure you'll eat outside as much as you can. What made it for me was the staff. They were absolutely excellent throughout the whole time. Rooms could have been a bit cleaner but overall it was a good experience.

I was in Nigeria recently and Went for brunch at this hotel with family and friends. Let's say that I was really impressed with the selection of food and service at the hotel. The food was so nice and the staff were very professional. The scenery outside was so beautiful and picture perfect. Will definitely visit again when I am in Nigeria.

Hotel is in a good location. Boat access.  Rooms are clean and well maintained. Food selection was good with ample portions  at a reasonable cost. Hotel Area is secure and comfortable.  Hotel offers trainer for fitness and workouts.

I often stay at Radisson Blu for business meetings, the staff is very nice and helpful. They are always ready to help and find a solution for any little problem. Rooms are clean and the position of the hotel very strategic.

I  was expecting woow since they won Tripadvisor award but l still feel short changed, maybe l should try it out when its not peak period.  The rooms were ok but l think housekeeping can do better, sometimes they would put one tablet of soap and on other days 2.  Never try to order room service we tried to get food and ice for our drinks and it took 2 hours Shola was on duty that day, The live band makes it lively, l really enjoyed it and the restaurant really tries, well done James, Emmanuel and the lady who was doing eggs on Easter monday, well done girl, she was so much under pressure but kept smiling.  Kunle kept the drinks coming when we sat outside.  Then try getting towels for swimming, the gym will tell you we don't have, she doesnt bother calling housekeeping.  So first

The first time I was attending radiason swimming pool was on 2015: there were 3 sun umbrella. Then, one umbrella was broken, and later also the second one was broken. Actually there is just one sun umbrella (broken) available in the swimming pool, and it is impossible to stay without. And they ask you also to pay to addend swimming pool... Scandalous!

Great location for business travellers with a well balanced atmosphere of business and pleasure. Rooms are very cozy and the waterfront very relaxing. and make sure you do not miss the "Lagos Sunset" cocktail on arrival.
Review Text

Was my first time at this hotel, visiting early in Feb 2017. It is easy to be critical of the service of hotels in Lagos, especially looking at they prices they charge. But this stands out as my worst hotel experience of any business trip over the past four years. This is why: 1) Arrived on the Monday evening with several colleagues, to find that they had booked me into a smoking room. It is a clear preference with our corporate travel agent (and I travel often), yet the hotel proceeded to blame this on the travel agent and refused to take any responsibility.  2) They claimed the hotel was full and could not move me until the next day. The smell of smoke in the room was disgusting. 3) They finally managed to move me the next day (of course I still had to pay for the stinking

Review Title: Terrible experience (s)-Jeans stolen during a 8-hour stay and 3 room changes!
Review Text: I checked into the hotel at about 21.00 hours and had to leave by 05.00 hours the next day for Abuja. I changed the jeans I wore to travel and kept it in closest. On getting to my hotel in Abuja, I found I did not pack my jeans. Returning to the hotel four days later for a 3 night stay, I reported the missing item at check in and followed up many times but was passed around from one staff to the other. I promised to alert other prospective guests so that they beware. During an earlier stay, I had the terrible experience of having 3 room changes for a 4 day stay, owing to bad facilities in the rooms. That's it for me.

So, let me start my review with the only negative I have, check in was slow eventhough there weren't traffic of guest. It was like they were struggling with something. Anyway after check in everything else was great! I stayed at this hotel for 3 night for work. The hotel is centrally located on the Island. I was welcomed with a chilled drink whilst I waited for check in. I stayed on the second floor with the city view. If you want the sea view, it cost more. The staff were very courteous and polite, obviously well training. The breakfast buffet was good. My room was big and bed was very comfortable. I have stayed in other Radddison Brands, even though this one doesn't come close, I will still recommend it.
Author Location: New York, New York, United States

Review Text: Very relaxing after a hard days work. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Good location in Lagos. Rooms were kept cool during the hot weather and were very spacious and mostly clean. Would recommend for a comfortable stay.

Stayed at this hotel a couple of times but this was the very worst experience ever. Room lodged in was badly stinking and requested to be moved and the second wasn't any better. This is the first 4* hotel that offered buckets of brown water to shower as no water running. While I have business meetings during the days. This occurred for 2 consecutive days. In my opinion, this is a 1* hotel now and should not be regarded above 3*. Pls be warned.....

This hotel has to be put in context - it is a respite from the chaos outside of its gates, however nowhere near the standards I would expect from a property of this brand and with this price tag: - I liked the breakfast. There was enough to choose from and the staff was helpful and fast. - The size of the room and bathroom is quite good. - Internet connection worked well for me. - If you book a room with the lagoon view, you do get a nice view but also a lot of noise - the outside bar is open till 2 am, if I remember well, and it is impossible to sleep without earplugs. - It is clear that the hotel is cleaned regularly, however I still saw stains on the bed linen and hair in the bathroom (from the length and colour I definitely know it was not my hair). - Corridors smell of

Stayed for two weeks and would have given five stars but for the service at The Surface Bar & and Grill which was more often than not a let down  What I liked - Fast check-in without too much paperwork  - The mobile app - has a very comprehensive view of the hotel and all services including detailed restaurant menus; I tried the app to set up a wake up call and it was spot on! Worked like Swiss clock work. 5 stars for the mobile app alone! Menu prices in the app need to be updated.  - The Voyage restaurant staff are excellent! From the hostesses at the door to the chefs at the egg station and all the wait staff, service was efficient and effective. I was pleasantly surprised when Lovely greeted me by name one morning! I commend the team effort but Bola, Temi and Lovely stand out

Ok i won't go on about my previous stays, brown water coming through the system is one thing but when you try shower or wash and the water is lukewarm at best, there's a limit, reported temperature three times but it was never solved, lots of lip service, the rooms stink of dampness ( tried a couple) and the hall carpet is disgusting. Rather stay elsewhere, which is such a pity because i work right opposite, i suppose i will have to stay elsewhere in future

Our visit to Radisson blue Anchorage Hotel was exciting, memorable and relaxing. There is much to commend with regard to the lagoon waterfront location of the facility which offers a scenic enjoyment to guests and patrons. Reception was good. Staff were ready to offer assistance with all politeness. Hotel enjoys great patronage with noticeable number of guests. Recommended as we were well satisfied all through our visit!

I spent a week here for business and the point is best to not compare this hotel to normal western life. In Africa this is a great place to stay but be aware that you will not be in a normal situation.  For a start  there are issues with the electricity I found myself stuck in the lift in darkness and my room was plunged into darkness many times. This is normal. The service is slow. The food is average The staff though are awesome just ask for help and they are so happy to sort things  In my stay my TV  didn't work and staff tried to help but reality is there maybe many reasons as to why things aren't perfect . The breakfast was excellent throughout Be prepared for bomb checks when you arrive  Good thing is that security is of paramount importance so feel safe, enjoy the
Review Text

Review Title: This is a rating for the restaurant...
Review Text: Radisson seems to be falling from Grace...   I'm typing this review while I'm at the restaurant having a buffet dinner; there's little to no variety and there are many empty food points which don't get replaced until you prompt a waiter. The desserts are sub par; to be fair this isn't unique to radisson.  As I am not staying at the hotel and have come here to have a nice buffet dinner. I leave hungry and very unsatisfied and feeling out of pocket...  Please bring back the old Radisson...

My first trip to Lagos and I didn't have any expectation or knowledge from Lagos before.  Hotel location beside  the main road and the river on the other side.  Hotel security was very good and we felt safety was ensured at all time.   The food was excellent with good services.  Rooms were clean but outdated style. Shower impossible to use , due to extremely hot water. This has been pointed out several times the last years and amazing that they do not get sorted this out.

I and two of my colleagues recently returned from spend a week at this Hotel.  They have exceptional staff. Virginia on the front desk, set the standards. Polities, efficient, helpful she is an excellent ambassador for the hotel.  As where all the staff.  The rooms were clean and the wi-fi excellent. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anybody.

Review Title: A go to stay for Lagos
Review Text: As usual no complaints!  This hotel unlike others is the right size for Lagos!  Good food, very comfortable rooms and friendly staff. It is reasonably well located but all hotels face the morning and evening  traffic issue.  The hotel car service is not overly priced and given the association with Sixt a pickup at the airport works well.

I was here on a business trip. The hotel is not too far from the airport, service is goo, food is nice, rooms are good too. The breakfast is quite nice, with a good variety of food fir all tastes. The rooms are reasonable size, clean an tidy. The staff are friendly and always happy to assist. Overall good value fir money.

A let down. Radison Blue was always a prestigious name with swell hotels. This hotel is however old and past its glory days. Everything is clean and work with average service. The carpet runner in the hallway past my room is old and worn at places and it is a long time since I have seen a carpet with so many stains from end to end. It is OK for short stays however is not on my bucket list to spend a long period or holiday.

Radisson Blu experience was a delightful and very memorable one both times I visited.   First was a 2 night stay which was awesome. The room was very neat, bathroom lovely and the breakfast buffet was simply great.   The second visit was even more memorable as I chose the Surface Bar as the location to propose to my fiancé on Dec 24 2016, Christmas eve. The experience was phenomenal. Special thanks to Lola (in particular) and the rest of her team as they made sure the execution of what we planned was spot on.  Surely a place I'd love to come back to often.

The shower had one temperature. HOT...too hot...scolding...I eventually gave up asking them to fix it.. On the bright side, the beer was ice cold. The food was excellent, and the room (shower aside) was really comfortable.   On the whole I would definitely recommend this property. It is a typically good Radisson Hotel, and in Lagos, there aren't too many places that will be better.

Review Title: Nice view, below expected standard -   But do not eat at the bar!!
Review Text: Good security. Relative good check in experience, staff respected gold status. Nice location of the bar. However, do not eat any food there ! Not sure if I'll maintain the burger tonight ?! Rooms are relative nice. Try to get a river view room. Feeling hesitant if Four Point would have been the better option. But probably my last stay here.

Review Title: Clean, comfortable but not the standard I would expect
Review Text: Travelling due to work, we stayed here and sadly it was not up to what I come to expect from a Raddison. The rooms were superficially clean, but very tired and in need of investment. The food was average - bland and menu not up to scratch. Breakfast was average as the did not replenish dishes when they ran out. I asked them to replace something and I was still waiting 20 minutes later and had to leave. Disappointing.
Review Text

Visited Radisson Blu yesterday evening for New Year eve celebrations. Great property with amazing views of Bay. Had it not been for the TERRIBLE food, the evening would have been outstanding. The menu had very limited options to chose from. Whatever was stated was stock out or unavailable for Veg Options. For almost 4 hours they kept taking one or other order but delivered none- some of them being soup, sandwich and burger. The manager was not around to take the feedback. The staff however was professional. Kept apolosising. Drinks were good though.   Wont ever Visit again solely for food or dinner.

Review Title: Never trust whatever you are promised in this hotel....
Review Text: I visited the hotel on the 17th of Dec to make inquiries and ended up making a booking for a standard room with a lagoon view for a 3nights Christmas stay with my family. As part of my inquiry & booking i asked for a roller bed which Stella confirmed the hotel will provide. On 24th Dec, i arrived the hotel at about 8:30AM for an early check in but Victor (the receptionist) advised that i comeback by 2pm else i pay 50% a day cost for early check-in. I requested for a room with a double bed + a roller bed again and he promised these will be available for me at check in. I finally arrived the hotel at about 3.30PM with my family and [1] there was no room with a double bed [2] there was no roller bed however Tolu with the intervention of Victor (both receptionists) promised that

Review Title: Great location and nice rooms however not the standard that you expect for a Raddison Blu
Review Text: I have stayed at many Raddison Blu Hotels, Senegal, South Africa, USA, Canada, UK and this Raddison Blu just doesnt feel like one based on the service that you are given.  Its a beautiful hotel and the rooms are modern, clean and large however I have now stayed at this hotel three times since visiting Lagos and I am not sure that I will stay again.  The first stay I had a room that was extremely noisy right beside where housekeeping kept their supplies.  The second time I was given a room that was full of mould and it was so damp I had to ask to move.  The last stay which was for 5 days I had a room with no hot water.  I had a shower every day that was cold. I informed the hotel and everyday I was told that someone was going to come and fix the problem and no-one ever did, so I

I am currently at the Radisson Blu in Lagos. I have had an absolutely fantastic Stay. First I got an upgrade when they found out it was to be my Honeymoon - the entire hotel staff has been absolutely amazing.   A receptionist (Sheila) met us as we checked in told us we would have a few mins delay and offered us Drinks on the house. It wasn't about the drinks - but the warmness and clear attention to your needs.  We walked into a room well made with rose petals all over, bottles of wine, swans on the bed and a personalised note to I and my Wife - it was absolutely breathtaking.  The manager called us to ask if there was anything they could do to make our stay more pleasurable; they had someone come over to check on us - there was so much attention to prove they knew we were in

The dinner buffet is on point plus the platform of the ambiance of savouring these delicacies by the lagoon side with serenading music in the cool evening breeze. Unparalleled experience. You should try it if you are in Lagos, Nigeria.

Great evening atmosphere on the river side deck. Good food and wine. Felt safe and enjoyed the week. Hotel is clean. Conference facilities are good and our delegates enjoyed the buffet lunch and overall conference experience.

Excellent location, peace of tranquillity in the caotic Lagos. Very good combination of efficiency and exotic atmosphere. Unfortunately the pool was unavailable. Even the rooms at the road side are very silent, except the one near the corridor door a the floor because of guests opening the door at all times.

overall, Its a good hotel. Good Food and good ambiance. Just needs hot water pressure for the shower and the corridor carpet had a musky smell, maybe it needed a good clean. Great reception though and Staff.

Good place to stay and Eat. One of the safest place in Nigeria to be at. Offers scenic beauty . The boats on the banks add to beauty. Rooms are clean and spacious and excellent hospitality. Slightly on heavier side of pocket than average hotel in Lagos

Visited the hotel and restaurant with a view to using this as a permanent accommodation for incoming overseas staff , hotel is clean and well kept but the service in the restaurant was disgraceful . We checked the menus online but when arriving the prices had been lifted by 50% , when the so called manager - Soyo - was asked to honour what was online he was not interested . The waiting staff got all drinks orders wrong , failed to bring the correct amounts and of the 6 meals ordered , 3 came after 45 minutes a further 2 15 minutes later and the final 1 after all other meals had be consumed. If you are looking for a hospitable hotel that will cater for your needs then I'm afraid the Radisson Blu is not the best choice.
Review Text

Visited Radisson Blu yesterday evening for New Year eve celebrations. Great property with amazing views of Bay. Had it not been for the TERRIBLE food, the evening would have been outstanding. The menu had very limited options to chose from. Whatever was stated was stock out or unavailable for Veg Options. For almost 4 hours they kept taking one or other order but delivered none- some of them being soup, sandwich and burger. The manager was not around to take the feedback. The staff however was professional. Kept apolosising. Drinks were good though.   Wont ever Visit again solely for food or dinner.

Review Title: Never trust whatever you are promised in this hotel....
Review Text: I visited the hotel on the 17th of Dec to make inquiries and ended up making a booking for a standard room with a lagoon view for a 3nights Christmas stay with my family. As part of my inquiry & booking i asked for a roller bed which Stella confirmed the hotel will provide. On 24th Dec, i arrived the hotel at about 8:30AM for an early check in but Victor (the receptionist) advised that i comeback by 2pm else i pay 50% a day cost for early check-in. I requested for a room with a double bed + a roller bed again and he promised these will be available for me at check in. I finally arrived the hotel at about 3.30PM with my family and [1] there was no room with a double bed [2] there was no roller bed however Tolu with the intervention of Victor (both receptionists) promised that

Review Title: Great location and nice rooms however not the standard that you expect for a Raddison Blu
Review Text: I have stayed at many Raddison Blu Hotels, Senegal, South Africa, USA, Canada, UK and this Raddison Blu just doesnt feel like one based on the service that you are given.  Its a beautiful hotel and the rooms are modern, clean and large however I have now stayed at this hotel three times since visiting Lagos and I am not sure that I will stay again.  The first stay I had a room that was extremely noisy right beside where housekeeping kept their supplies.  The second time I was given a room that was full of mould and it was so damp I had to ask to move.  The last stay which was for 5 days I had a room with no hot water.  I had a shower every day that was cold. I informed the hotel and everyday I was told that someone was going to come and fix the problem and no-one ever did, so I

I am currently at the Radisson Blu in Lagos. I have had an absolutely fantastic Stay. First I got an upgrade when they found out it was to be my Honeymoon - the entire hotel staff has been absolutely amazing.   A receptionist (Sheila) met us as we checked in told us we would have a few mins delay and offered us Drinks on the house. It wasn't about the drinks - but the warmness and clear attention to your needs.  We walked into a room well made with rose petals all over, bottles of wine, swans on the bed and a personalised note to I and my Wife - it was absolutely breathtaking.  The manager called us to ask if there was anything they could do to make our stay more pleasurable; they had someone come over to check on us - there was so much attention to prove they knew we were in

Review Text

Review Title: Looks good but not real value
Review Text: Firstly, all the staff I encountered were very friendly and efficient.  They are let down however by the hotel.  During a 4 night stay there was no hot water in any of the rooms, I had steak for dinner one night that was the toughest I have probably ever eaten and their mark up on a small beer borders on outrageous.

Aside the catering services and courteous staff, there was hardly anything the justify the huge rates I paid. I had selected the hotel on my own hoping that the high rate meant top quality services and high standards. I found the poor housekeeping standard shocking!Old bathroom towels, smelly corridors and rooms (probably from the rugs), etc

Review Title: A Slice of Paradise in Lagos
Review Text: This is a beautiful place to stay; ambience is awesome and Staff are very friendly and homely.  Nice restaurant with meals you will not forget in a hurry and side bar by the lagoon. The view is second to none. You cannot help but feel like you have cut a slice of  paradise.

The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean. The breakfast buffet was good but not great. Room service was fair but far from good. My complaints about the water temperature and food quality from room service went unresolved. The internet speed was very good and reliable.

Always a pleasure to stay here, the hotel staff are service orientated which makes for a change in Nigeria. The food was good, and the coffee at breakfast was very good, this makes  me very happy in the morning. Room is clean, bed is comfy, shower was hot. I like the length of the pool, at least one can put in some decent alps to get a workout.

The hotel is nice with a friendly staff. Bar and the lounge area is also good. it comes with a nice breakfast.  Room is ok. TV has good selections and I like that you have both shower and bathtub in the bath room.   Easy hotel on the V Island.

I stayed here about 3 years earlier.  There had been some noticeable improvements.  The last time I was there the aircon in the lobby area was extremely loud and the rumble could be heard in the room all night long.  This seems to have been fixed and I enjoyed my stay so much more.  The rooms are a good size with large bathroom containing both shower and separate bath, and very comfortable.  Great to have dinner overlooking the inlet each night.  Service was exceptional.  Some of the best service that I've had at any hotel anywhere.  The staff made my stay a very comfortable one.

The views at night are amazing from the outdoor terrace bar. I watched in fascination as a brightly lit tourist boat went by twice. There's always something to look at.  There are comfy sofas at the front of the terrace but none were free when we arrived. We therefore sat at a table - and the chairs were more comfortable than they looked.   Unlike other establishments there were no issues with taking a small child into this outdoor terrace.  Staff aren't as friendly and helpful here as at some other establishments but this is made up for by the location.

Hotel's location is very convenient to commute to any part of Lagos. It has the best view of the Lagoon, and the service is warm and good. However, the hotel has to upgrade its furniture in the rooms and the TV most essentially. It would be nice if they add more channels for the foreign visitors.

i alwys go to the same hotel despite the average food in taste and in diversity despite the bad smell of the lagoon despite the bathrooms which sometimes lack hot water and with taps only God knows how to adjust the lights also...sometimes you might need a phd to understand how to turn them all on or off after a lot of staying i finally understood how to deal with the AC...  but they are two things that still makes it worth the stay for me: the sofa at the window side and the very warm and nice staff
Review Text

Great internet connectivity for multiple devices in the comfort of your room, without additional charges - wow! Service was very friendly and efficient. The rooms, however, had a bit of moisture... Breakfast was fine. All in all, a very pleasant stay!

I took my cousin out as she's in town for a few days. We went to Radisson and one of the things we ordered were chicken wings. They tasted so bad, a little stale, cooked in tomato sauce, no flavor and cost N5,000 for 5 pieces.   We told the waiter all this and told him to tell management yet he proceeds to process the bill without any effort to speak to a manager. For the caliber of the hotel I think that's extremely poor service. I would return because the ambience is nice overall but perhaps only for drinks.

In deed a very good establishment with seasoned professionals staffing every post. I have stayed in most 5* Lagos hotels and find this Radisson to be the best. Security is great, the staff is polite, the offering is up to par.

I held a meeting at this hotel liked the outlook, but the room was poor for the charges I paid for N88,000 per night. Especially the showering unit is poorly designed and the towers are poor infact looks old and some what dirty.

The Radisson Blu Anchorage Hôtel in Lagos, Nigeria is "Top Notch." The employees at the Radisson Blu are pleasant, approachable, and have a "Yes I Can..." attitude. security is well trained, apparent and taken seriously. I highly recommend the Radisson Blu for your next Workshop/Event. Lagos is an enjoyable city. The deck lounge and pool area includes live music and is a great way to relax and end the day.

The hotel has very efficient and courteous staff. Services are generally very good. The surface grill and bar with the lagoon view, is a wonderful experience at night.  This is a wonderful hotel, and I recommend it to anyone who will be in Lagos for either business or pleasure

Review Title: Nice hotel and good customer service but a bit slow with requests
Review Text: My main review today is about the Sunday breakfast brunch. ; my aunt and I stayed at the hotel for a couple of days on the 3rd floor precisely and we noticed a big smell from the hall way carpets ; also she had had a running tummy for almost 7 days so I thought it was something she ate until I ate some mushrooms on the Sunday and as I speak. Been very very unwell. Which was exactly the symptoms she went through and had to go through some antibiotics and she was ok again.

I have a nice and fulfilled stay at Radisson Blu. keep up your performance, you staff are very hospitable right from the gateman to other staffs. keep it up. the security network was fantastic and your meals are very fine, it was an exciting moment at your hotel. you need to review you channel list number on your information desk in the room to correspond with the channel.

Review Title: Review of Radisson Blu Anchorage, Lagos, Nigeria
Review Text: Radisson Blu Anchorage hotel Lagos, located at the heart of Lagos Island, at Ozumba Mbadiwe Street.  The front desk staff were excellent in their customer service - I spent between 5-10 minutes and I was checked in.  Room service was also good with prompt response to requests.  The electrical systems all worked throughout my stay.  I have been here before and will highly recommend the hotel to anyone who will be in the Lagos Island.

Review Title: So loving the VI Radisson Experince...
Review Text: I love water front view,ambiance and great customer service from the security to the check in. Located in the center of Victoria Island Lagos.. so in-between getting to Lagos mainland and the island extensions...
Review Text

Review Title: Awesome Cappuccino, not so good Showers
Review Text: Lovely view of the Lagoon, peaceful hotel (unless you have noisy neighbors) especially after a long day in Lagos traffic. Highly recommend the cappuccino at breakfast! The staff are courteous and quite efficient. My favorite place to stay in Lagos. The showers can be irritating at times and some of the TV channels don't show but on the whole a lovely experience

Raddison Blu Anchorage is simply a stunning hotel.  The rooms, hallways, lobby, restaurants -- all make for a beautiful space and location.  The staff was super helpful and friendly.  My only complaint would be my dining experience.  Like most hotels in Nigeria, they charge way too much for food that is just okay.  It is not bad, just not worth the cost of what you have to pay.  You can walk 2 minutes away to a restaurant and get the same quality of food for about 1/4 of the price.

The cost of your services and lodgement is on the high side. It would be nice if you could bring down your cost or give special offers and complimentary gifts. Also give full details during checking in  a guest on services/items that are free/complimentary and those that are not

Good service by staff but price for room is not value for money compared to same hotel providing same service.The smell in the room really knocks me off completely when thinking of staying in room than outside

Workers seemed demotivated and did not care for customer service, they tried to avoid attending to me because they were about to change shift and were even passing me around. I spent a long time waiting for them to attend to me and someone finally did grudgingly. The rooms are poorly maintained when compared to what they used to be, the air was very damp, they refused to bring up towels to my room and only did about 5 hours after I checked in - only when I called several times and finally angrily called the hotel manager.

The experience was totally disappointment considering the expectation. The initial room assigned had an awful smell and no freshness even for the eventual room taken.  However the Lagoon view was amazing and the Jollof Rice with snail was heavenly. Polite employees and speed of response is commendable.

I stayed here for 2 nights in October 2016 having stayed there previously about 7 years ago when it first opened.  A beautifully appointed hotel in an excellent 7 convenienet location. Well trained friendly and efficient staff. Any minor problems were dealt with quickly and efficiently. Definitely my best hotel experience on VI, Lagos in all the years travelling there. In fact probably my best experience in Nigeria so far.   I will be hosting some VIP guests in Lagos soon and will be booking all of them into the Radisson Blu.

I have stayed over 50 nights in this hotel and over 50% of the mornings there was no hot water to shower.  The hotel management and team consistently acted surprised when they were told, even though I and other colleagues told them multiple times oper week over a period of 6 months.

Review Title: Great Location in Lagos to Stay
Review Text: Stayed 3 nights at the hotel for business meetings held in the conferencing facilities of the hotel, with multiple delegates also staying. The rooms were very nice clean, tidy and spacious.  The hotel is stylish clean tidy and airy.  Great location next to the river.  Internet is quick and reliable.  the food choices are good and varied and I had an excellent steak in the outdoor bar which over looks the river.  There was live entertainment on the terrace bar in the evenings too which was a nice addition and not obtrusive.    The hotel is very secure if you are concerned about security and unlike some Lagos hotels there is good control of who can come and go from the premises.  More impressive was how helpful and friendly the staff were throughout the hotel, always greeted with

Good hotel with cleanliness, excellent service.  Need to do the following to enhance customer stay experience: 1. add more variety of vegetarian food. 2. Improve the quality of pillows. 3. Increase water pressure from the shower.
Review Text

Been coming to Lagos on business for 20 years and have tried a few hotels. Nigerians generally give good service so no worries there and this hotel has an outside deck onto water with a bar some live music occasionally with restaurant in or outside. Room was clean although some exposed wiring and water pressure quite low but I liked this hotel and will definitely make it my preferred choice, it's the right side of the bridge to get in to see business clients without hours of traffic so if you travel to VI on business probably a much better choice than the in my impression over rated Southern Sun.

A Wednesday evening at the Radisson Blu Anchorage exploded as Prudential Sound gave us some very entertaining and very musical entertainment. An eclectic repertoire of popular songs ranging from Sinatra to eighties pop was enjoyed by many, soulfully delivered by a passionate vocalist, smooth sax, banging bongos, guitar and keyboard. Well done guys!

I will rate the hotel 8. The entertainment was very poor. The television is not audible, the pictures ceases. It hangs. My experience in this regard was disastrous. I believe this can be improved. Thank you.

I'm not satisfied with food variety specially on the vegetarian space. The buffet was average and three days I felt that the juice became rancid (probably the same was served prepared on the previous day) which is not good for health! The wi- fi was excellent and the location is also very good . One can really relax in the evening time.

Nice architecture (Interior and exterior). Really cool sculptures. In general good service. People inside the hotel are quite friendly and try to help when needed. The rate per night is quite expensive...

I love Lagos ... Bustling and brimming with energy and life ... But in general the service / hospitality sector in Lagos needs to work on actually living up to the word 'service'.   So I was really pleasantly surprised with the great service and hospitality I got at Radisson Blu. My first time to stay there ... I usually stay at another 5 star hotel (which I won't name or shame here!), but wanted S change. And my secretary booked me at the Radisson Blu.   Rooms are acceptable quality ... Clean and spacious and tidy and functional. But it's the service I am raving about. In a 3 day stay, I think I had 6 hotel staff ask me "how is your stay? Any feedback for us?" ... And they had a pen and paper to note down my feedback!  So they take the feedback seriously.  And the lagoon view

General stay was OK. Secured placed, with European standard adequate for the having business meeting in different places indoor or outdoor. personnel is focusing on the satisfaction of the client solving issues and problems as quick as they can. Time for service at surface restaurant is too long and need to be shorten and food quality is good, Blu burger is to be tried

Review Title: It's top notch but kinda Pricey
Review Text: Raddison Blu was as I expected .... Excellent services.... Stayed in a room overlooking the sea.... Although the rates are a little exorbitant, The cost of items in the mini bar in the room is shocking that one may be tempted to smuggle in Snacks and drinks....  Their services though are excellent, the smart TV in my room made it possible to set an alarm for 4.am . Their 24 hour catering, laundry is highly applauded  Was also serenaded by the classy Spa treatment by beautiful Masseuse....
