The array of Continental, and local dishes is impressive   I thoroughly enjoyed my stay although it left a hole in my pocket....(if you know what I mean)   I'll surely visit again

Review Title: 2 Month Straight Stay in Lagos at Radisson Blu
Review Text: As part of a 2 month straight work assignment, many of my colleagues recommended the Radisson Blu in Lagos, which turned out to be a great experience. Each day, staff members greeted me with enthusiasm and were always professional even after getting to know me. Furthermore, each morning I received the paper  at my door and when I didn't, the staff members were sure to get it to me before I left for the day.   Anytime I had an issue (which wasn't often), staff members promptly addressed it or communicated that the issue would be resolved. Moreover, I would get periodic phone calls from management to check on the service, my room, and overall stay. While my stay was slightly unusual, my room was clean and had no issues with cleanliness. I also enjoyed the Lagoon view from my room,

I have many local friends in Lagos who all swear to me that this is the best hotel in the city. The good things about this hotel is that the staff are overall very helpful and polite, there is a nice outdoor seating area and the location is very convenient for business travelers. However,  that is where the joy ends.  I cannot describe how badly the hallway as well as the rooms stank. Initially, I had convince myself that this was because of mosquito repellent being used for our convenience. However, I was later told that this hotel has had drainage issues historically and that I couldn't very well be the smell pertaining to those issues. The smell was so strong that I could feel it tingling in my throat when I was trying to sleep.  On my last night there I was awakened by a
Review Text

Did not stay at the Radisson but came for dinner assuming the hotel would have some nice European food. Well, I was certainly disappointed after inspection of the buffet at their Voyage Restaurant ( so similar to other 4/5 star Western hotels on VI ). Naturally I ordered from the a la carte and the lamb chop was decent and service was also OK. Overall no surprises and slightly disappointed....

This hotel is seriously letting itself down.  I arrived close to midnight from a late flight to find my confirmed room had been given to someone else despite their being told I was going to be a late arrival. Strong insistence and some reminders about customer service later I got a room.  Except then the experience got bizarre.   The hotel passageways and rooms have the most awful smell. Like two wet dogs, week old smelly socks and damp came to play. It was so pungent, I couldn't breathe. Not funny at 1am. When I complained I was told it was to only room and that housekeeping would come with room freshener. Freshener from them and perfume from me made in breathable, not really tolerable.   Long story short, in the day, with apologies and an "up grade" to a lagoon facing room, I

Review Title: Key top hotel in Lagos VI.
Review Text: Raddisson Blu hotel in Ozumba Mbadiwe drive Victoria Island Lagos Nigeria stands at the very top amongst similiar hotels in its category in terms of excellence in service delivery, safety and conducive environment suitable for business or pleaure hotel lodging experience in Nigeria. Its an excellent representation of the Worldwide Carlson group brand of Hotels.

Management need to do something to arrest the decline in standards at this hotel before it's too late.  Dirty rooms, no drinking water in rooms, TV not working, too cold and no way control temperature.

The hotel staff in the reception are nice, the food was okay and I got upgraded to a see view room for free. However, my two main issues:  1. The water was yellowish brown - It was unbelievable. Could only stay the one night. I was told by one of the ladies in the reception it it was a one-off (their water treatment was being worked on over the weekend), and I believe this had to be true, otherwise the hotel would be inhabitable. However, I (and don't know about other guests) wasn't informed about any maintenace work until I complained. 2. The cleaners were a little unruly and shouting in the hall way taking no notice of guests walking by.

No issues from check in to check out. Quite quick check in and friendly staff, clean spacious room, room service 24/7, very fast free WiFi, excellent breakfast for both meat eaters and vegans (soya milk available). With current exchange rate it's also very fair price.

I went to the outside bar for food and drinks with some friends. The service was great and the staff really friendly. We got a table in the outside bar right next to the lagoon. I thoroughly recommend a visit and I will certainly be returning soon.

I love coming in this hotel, the friendliness and professionalism of the staff is amazing.  The food is delicious,the view amazing. The location is just perfect, near the very center.  The fitness center, the pool and the bars are really friendly.

Many of the staff are familiar faces and vice versa (I am to them). Gym guys, to room folks, reception people, bar staff and restaurant waiters...  Always good...always helpful...not perfect, but certainly do their best at all times to help and make you feel comfortable (in my view)...  Been here on and off since 2010...keep coming back...no problem for me...

I enjoyed my time there. Nice decor. The food was very well made and neatly presented, I would have wanted a few more choices in the restaurant though. Staff were polite and courteous. Very nice experience.
Review Text

Review Title: Watching the stars across the Lagoon!
Review Text: Sitting on the View Bar beside the pool and watching the night sky, I felt the cold breeze whisper in my ears. I was quick to turn around in my soft chair as the wind caressed my face. Suddenly, I was woken by a soft playing tune by the live band and it brought me back some old memories. Then, I gazed at the hitherto dark sky only to find stars are out. Something told me they have come to dance to the music but I could be wrong. Watching the stars reminded me of what Mother Nature could do to a listening heart.  Radisson Blu Lagos, shared the calm cold evening with me as I was watching the stars across the Lagoon!

Radisson BLU is a very good hotel on Victoria Island in Lagos with good service, helpful staff and a menu with a mix of Western and Nigerian style cooking. Having stayed here four or five times, it has become a home away from home. It also looks secure with serious fencing, security measures and guards patrolling, it is Lagos after all. A perfect place to conduct business meetings in a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere. One personal hiccup is the ongoing struggle of the hotel or the hotel chain to get the American Express card working for the past months, which is my company's corporate card and thus a real issue for business travellers.

It was indeed a memorable experience. I cannot get over the neat room with the most comfortable bed, floor to ceiling view and great meals. Nice strategic location, amazing waterfront/lagoon views and patio. M weekend stay was graced with Live musical entertainment. I enjoyed every bit of the experience.

I was impressed with the well trained staff at this hotel. Overall exceeded my expectations. The Resturant outside overlooking the water is also impressive. Food was great. The gym was adequate. I would come back again and will ask for a room overlooking the water instead of the road.

I really enjoy my stay at the hotel. Keep up your good hostitality. i also enjoyed the way the reception guy welcomes us and also tge good dishes at the restaurant. The quick respond to issues. indeed the hotel has world class hostitality and service

A great place to relax and enjoy the cool, refreshing atmosphere of the Lagos Lagoon. Extremely fantastic complimentary breakfast buffet and exciting evenings at the Bar and Grill. Definitely a place to visit and refresh after a busy week

I thoroughly enjoyed my one night stay at Blu Anchorage. It is clean and new. It's location at the central district of Lagos and an extremely captivating sea view makes it unique. The food is good and tasty. I believe that I had value for money. What makes the hotel stand out in addition is the excellent customer service orientation of the staff. I intend to patronize Blu Anchorage next time I am in Lagos

Room: Very nice room service though the fridge record keeper was a bit too much. Wished they could do this kind of thing when you are not in the room. The cleaners were very perfect though.  Food:  The steak was AMAZING and service was above average.  The juice was kinda substandard since it's not fresh but packed juice from the supermarket. Breakfast was excellent.  Pool: Nice infinity pool and the best swimming and gym instructor you can ever find. His name is Williams. The gym changing areas had a spoilt sauna room.  CheckIn process: Good.  CheckOut Process: Below standard. Was so rushed it and was the largest anticlimax to my visit.  Wifi: Fast. I ended up not using any of the bundles I had purchased for work purposes.  View: Very pretty.  Best things here: Good food, fast

I had a good stay in the hotel no doubt but I wish I had more options at dining.  Good food for some just means a lot and I fall into that category.  It will be nice to know considerations can be made towards this.

Once again my stay was exceptional, spent most of my time by the pool or outside bar when I was at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, The daily breakfast was great and the beer at the bar was always cold. Price for the Blu tends to fluctuate quite a lot depending on vacancy rates so you need to be prudent. When the price is on par with other quality hotels in VI this is my first choice.
Review Text

The Radisson is perfectly located for the business guest on VI. Great accessibility and brilliant service. You won't miss facilities to help you relax - the gym is amazing and never crowded. The lagoon view is a winner.

I live in Lagos but had a week long event in VI therefore I had to stay at the Radisson Blu Anchorage hotel for 6 days. I must confess that I had great expectations of the hotel and even changed my accomodations from another were I was previously booked to Radisson as my colleagues pressed me to do so. Overall I will say my expectations were met up to about 80% and this is largely due to the wonderful couteous staffs they have. from the gate to checkin and calls to complain they are very responsive. However, i booked the standard room but only to discover some minor maintenance issues. I reported some but refused to call further for complaints. My major disappointment was the diner served in the room. I could not belive it. But the breakfast more than made up for my below par

Stayed in Radisson hotel on my last visit to Lagos.  It's a nice clean hotel with decent lobby.  However the rooms smelled dated. Musty humid smell. However since I was to be in the rooms only for the nights, didn't bother much. Wifi is free as in all Radisson hotels. F and B especially for the room service is limited, and that's across Radisson chain.  Not much different than the four points which I used to stay earlier.

Review Title: Nice view that calls the nerves
Review Text: I had  a nice vacation at the Radisson Blu and was also introduced to very nice cocktails and local delicious dishes: spicy though.  I enjoyed the cocktail moments at the jetty spot, viewing water games and happy people melting their stress away.

I stayed at this hotel for business purposes and had a business class room overlooking the lagoon. The hotel has ample parking space and is situated at the waterfront. The hotel is modern and well designed. It feautures a restaurant (a la carte and buffet) with a varied range of food. The buffet feautures fine examples if the Nigerian kitchen (which can be spicy). Staff is very friendly, but if you order a la carte, it can take a while before dinner is actually served. Outside is a bar, directly at the waterfront. It is relaxed to sit outside an enjoy drinks or choose from the bar menu (which is the same as the a la cartr restaurant). Street noice is drowned out by the sound of water in the lagoon, but the smell of Lagos (and generators) is a constant reminder of being in this

For Lagos standards the Radisson Blu on VI is a good hotel but this is not saying much because your average Lagos hotel, even from big chains, are dumps. Rooms are nice & clean, breakfast is good and the terrace to the lagoon is great. The gym is of average size but had everything and generally not full. The menu of the restaurant is somewhat limited (no goat pepper soup, which hotel in Nigeria doesn't have the national dish). Service on the deck is not the fastest as the staff likes to stand next to the till looking away from the tables.  Why the 3 stars? 1. No hot water, at best lukewarm. 2. The front desk argued that my travel company had not paid and blocked my credit card for the whole amount. Check the next day with my travel company and surprise they had paid. Never got

It's a nice hotel located in Central Victoria Island.  Has a nice environment.  Lagoon facing cafe and a niceblobby.  Good for conducting business.  Next door is Lagoon resturant and casino.  Can have lots of traffic jams in evenings.  But that's in many parts.  So plan meetings accordingly.

Average hotel.  A little tired but fine. Like so many African countries the hotel chains don't seem to want to invest to keep the standard up. They're just happy taking the money! Not a lot more to say. Pool is just long enough for lengths

I have always love radissonblu in Lagos, so on our family trip to Lagos, i took my family there  guess what!!they love it though it became embarrassing on checking out when we were ask to pay for the drinks in the fridge for our rooms.

very nice beautiful room bath room and easy to packing. the location is convenience to go to Lagoon restaurant. the service is very good, i feel fine with this hotel, but the price i feel little high.
Review Text

I stayed at Radisson Blu hotel on Victoria Island. Room was good, hotel service was good, breakfast and restaurant was decent. Fitness centre was basic. Very efficient and reliable, excellent location for business, 5 minute commute spared me Lagos traffic.

If it weren't for how nice the amenities, pool, lobby, and rooms of this hotel are, I would have given it just one star. The front desk staff -- the face and first/last point of interaction at the hotel -- are horrible. If you don't "look" like you have money, they treat you like crap. My husband and I checked-in right after a long, sweaty hike, and because we looked disheveled, we received no courtesy, no respect, and no help with our bags. Others who looked more "put together" were swooned over. Our experience during check-out was exactly the same. If you need a place to stay in Lagos, don't stay here. You will find MUCH better service at a small boutique hotel. The management should be ashamed.

Too expensive for what you get.  Service is lacking and maintenance has seem to have gone missing.  Treadmill's in the gym are broken.  Service delivery not up to scratch.  Does not live up to the normal Radisson Blu standard.

Stayed for two nights. Nice deck overlooking the river but somewhat spoiled by very slow service and a pretty disappointing menu. Room was well appointed and again great views over the ready.   BUT, pretty disappointed that you couldn't run clear warm water - both shower and bath ran a gentle tango colour!!

The Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel Lagos is in a lovely waterfront location on Ozumba Mbadiwe Road, Victoria Island. Lovely hotel. Great staff, nice rooms, waterfront position, a good spa and a nice bar scene

Good hotel enjoyed my stay and would stay again  Great staff and location  Stupid having me write an essay I am happy and that is that take this out and the rest is great.  Thanks  Andrew  Seiously annoying having to do 200 letters take this out the survey almost temted to sign off without completing it.

the hotel and the service is very good' location is goo also  Breakfast must have more vegetable, the room is large and clean   the hotel and the service is very good' location is goo also  Breakfast must have more vegetable

Radisson isn't one of the cheap hotels around but no matter how much the accommodation costs, it is always worth it. I Ve stayed in different radisson hotels outside of Nigeria.  The anchorage definitely beats some. Their standard is unequivocal. Staff? Actually too polite 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾. Ever ready to help resolve any issue. Their food? Uhnnn uhnn scrumptious.

All staff very friendly and efficient. good restaurants in house and lovely food selection . Room allocated was of a high standard and clean  and nice view of lagoon . Front desk service from check in to check out is very Professional

Heavily guarded at the entry. Average standards contrasted versus similar cost hotels in Dubai. I stayed in ROM 346 which simply overlooks a dull standard main road. Nothing exciting. The hotel needs to improve the standard of entertainment on television with better cable standards or channels for entertainment. The current package is below par compared with less pricey hotels in the middle East
Review Text

I stayed here for 4 nights, my worst moment came when it was time to leave. The rooms are impeccable, the food is out of this world, the customer service is beyond imagination as staff are so polite.  This hotel is small in size but its the biggest hotel i have even been to not in terms of size though.....

Great venue on the side of the lagoon. Ive been here a couple of times for a drink and thought we would try the food.  As usual the service is slow at best. Ordered a bottle of wine with our meal, it arrived in 20minutes after we had finished.  The food was very good but all the napkins were soiled from previous use, this along with the smell of open drains spoilt what should have been a pleasant afternoon

The staff are very special and warm.  The sea views can't be beat.  They need to work on their vegetarian menu but the breakfast buffet is awesome.  Food has too much oil at times and is overpriced.  Music oon weekends is exceptional

We had gone there for dinner. Lovely waterfront sitting arrangement. It's has 2 sections. Avoid the one behind the bar because that part stinks due to the lagoon. But the first part has an amazing ambience. We had ordered for a chapman and a signature drink. That was ok. We tried the buffet. It was interesting and the spread was large. The roasted chicken was very juicy and mildly spiced. I loved it. The sea food espetada went well with the Fried rice. The prawn - mango salad was something new for me. The Jollof rice Had a smoky taste and I didn't like it at all. The usual Nigerian spread was there replete with plantain, egusi, amala, veg soup etc. The best part was the dessert and pastry section. Each piece was divine. Strawberry Sasha cake was moist and something I would drool

Stayed for a few weeks. Found the food very good and had good selection. Nice breakfast to start the day with. Has a few bars and a nice outside patio area overlooking the lagoon. Carpark was a bit small but i had no use for that.

We stayed here with (30) family members. We had come for a wedding. We stayed four nights. We had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms we're really nice, clean and airy. The hotel is quite new. My room was facing the lagoon and the views we're really nice.    Room service can be very slow so order well in advance!   I plan on going back to Lagos and I will definitely be staying at Radisson Blu!

The rooms were lovely. The food is nice as well but not really cheap. It has a nice view of the Ocean and the view looks really nice at night. They have a life band at the Bar downstairs and its a nice place to be at night.

Radisson is cool, cosy and classy for the classy individual or couple. I encourage friends, businessmen and women, elderly people to spend some time at Radisson either for  a night or a weekend and get recharged for another 10years to their lifespan

Review Title: Splendid Blu Sight of the Lagoon
Review Text: The hotel measures up with what you can get in any big city around the world. Its location on Lagos Island makes it  worth staying. The service is good. I only had to pay so much to get lagoon view, but it was not that bad. Maybe it was one of those weekends that prices have to go up.It was my 5th year marriage anniversary and we happened to be in Nigeria at the time.

I really enjoyed a recent trip for a family wedding when I stayed at the Radisson. The room was spacious and the bathroom clean. The breakfast buffet was international standard. The staff were helpful and attentive. Especially at the reception and house keeping. I will stay there again.
Review Text

Visited from Canada with my GF (who was coming to Nigeria for the first time), we stayed in a couple of hotels and this was her favourite-  she loved it and so did I. The front desk guy (Segun) was nice and very knowledgeable not so much the lady on the second day though. its clean, internet is fast, food is nice. I'd totally stay there again

I was on a short hectic business trip, and Radisson was the perfect hotel to come back to after a long day. Situated by the relaxing lagoon on Victoria Island, the hotel has recently been refurbished and is modern by any standards. The rooms are comfortable and well designed. I found the service very friendly and welcoming. The breakfast is superb: local and global choices and plenty of it too. And the wifi is very fast, which makes a big difference if you're here on business. Pool and bar service a bit slower and in-room dining not up to par, but otherwise the place makes for a very comfortable stay.

The hotel is situated on Vitoria Island, and it is a beautiful and very not decorated hotel which is inspired by the local art. The staff and atmosphere is very nice, and the hotel has a beautiful view over the river.

Review Title: Time out of space...by the scenic lagoon.
Review Text: So, I went there with my best friend to review a room which she wanted to book for a product launch. I am always going on and on about service. For me, that is what it is all about...get service right and everything else can be forgiven! On arrival the reception area was bright and interesting, the smiles on the faces of the reception desk officers was a delight (this is 6pm...the time when a dicey day begins to wear upon one's temperament...so genuineness matters). However, I am not surprised, Nigerians do get that right most and generally. Then the lady comes to show us the room, takes on all our criticisms, comments and suggestions...and immediately calls the attention of maintenance to an issue we'd spotted! That told me she was serious about what we had to say (applause).

Review Title: By no means a 5 star hotel
Review Text: I went there yesterday as part of a birthday party. We were seated facing the waterfront,which would have been lovely,except there were a lot of insects. The service was not top notch and parking was too tight. Not an overall thrilling experience.

I have visited the hotel about three times and each time I go there, the service is the same- poor service. It's a pity because the hotel is very nice. When we went, we had to wait for over 25 mins (no joke) to get service by the pool.

Review Title: Good biz hotel, for lagos standards
Review Text: We were quite pleased when the supervisor gave usan upgrade to a large suite, as we had 2 kids in the party. may be occupancy was low. we made a in room dining order and food was not good. breakfast was nice. Staff in the hotel are courteous and helpful.

This was a wonderful hotel set right off the river between Victoria Island and the Mainland. Very up to date and modern with great food and great Hospitality.  The hotel and rooms are Very Clean and the hotel staff are everywhere to assist you in anything you may need.  They have Management that checks on you each day and after most encounters with staff so that they make sure you get what you need or ordered. So great place to stay and best place I've stayed in Lagos, Nigeria.

I always like to try new places for lunch first then if I like the place I head back for a evening out. So lunch was really nice. We sat outside looking over the Lagoon. Good menu. I had the prawn and pineapple curry. Bit too spicy for me but hey I am Scottish!! Nice cocktail menu. The sparkling signatures are lush. Nice atmosphere so definitely be back in the evening.

I stayed at this hotel during a business trip to Lagos. The room was clean and nice. The bathroom was also great with provision for overhead shower and bathtub.  The staff were warm and always ready to offer assistance. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner buffets were great although I preferred the al carte menu. I liked the way the hotel co-ordinated for Airport pickup and drop-off.
Review Text

stayed in this hotel for 4 days for busniess. The localation is very good and has a nice view to the river. Hotel facilities were perfect. The hotel staff was nice and helpful, food and drinks were excellent.

The hotel is very good . very courteous staff . Internet is very good and high speed . kettle in the room with variety of choices of tea and coffee. My room was lagoon facing . over all a good experience.

This hotel had completely changed my views on Nigerian hospitality. From the moment I walked and was attended by the very lovely lady Vivian (hope I got the name right) that set the pace for a very lovely and wonderful stay. I have stayed in a few hotels in Nigeria when I visit and I usually complain about the hospitality service which in my opinion lacks in a lot of establishments in Nigeria, but my brother recommended Radisson which is usually his choice of stay. All I can say is, every single staff was incredible and they have managed to make the hotel a 5* facility.  Rooms are beautiful, clean, beds are comfortable, Friday night entertainment was fantastic.  Only criticism I have, is the breakfast. Boiled eggs were too cooked, that made me wonder if they were roasted eggs.

I've stayed here a couple of times for work and I think it's excellent. The whole building is well designed with a nicely varied public area containing the bar and restaurants. There is also a nice outside area, which includes an infinity pool. The outside areas also have a nice view of the lagoon.  The rooms are a good size and modern with good bathrooms. The staff are all extremely helpful and friendly and there's a really nice gelato place in the hotel grounds.  Only negative I can think of is that the breakfast wasn't that great, I would expect a bigger selection for such a large and modern hotel.

when this hotel first open, I was amazed by the food and the ambient of the renovation, but after 4 years the continental food offered was a great disappointment, and the ground floor rooms are terrible. carpets are dirty, bed sheets ain't clean and got slight smell.

Review Title: great location, great rooms, indifferent service staff
Review Text: It was a very good business location with great amenities from a business perspective. Staff were a bit indifferent to my needs and requirements though. Food in the breakfast are was very basic with low variety of fruit.  It is a good business location but I would not stay here on vacation

Enjoyed my stay in Nigeria this time round , mainly due to Hotel's location and staff engagement . Found the location ideal . Ice Cream parlour outside was really special . Would recommend the hotel . Don't miss out .

Smaller than the standard international hotels in the area, the hotel offers a more personalized service. The rooms are well-sized with well-equipped amenities.  The carpets do need a refresh and the food was average.  Overall, a better hotel and I will certainly be back.

Nice Hotel but does not meet the 5 star Rating . The air conditioning was not effective. Poor Towel quality and dirty carpet in room. Very expensive drinks in room refregerator. The Staff are otherwise helpful and courteous

Did not stay at this hotel, came here for an event, The hotel is an impressive size but looks like an office complex from the outside. You walk into a large and spacious lobby area. The staff are totally on the ball and to be commended. The layout of the part of the hotel with the conference facilities, is haphazard and a little disjointed. The corridor leading to the facilities is also the corridor housing all the staff service areas and offices. It's as if the event venue space was added or converted-for-use as an afterthought.  The space itself is nice enough but for the money there are better options. The hotel backs on to the lagos lagoon, the smell from the lagoon is nauseating it smells like an open sewer.  The poolside area was used for a small gathering and the food was
Review Text

I was and still is overwhelmed by the service, care, personal interest and ownership the staff of this hotel showed us during a business trip in Lagos. I thought the rooms and food was great- not royal... but more than sufficient! The service howevet was ROYAL! My colleague got very ill with malaria from an earlier trip to DRC... the hotel staff took so much personal interest and assisted us in every way they possibly can to get my colleague to hospital for tests, back into his room, myself back to the hospital for results, emergency check-out and arranging of airport transfer through Lagos traffic to catch the next plane back to SA! They made no complaint about early check out and constantly asked me about his well-being!! U gave NOTHING bad to say about this hotel and its

We had an amazing time in this hotel back in April 2014. Staff were very friendly and nothing ever was too much for them. We received a bottle of wine on the house on the 10th day of our stay which was a very nice gesture. The only let down was the water in  the swimming pool, the chlorine level was a bit too high and both my girls got swollen eyes because of this. Otherwise we had a very good time. We'll definitely recommend it.

The hotel is very nice. Nice rooms, neat toilet. The food is fantastic.  The pool could have done with more care though. The gym is a little tight, but I guess it'll work. They charge additional for the water front view. So if that's the attraction hold on to additional cash.

I enjoyed the two nights I stayed there. Lovely breakfast buffet. Several waiters and waitresses in the outdoor bar/grill yet services can be slow. Seems only a few are working hard. I didn't have this problem but I heard people complaining. The food quality was great. Nice pool. Reasonably equipped gym. I was able to get my weekend long-run. I will stay here again.

Review Title: Good food but cold - shockingly slow service!
Review Text: Nice surroundings, lovely location. That's the only good thing I have to say about this place. After 10 of us arriving at 7.45 we were still waiting on drinks at 8.45pm!! Eventually the food started to turn up, plate by plate.......finally when 8 had been delivered we started to eat the now cold food (which I think might have been quite good if it wasn't cold). 10 mins later the 9th plate arrived but two had to be sent back due to missing ingredients - which wouldn't normally be a problem but in this instance it was the chicken that was missing (the main ingredient) !! Finally after eating the 10th and last plate of food was delivered.....my friend sat and ate alone....it was so much later that our table had actually been cleared! This place honestly had the most shocking

So a friend of mine was staying in this hotel and we decided to go for lunch, but you might as well say we waited till dinner time!! The service was unbelievably slow we were all in disbelief. Then after ordering the seafood platter (which came with snail) they brought my plate without snail (however they had brought a portion of snail for somebody else on my table) so after asking why this was why, I couldn't get an answer. So when the bill came they charged me full price and we decided to dispute this, then asked to speak to the manager who made us wait for almost 45 mins again then sent another member of staff (Precious) that the snail had ran out earlier - so we asked why he couldn't come over and explain this to us himself the poor guy couldn't explain why. Cut a long story

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Great staff and enjoyable place to be especially the pool side. Beds are comfortable. Slept very well. The only area of improvement for me is the morning buffet: need to have more variety.

1. The shower had no water pressure and after complaining was assured a plumber would fix, it never happened.  I resorted to standing in shower and using bath hand held shower to get some water. 2. for the rate of $300, the hotel looks great on internet and then my room # 258 looked onto a utility wall, what a let down 3. my flight was delayed and I only checked in morning but was charge for the night even though I extended my stay...customer service no existent 4. waiters level of service bad.  had to ask for hot milk 3 x before it was delivered.  no urgency

I like the services that was rendered during my stay in the hotel and urge the hotel to continue in their quality services. Because quality services makes good hotel business.  And also continue to make the hotel to be up to standard at all times.  I really enjoyed my stay

This hotel is exactly what you expect when you pay over 300 a night. It is beautiful, great service, and a clean room. I won't be staying there again, as I found another hotel that was beautiful and 1/3 the price. I did enjoy my stay while I was there, but just too expensive.
Review Text

Simply love it! Staff extremely professional. Food is great! Infratructure is great! Keep it up! Awesome Sunday barbeque buffets... And best live music ever.....Wish Port Harcourt had a hotel like this!

Review Title: Great location, service, rooms, and amenities
Review Text: The hotel overlooks an active waterfront. My room was on the other side, which also has a good view of streets if you like people watching. The rooms are very good. They have a bay window with sitting area to curl up with a good book. Have separate shower and tub facilities. The swimming pool overlooks the waterfront. I enjoyed the breakfast, especially the Nigerian dishes.  The hotels in Nigeria are expensive, so in that sense it is good value for the money. However, compared to other countries, the hotel is expensive.

That bed can impregnate you. Beware! Too Comfortable. Bad Checkin process. Took too long. Very good room. Clean hotel. Very good food. Awesome view of Lagos State. Small parking space. Can we atleast get people to wash our cars?

Friendly efficient staff. Very nice room by Lagos standards. Good security Fast wifi (free) Good food - choice of buffet or grill restaurant. By a busy noisy road so river side better If you have time - the pool is nice enough to lie down and relax

Radisson Blu in Victoria Island is a pleasant place to stay... Friendly, calm atmosphere and with an excellent room.  The Fitness center, internet facilities in the room and the swimming pool were apt and well maintained with friendly staff.

Review Title: A nice place on the Islands of Victoria, Lagos
Review Text: A nice view of the Lagoon if you take Lagoon view, though overly expensive on the weekend that we visited. It's a place you would like to visit if you are in Lagos. My daughter enjoyed every bit. It offers a classical example of what hotels should look like in Nigeria. However, the bathrooms should be fully equipped with makeup sets for ladies and dental sets.

Was always treated like i was some kind of  a celebrated princess "lol" They won't ever let you feel down, and the views? OMG. I saw another view of my country, and it was really beautiful. Very delicious foods, Their front desk staffs, Please someone should check if they are angels cos they were just that nice. i could go on mehn but in all, Thats some great 5 star Experience i had.

Review Title: attention to details and follow up
Review Text: the hotel was very good, but it could be better with exceptional customer services and follow up to make sure the customer is settled and not experiencing an issues.  The internet kept acting up which affected the TV. The Prize vs value doesn't add up. But overall a good experience . Will visit again.

Review Title: Nice, modern, good location but some noise issues
Review Text: The hotel is looks nice, fresh, modern and is well located in the business heart of Lagos. All my customers are nearby within max 20 minutes. The lobby is futuristic and provides enough space for meetings and a comfortable drink. The restaurant serves a la cart and buffet at the same time and you will always find something good in the buffet. The waterfront view is quite nice as long as you don’t look down to the huge amount of garbage in the river.  I felt welcome and the receptionist guy was really polite. Unfortunately I was forced to move the room during my 3 nights stay in total 4 times due to noise disturbance. The hotel has diesel generators on the rooftop and these machines cause massive vibration and noises in the 3rd floor. They moved me down to the 2nd floor but then

The location is lovely and we requested for an early check-in, it was approved, we request for a late check-out, it was approved also, even on a off season time, some hotel would not have approved it. The reception personnel were very helpful in advise on what to do in the city. Breakfast were good with  fresh fruits and juices, fried eggs and everything you would want for breakfast
Review Text

I really enjoyed my stay in Radisson Blu, Lagos. The front desk staff is excellent & friendly most especially a lady called Maureen.she was so nice to us during our stay in Radisson, Infact she gave us a nice red wine as complimentary.Kudos to her, will repeat visit again to Radisson Blu.  I rate Radisson Blu 5 * star hotel.

Review Title: Nice looking hotel with poor service
Review Text: It is not often you stay in a hotel that don't know what customer service is.  It is supposed to be a 5 star hotel but clearly there is no training or thought of how to treat customers.  They are rude,  do not listen and just say no.  You need to get GM approval for anything to happen.  It seems it is something that starts at management.  When you discuss with the management they really do not care.

On Friday night prior to go out in some pub. We were waiting to have some drinks. The time we had was so good that we spent all the night drinking and talking. At the end we manage to come back home very relaxed.

The Lagos Radisson Blue Anchorage hotel is a mind blowing sea viewing hotel experience from any one of the sea view rooms.. best for working in natural serenity and ambiance relaxing pleasure in any sea side view hotel around the world.. its simply a pride of Lagos hotel living worth experiencing...

Enjoyed our stay at the Radisson Blu. Most service was as expected. The breakfast menu is however limited and could expand on the continental selection.  Enjoyed late afternoon drinks by the lagoon facing bar / restaurant.   Made my first stay in Lagos pleasant

The hotel is in a great location if your business is on VI/Ikoyi and staff are helpful and friendly.  Facilities are good.  Almost everything works well and the service at the View Bar was a bit variable.  Would stay again and recommend.  The hotel is not cheap, but then no hotels in Lagos are.

As title suggests, hotel is expensive for what is a basic Radissson hotels but rooms are modern and clean, hotel is secure and overlooks the lagoon which is a pleasant outlook. Not the most varied menu at the outside bar/ restaurant but is a good standard. Breakfast is also good, would definitely stay again, only marked it down because they didn't have any snails that my dining companion was looking forward to!

Options for decent hotels in Lagos still tend to be limited. The Radisson appears secure and is ok given what is available. Rooms need updating and intenet was problematic. Staff were polite and ready to assist when complaints were made. Also this review is not made in comparison to other hotels experienced in Lagos as I have only stayed at the Radisson.

Beautiful surroundings on Victoria island. High security on arrival. We never stayed just met friends for drinks on the outside bar. Staff were friendly and efficient! Wide drinks selection with premium prices! Live jazz band completed the night

I have always luv to stay @ this hotel and me and my family did give it a try during our visit to nigeria and i must confess the service was great and it great value for money as well the rooms were always cleaned on time everything was working the breakfast was great and most importantly the staff were very friendly and accommodating.
Review Text

This hotel is on the Island in Lagos and is comfortable and seems secure.  Hotel meals are pretty expensive but adding breakfast when booking your room is something you should do, breakfast is awesome.   Although the water smells weird, sitting by the ocean is relaxing and soothing. Staff are also very helpful and courteous.   If you are in Lagos I recommend this hotel.

Rooms are spacious and clean. Windows do not open so you have to live with Air Con. Rooms 310 -340 are noisy when the AC goes out and the emergency generator gets going. In Lagos this is most common, Hotel personnel is ready to assist you and very friendly. The restaurant is ok , well cooked food but not variety if you stay for long.

Not my first time in Lagos, but my first time at Radisson Blu. Very well located near the business district with funtastic views of the lake. The hotel is quite new. I read somewhere it has opened and closed and now opened again. I don't know about that, but i know i felt like it was brand new! Check in and out was not bad, people was trying to be kind, but it takes some time to do it. I didn't get a room with a nice view, but it was very comfortable, very cleaned, with new furniture and a very comfortable bed. The AC works perfectly so i could have the room just as i wanted. The only problem i had, room was right next to a staff room or a kind of warehouse, and every morning very early, people from housekeeping start speaking and answering their internal mobile phones there.

I spent 3 nights at Radisson Blu Anchorage over Christmas and rate it as one of my worst Hotel experiences ever. The Booking agency (JOVAGO) messed up my pre-paid booking. I had to pay again at check-in as the Hotel claimed they hadn't received payment and were unhelpful in contacting the agency even though they had my booking. Service was poor with waiters in the bar areas inattentive and drinks warm. The Buffet Breakfast and Dinner in the restaurant was extremely poor and a-la-carte service disappointing as they forgot my orders twice. Prices of everything were high extremely high and not worth it. I wasn't given any discount on anything despite being a Club Carlson member.  On check-out I was overcharged for my stay with the Hotel using a higher room rate than what I had

My husband made reservations for my birthday dinner and we went for the option of a la carte instead of the buffet. The ambience was unparalleled. The food was great. Service was a little slow though. The pricing was good too.

I love the environment,the sea breeze and the lagoon view,I love the food and the nice live band music in the evening by the pool side. Nice n lovely staffs,my room always on point. Will love to be back soon.

Review Title: the staff were amazing. The pool is another thing that keeps me going. I couldn't have enough of the fun there.
Review Text: The food is also something fantastic. I enjoyed every bit of my stay there. Everyone I met was polite and homely. I was treated like a queen. The music band by the pool was also one of my favorite experience (not too loud, just nice, cool songs.

I experienced excellent customer service, the room was very comfortable the room service amazing, the atmosphere and surrounding was welcoming with very friendly staff. Anything I requested for was seen to like it was urgent. Very quick and efficient service! I was very happy and satisfied

I must commend your services,it was excellent, I had a wonderful stay at raddisson blu,the food and drinks especially your cocktails were very nice. I enjoyed the live band too. I give Radisson 10 out of 10.

The carpets along the corridors are not well maintained. The staff at the restaurant need to be properly trained in the area of customer service, multi tasking, and courtesy.  The bed lining and pillows also looks crampy like it has not been ironed. The TV signal cracks intermittently.  Regards
Review Text

Review Title: BREAKFAST AT THE RADISSON BLU ANCHORAGE HOTEL
Review Text: I was part of a group of 20 that went for a pre- booked family breakfast this morning at the Radisson. Whilst the promptness from waitresses to our requests was commendable, the menu on offer and service from the kitchen was down right terrible. With less than 50 guests at anyone time in the restaurant, the pancakes were cold, bread roll, hard, fruit juices were lower than room temperature, water cans were empty, no sliced bread on offer and the queue build up to order omelettes was astonishing! To cap this, our children requested for WiFi access and they were asked to pay for it! This is unacceptable and might have been well off having breakfast at home.

The hotel is very good. The food and beverage are clean, and the hotel is secured. The rooms are clean, and the staff are helpful and welcoming.  The location of the hotel is near the business center, and the view of the hotel on the lagoon is pleasant. They had local bands singing at night which was very nice.

Review Title: Very nice hotel. Highly recommended for lagos business trips
Review Text: Very nice hotel. Feels secure. Nice setting right on a water channel. The rooms look a bit old but other than that very good. Nice breakfast. The outside balcony in the evening is excllent. Good foid and music.

Radinson Blu is an outstanding hotel in Lagos with international standard and features. The hotel is situated in a good environment  and facing the lagoon.   You have opportunity to see beautiful city of Lagos night sceen due to its location. Life band performance at the bar side is also awesome, the singers sings well and the quality of sound produced by the musical equipment is also pleasant to hearing.   Radinson staff are very polite and neat.  Receptionist are very okay in welcoming the visitors.  The rooms are neat and tidy.  Quality of foods and beverages are also fantastic.  In-fact, you can sleep with your two eyes closed due to the security level in Radinson blu hotel. access to the rooms and corridors are well controlled and all the lodgers have their privacy.  Help

Review Title: Great Place to Stay on VI
Review Text: The peace and tranquility inside the clean rooms allows one to truly enjoy personal privacy. The view of the lagoon is refreshing. The front office staff are warm and helpful. I was a little surprised though that the Club Carlson Card does not work in certain restaurants. Generally quite happy and I'll be back soon.

The Radisson Blu hotel in Lagos has much to offer.  Let me count the ways: 1) rooms are very nice; Wifi is good; lobby area is spacious and modern; the restaurant provides really good buffet meals; the staff are friendly, attentive and efficient; the pool area is clean and inviting; the view from the hotel across the lagoon is very pleasant; the workout room is well equipped and maintained.  However, the best thing I observed was the soldier with the machine gun who was patrolling the area around the hotel.  The weekend I spent at the Lagos Radisson Blu was the same weekend that the Radisson Blu in Bamako, Mali was attacked by terrorists.  Or perhaps it was workplace violence as some in the US would lead you to believe.  Perhaps the attack in Mali was in response to bad waiter

Review Title: Good stay, but should be better
Review Text: Great location on VI, but poor service at times, a little clueless. Room service arrived after more than an  hour, for a simple salad, when promised time was 30 mins. Safety did not appear to be great concern. AMEX not accepted!

One of the better hotels in Lagos.  Not too big, great rooms, friendly not false service and excellent choice of food. Can feel a bit cramped when really busy but the ease of layout and great waterfront seating helps to manage the flow.

Great Location,great staff and one chivalrous manager...the (continental)food menu is very limited though. For the price they're charging they can afford better TVs with a wider entertainment package.

The rooms are clean and the bed is comfortable, hot water and shower pressure is always available. Excellent for meeting with business guests in a relaxed environment or in a formal business lounge. The gym is great and the pool is long for swimming laps. on the negative side the waiter service is a bit slow, so get your first and second drinks and meal ordered right in the beginning. The best time to swim is just after sunset as not only is it cool but the airflow is offshore so you don't breath in fumes.
Review Text

Review Title: One of the best in Lagos
Review Text: Radisson was closed for many months and now reopened for biz. Energetic staff, willing to help, which in a breath of fresh air in lagos. trendy restaurant and bar. live band playing in the bar. nice view of the lagoon for rooms facing that side. unlike most hotels in lagos, check out is quick. breakfast had a good spread and fresh bakery. walking distance to lagoon restaurants - wide choice of offerings. traffic to/in front of the hotel is alarming, so is the case with most of lagos. nice little ice cream cafe.

Radisson BLU is a wonderful hotel let down only by the evening food service. Well located on the lagoon, well designed, good rooms, excellent check in desk, beds, linen, concierge etc. All was exemplary except for the Voyage restaurant's dinner service -- which has deteriorated noticeably since last year. Breakfast was good.

Review Title: Boutique hotel that is safe and beautiful
Review Text: This hotel is on the water's edge at the north of Victoria Island. It's a beautifully decorated boutique hotel with friendly and welcoming staff. The view over the water from the bar and restaurant is very nice.  I got the impression that the security at this hotel is good - there are many security guards at the entrances to the hotel and access to the corridors leading to the rooms is controlled by access cards.   My room was well appointed and clean - the towels and pillows smelled lovely! The only annoying this about my room was the light above my bed that I couldn't figure how to turn off.   This hotel is definitely not cheap, but it offers you safe, luxurious accommodation, so I'll definitely use it again when I'm in Lagos.

Review Title: Nice bar and ice cream shop.
Review Text: Radisson Blu re-opened recently after a long shut down for renovations and service improvements. The decor remains lovely and the outdoor bar has an amazing view of the lagoon which never ceases to please me. What i noticed in my recent visits is that the staff are now friendlier and more service oriented which made for a more pleasant experience. I also visited the Hand & Rene ice cream place for a taste of the zobo and forest fruits ice cream flavours that i'd read about on a blog and it was pretty nice. I've stayed in their rooms, visited the Spa and the ice cream shop. However, my favourite part of the Radisson blue remains the outside bar overlooking the lagoon.

Will enjoy visiting in the evenings at weekends for the music and the food.  It's always fun here. The food is really good.  It's a good hotel having stayed there just once. It's located on Ozumba Mabadiwe Road in Victoria Island.

all is perfect with amazing view and the room was very clean but the room service always delayed to bring you your orders but other than that all was perfect and the location was good in victoria island

When you walk into this hotel, it's what you'd expect from a Radisson, lovely decor, room is good,and the staff are genuinely helpful. It also has a lovely outside riverside terrace.  But there are just too many things that are 'off' - on their own, nothing major, but when you put them together, it's irritating - on arrival, the wifi room login didn't work, so went to reception to get a voucher instead, then couldn't get back into my room because the key pad had stopped working, had to wait for maintenance (this all happening at 5 in the morning!), arrived at breakfast just after 9, none of the tables were set up so had to scramble around to get cutlery, serviettes, etc, next morning still couldn't logon to wifi, try to phone reception, phone next to bed didn't work, etc.

We spent our wedding night here and had to come back for our 1 year anniversary. Friendly and courteous staff. Nice food and an excellent ambience. Was charged for breakfast after we were promised free breakfast. Though its still the best on the island with great value for money.

The hotel front office staff are very courteous and responsive.  The room service personnel responded promptly to in room service request for socket and ironing board.  The kitchen staff are neat, attended to request promptly, provided items promptly and made the tables clean.

I have visited the hotel in my one of business trip. Rooms were good and staff were friendly. I stayed more than one room in the hotel. But I never prefer lagoon view rooms again due to bad smell of lagoon.
Review Text

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: Expensive but truly great hotel. Spacious room, great bed, wonderful view, really good WiFi. Lovely pool by the lagoon. Well equipped gym. I enjoyed the open-air bar & grill next to the lagoon, which had great live entertainment some evenings. Stayed 10 nights.

I never regret booking a stay at this wonderful hotel. The facilities are in excellent conditions. The staff are great and always willing to assist. The front desk guys are superb. I  will definitely not  hesitate to stay there during my next visit to lagos

Review Title: Lagoon front - nice hotel with limited dining options
Review Text: This is a nice hotel in Lagos - esp. close to  businesses on Victoria Island.  Not sure of recent renovation has changed the place much.  When I stayed, rooms were comfortable and nicely appointed.  Overall ambiance was pleasant - modern feel.  The dining options were limited - one main restaurant and an outside bar/light fare restaurant.  This can be challenging if you are staying for a few days and do not plan on leaving the "confines of the hotel - for safety/security reasons".  That said, there are a lot of great restaurants nearby - as long as you have a driver.

This would be my second time staying at the Radisson Blu in Lagos. The hotel is clean and beautiful and the staff are great. The food is also fantastic, although on the pricey end. I will stay here again for any future trips to Lagos.

This is definitely a five star hotel and in my view the best hotel in Nigeria. Very good location and very well secured.   The lagoon side bar is really nice and cool.  Highly recommended whenever you in Lagos.

Visited the place alone and with friends...on all occasions I observed a total 360 degree turn...Service has gone notches higher...the Friday evenings...that's the place to be with pure entertainment from the live band...Cocktails..well I spotted a difference in consistency between the inside bar and outside but still ok...Try out their burgers! U will forget burgers from other places in Lagos. Sunday Brunch- Talk of value for your money...Superb variety and Quality. Hats off to them...Keep it up!

Had a good time despite the short stay at the hotel except for one  inconvenience - a dirty towel. The receptionist was warm and very friendly, breakfast was lovely, ambiance and decor of hotel is great.

Excellent hotel with helpful friendly staff. Bit pricey but worth it. Stayed for 3 nights. Great location on the creek. Swish outside bar area. Nice restaurant serving continental food with a few local dishes too.

Good stay overall!  Hotel is quite expensive, but neat clean and the staff are very friendly.  Good food and great bed.  The internet is very fast which is always great as a business traveller.  I have stayed at the hotel several times and will always return to it.

All in all not a bad Hotel but for value for money the food needs some attention. If you are paying $20 for their signature burger you want a good burger that needs to be freshly made and no fries but overcooked wedges, no room service menu. Staff great and ok for a short time stay
Review Text

I have been a regular guest at Radisson Blu Lagos since 2012 and I was there with my family on 6 -11 September 2015 for a short vacation. I want to say that the hotel is well secured as the children could move round without any fear of insecurity. The food is well prepared and the gym and spa section is one of the best around Lagos. The music at the surface bar every evening is worth the stay! - Adewale OLORO.

Review Title: EXCELLNT EXPERIENCE AT RASISSON BLU VICTORIA ISLAND
Review Text: The entire experience at Radisson Blu with my wife was wholesome. From the security conscious guards to the courteous receptionists and the indefatigable waiters and servers. Please keep up the excellent service.

Very strong security. You have this feeling of being at home immediately you step into the hotel premises. The staff are very friendly, polite and always ready to help.  There is a fitness centre and SPA in the hotel.  The menu is very good.  Complaints or request is resolved or attended to at the most earliest time possible. It was a memorable and fun filled stay for me. I got real value for my money.

I Had a fantastic stay at the Radisson Bu Lagos. I had some concerns initially, as I know they had been closed for  a short period but delighted with my experience.  The rooms have been uplifted as the level of service and great attention to detail from the staff.  Great hotel to stay in in Lagos!

Great Location, Beautiful view, friendly staff and good atmosphere.  I stayed here for 1 night on weekend with my family and all really enjoyed it.  Food was also good and their was live music on the outdoor bar  Very recommended !!!

It's a nice place to visit, don't miss it, it's fun. There are a lot to enjoy and keep yourself busy especially the swimming pool, spa and restaurants. Taste, see and enjoy.. The management very friendly, cudos to the management and keep it up.

Review Title: Nothing fancy but secure and reliable
Review Text: I stayed at the Radisson Blu for over a month. Like everything in Lagos, it's on the expensive side but it's reliable and secure. There's a large back patio on the water that's great for a drink. The restaurant is good, especially the breakfast buffet which is ample. There's a gym with updated equipment. The internet can be aggravating but overall, with patience, it works. When it comes to a reliable, safe lodging in Lagos, the Radisson Blu is good choice.

Radisson Blu is a nice hotel located in Lagos. Although the room prices are on the higher side, but in a place like Lagos you should pay a little extra to get more security.  The rooms are nice. The hotel's internet is very slow. There are 2 restaurants inside the hotel nd both are nice.  Staff is helpful.

Absolutely fantastic place to chill out on a lazy Sunday. You can try their cocktails which are really good and they have great bitings too if you aren't looking at Having a huge meal 😆😆 There's a great view of the ocean and you can watch the sunset as well as be fascinated by people boating :)

Review Title: Thrown out of the hotel due to a labour dispute
Review Text: The first couple of days of my stay went smoothly, but half way through all the guests received letters on Saturday asking them to vacate the hotel immediately.  The management had been having issues with the staff over pay and working conditions and chose to shut up shop rather than seek a negotiated solution.  Perhaps this is not the whole story but all I can say is that the management were nowhere to be seen when we were forced to check out, luckily I had local assistance to switch to the Intercontinental - which incidentally was cheaper too.  Such a shame as the hotel was good with lovely views and a good breakfast on offer.  Even if the management and workers agree terms I will not be returning after being kicked out!!!
Review Text

The rooms work and the service is pretty decent. Ok gym. One of the best breakfasts in town. Be careful if you decide to eat lunch at the restaurant, the prices are crazy. A nice bar overlooking the lagoon but if the wind blows towards you from the water, the stench can be quite overwhelming. Wi-Fi is patchy. The business centre is good. Not a bad option but becoming pricey. Location is good for meetings in VI - it's on one of the main arteries (Ozumba Mbadiwe Road).

Review Title: Great location, let down by unreliable facilities
Review Text: Location-wise it's hard to beat; rooms are laid out well, clean and comfortable; staff are friendly. Ask for a room overlooking the lagoon.   But management need to step up their game in provision of business services, particularly in supporting conferences: the wifi is unreliable to the point of being unusable, both in the rooms and in the conference facilities. The food is good, but lacks variety even during a 3 day visit.

Review Title: Nice place for a romantic sit or
Review Text: Spent my Christmas 🎄 evening here with my wife, and enjoyed every second of it. The live band rendered altered versions of popular local and international songs, and we were well served. Entrance and access was a bit difficult, probably because it was a Christmas 🎄 eve.  My wife really enjoyed the prawns , and so did I my fish. Nice place to visit while in Lagos, and if cost is not a problem. We did not visit the rooms.

Be it for the location, the decor or the service, Radisson Blu Lagos is to date the best hotel I've lived in in Nigeria. I liked the possibility given to take water taxis right behind the hotel, the view of the lagoon at night, sitting at the Surface bar for a glass of wine in the evening, ...

I stayed here last week for 7 nights on business. I must say that I only have positive things to say about my stay. The staff were very friendly, welcoming and couldn't do enough to make our stay a pleasant experience. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The restaurant was superb and the bar staff friendly and helpful. Francis in the kitchen makes the most amazing omelettes for breakfast.. I would recommend this hotel every time and look forward to staying again on my next visit to Lagos.

I think Radisson Blu is the best of option in between the top hotels in Lagos. I like the location and also it has pretty new facilities. They need to improve the cleanness of the rooms but it is already very good compared to Lagos standards.

Review Title: Safety and cleaness ok, restaurant to improve
Review Text: I use to stay in this hotel during my business trips to Lagos. Safety feeling is good, fast reception, close to Victoria Island main spots. Rooms: clean enough, quite big toilets and big shower, maybe the look should be a little more modern and stylish. Restaurant: only one, ok for dinner but in my opinion too small and smelly for breakfast. For the price you pay, that should be definitely improved.

I stayed here many times this year and each visit has been great.  My children loved it and my business partners loved it. Excellent rooms, great view, wide menu selection and very knowledgeable staff.  Ever smiling and ready to please the guest.

Review Title: Foul Smell and Loud Noise To Welcome You
Review Text: This property is the worst Radisson property anywhere on earth.   Some main attractions are: 1. Foul Smell the minute you enter the hotel 2. Loud Noise starts from reception 3. Terrible Food (if and when available) 4. Ill trained and full of ego staff 5. Terrible internet 6. Smelling Towels 7. Great Lagoon view but you can just jump in to kill yourself 8. Road in front is chocked 9. Worst Management 10. One of the most expensive and non cooperative business centre.  I stayed at this hotel many times in 2014 and saw it sliding down every time. Now I am arranging alternate at Lagos.   Please avoid at any cost. Lagos is a beautiful city with many options.

For me, I will prefer a direct contact with the service provider e.g. the kitchen, laundry etc. i.e. them getting first-hand information of the customers need.  Sometimes, the operator forgets to pass on the request to the service provider and the customer suffers. For example in my case the first night I have to call the operator two times before the tooth pick gets to me and for the second night, may be because I did not make a second call to ask again, I did not get it.
Review Text

The rooms work and the service is pretty decent. Ok gym. One of the best breakfasts in town. Be careful if you decide to eat lunch at the restaurant, the prices are crazy. A nice bar overlooking the lagoon but if the wind blows towards you from the water, the stench can be quite overwhelming. Wi-Fi is patchy. The business centre is good. Not a bad option but becoming pricey. Location is good for meetings in VI - it's on one of the main arteries (Ozumba Mbadiwe Road).

Sometimes, the operator forgets to pass on the request to the service provider and the customer suffers. For example in my case the first night I have to call the operator two times before the tooth pick gets to me and for the second night, may be because I did not make a second call to ask again, I did not get it.
Review Text

Review Title: Clean and safe place to stay
Review Text: This hotel offers a nice location by the river. I booked a basic room but as a member I got an upgrade to room with a river view. The room was relatively big and it was always clean. They give you two 0.5 liter water bottles per day. It is expensive but so are corresponding hotels in Lagos. This goes also for the food which was bit pricy. The service was good even though one employee tried to over charge me for scanning a document. The hotel has a pretty nice gym with lot of equipment. All in all it was a good stay and I would use the same hotel again if there was a trip to Nigeria.

Nice and clean rooms, excellent fitness center, good internet connection, restaurant buffet to be improved, polite personnel. The hotel is based in a safe location in Lagos very close to the area where most of the business are carried out.

In my opinion, this is probably the best hotel in Lagos. I stayed here for 3 weeks and security was very good when taking into account that one is in the heart of Lagos, Nigeria. The bedroom was comfortable and the restaurant prepared a good buffet selection each night. I would recommend eating at the hotel even though it is quite expensive for Nigeria.

Stayed in the Radisson for a night - and what a disappointing night it was. After collecting our room keys and went up to the rooms we opened the door to find a very unpleasant smell - akin to that of urine and wet carpet. Not a good start.  We went downstairs to ask for a room change (and the Concierge was unapologetic about this inconvenience). After we got the room change we went back up and the air conditioning was not working properly. At this point we figured we would manage seeing as the room didn't stink.  There were more shenanigans to come however. We ordered some food at about 2am (they got our order wrong and then brought up some strange tasting meat masquerading as Suya). Where it got really strange was when we got a call from the Concierge asking us to come pay for

Reviewing this hotel in the context of other hotels in Lagos (and elsewhere in Africa) it is very good. Clean, comfortable and plenty of friendly, helpful staff. The gym looked good (although I only checked it out and didn't use it due to EVD concerns during my visit).   Couple of things stopped me giving this place a higher rating. 1. Rooms smell just a tad damp due to the almost open plan nature of the bathroom, and 2. If you don't want to eat at the buffet the menus at the bars are very limited. 3. There's always an issue trying to connect to the internet with my iPhone.   As someone who really values a nice hotel for travelling I will be requesting my company put me here for future trips to Lagos.

Was very convenient location for me and had all the amenities I was looking for. The breakfast was very good. The fitness center met all my requirements. The staff was helpful and answered questions. Plus you are right on the water.

Quite surprisingly, once I got inside the hotel, I forgot where I was.  Only big reminder for me that I was in Lagos was when I ran water in washroom sink.  Just like any other hotels in Lagos, brownish water is the standard.  Otherwise, room was clean, linen was good, amenity was well replenished, and the stay itself was pleasant.  Internet was not so bad, but not so stable either as power was cut frequently.  But this, you can't complain while in Nigeria.  Breakfast was plenty, and I've really enjoyed some local spicy salad-like vegetables.  It was really good.  (I didn't bother asking what it was called).  Overall, I can recommend this hotel to anybody who's visiting Lagos, and I'm quite sure it would be a better option than other accommodations around.

Found this stay very disappointing for a Radisson and not sure I will rush back.  Several issues were experienced with the room that reflects poorly on quality including TV did not work on two occasions, safe did not work, carpet stained, towels grey. While I requested if I could get a room overlooking the water I was given a smoking room that was not sound proof to the generator resulting in bad nights sleep every night.  The food was not very appealing and certainly not value for money. The room service meal was very disappointing and not even as per the menu - how hard is it to make a toasted sandwich!

A disgrace to the Radisson brand. Everything was substandard, from no guest parking on arrival to lengthy delays at check out. In between we were treated to damp sheets, bad food, poor cleaning, and a shocking lack of responsiveness to any requests. It is a unbelievable they are still in business.

We're currently staying at this hotel while issues at our property in Lagos are dealt with. I'm actually amazed that they're able to charge the price they do with a straight face.  At breakfast, the "cleaning" of the table from the people who ate before us consisted of casually wiping off the crumbs with a used cloth napkin and moving the silverware from the nearby seat to replace the used seat. Cleaning complete!  The breakfast on offer was far below par - stale bread, unappetizing fruit and cold cut selection, and bitter coffee.  After our room was "cleaned", the used washcloth from the night before was still in the shower. We called to have it removed and to have new washcloths brought; that was three phone calls to Housekeeping and an hour ago and we have yet to receive
Review Text

Review Title: Good place to relax, eat and drink
Review Text: I didn't stay at the hotel but I had cause to visit it a few times in a sort of evening bar/ outdoor lounge capacity. Was quite chilled and relaxing but capable of being good fun with the right crowd. Decent cocktails, ok food and prices were a little high but the view and the atmosphere definitely compensated for that.

Located by the lagoon, the hotel is easily accessible within VI and has very warm and helpful staff 24/7. The internet is great and while there would be some evening entertainment on the ground floor, the sound does not get to your room.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. really lovely.our room had 2 big beds and a bay window overlooking the restaurant/pool area and the the lagoon. The Air conditioning was super cold though and we had to call maintenance to have it turned off at a point. Our key card also kept getting deactivated so whenever we went out and came back, we'd have to go to the reception to have it re-activated. The afternoon buffet had a wide variety of tasty dishes and the staff were courteous. My fave section of the hotel has to be the pool area, its super clean and sort of borders the lagoon where we could see some people Jetskiing. The hotel also arranged affordable cab services for us when we needed it. The meals and drinks and minibar are on the pricey side so if u'r really hungry i'd

Very well managed Hotel in a pleasant airy setting that meets International standards. Friendly and helpful staff,good security,high standard of cleanliness. Food is average but better than other hotels.

The whole experience started wrong. I was in Lagos for one day. Arrived early in the morning, and was supposed to have a pickup from the hotel. If you go to Lagos, unless you have a business associate or your own company that can arrange a driver for you a recommend you arrange a pickup through the hotel. Unfortunately the driver was not there. I had to call the hotel and they sent a driver, which they said would take 30 minutes. It took over one hour while I wasted time at the airport. The hotel facilities are relatively new, but the water in the shower was cold. Internet works ok, but it is not very reliable. If you are going to Nigeria be prepared to be exposed to deficient infrastructure. Power outages occurs several times a day, tap water is not safe to drink and traffic is

The hotel's location really sells it, right by the water, blocking out the traffic noise with a lovely pool, which is kept very clean!  The Gym is small but well laid-out and the breakfast buffet is great!  The rooms are spacious, be sure to ask for a sea-view, as there's a little seating area by the window where you can relax and watch the goings-on of the outdoor deck and pool area.   As anything is Lagos, it's an expensive hotel but you are getting very good value-for-money!

I stayed at the radisson for one night while on a business trip, moved from the Sheraton and needed to be on VI for a night.  The hotel was on par with any radisson blu that I've stayed at recently, rooms are comfortable and spacious, overall level of service was really good. There were also a couple of good places to eat nearby which was great, as hotel food does get tiring.  Gladly recommend staying at the hotel should you need to be on VI.

The hotel is extremely expensive in comparison of the service that you would get. I had to stay for business travel and since I was happy with other radisson services in other places, I chose this too. Rooms are fine and cleaning service is really good. But I am afraid the food in restaurant is extremely expensive and the quality is poor. Room service is horrible and they charge you 1000 extra NGN if you order food to be brought to your room! The water in room sometimes had problem. One night I did shower with an orange water!  But have to mention good things too. I also got a complementary wine from hotel in middle of stay which was nice :) Overall, quiet and clean, but if you need to stay longer than few nights, this may not be the best choice.

I love the atmosphere, the services and the people are very warm and friendly. But the food is the problem as the restaurant do not have enough varieties on their menu. I will recommend it to my friends and family. I love the ocean view also.

This is like any other Radison Blu Hotels, however, the service is the best I have seen in any of the Radison Blu hotels in Africa. The food was also excellent on the night I stayed at the hotel as they were offering an international fair of International Curry Night (covering India, Thailand, and others).
Review Text

Radisson Blu Anchorage leaves an aesthetic taste in your mouth, especially if you love art. Starting from the gate of the hotel to the reception to the restaurants, the lagoon front and the rooms. If you can afford it, and you want to have an excellent impression about Nigeria then you should stay in Radisson Blu Anchorage

I had stayed in Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel again on my return travel to Nigeria on 17-08-14 (reservation no: 17244925), hoping that I would have a pleasant stay.I was staying only for a night and did a late check in. The television in the room wouldn't work. When I reported this issued they send a technician and then later informed me would change the TV. Considering that I had to wait longer and that it would take time I opted not to. This is something which should have been done / verified prior checking in of the customer. I found it hard to believe that something like this is happening in a hotel of such reputation and class.  In addition, the payments for both the stays I made (reservation: 17244925, 17244925) was made in advance.Even though this was done, the

A very good 5* Star hotel in Lagos in a great location.  Ultra modern.  Very friendly staff as good as any 5* hotel anywhere in the World with a very few limitations and exceptions.  The water quality in the bathrooms can be a little sub-standard and some of the rooms are showing a signs of normal wear and tear - but in general a very superior experience for a lagos hotel.  The creek side bar and barbeque is also a very pleasant place to watch the world go by or have an informal business meeting.  The grilled prawns are fabulous.

Review Title: Nice, Clean Hotel for Business Travel
Review Text: Nice hotel to stay in Lagos. Clean and the food is good. There was construction in the area while I was there which created traffic around the hotel. Made traveling around during the day not too pleasant. Hopefully all that is over now. The guest was good, they have a generator so no need to worry about NEPA problems. Overall good hotel in the VI area

Review Title: A Wonderful Natural Paradise in Lagos
Review Text: Very Nice, Clean and King size rooms, my Business stay was fantastic with a very good and free Internet Connection!  Congratulations to the Chief as per his wonderful Buffets I really enjoyed the food!  Our Meeting room has a day light and this was so intersting to have a coffee break with a day light!  For ever my Business stays will be at the Radisson Blu Lagos!

Review Title: A Wonderful Natural Paradise in Lagos
Review Text: Very nice, clean and king size rooms!  I also enjoyed the food specially the Buffets and Congratulations to the Chief and staff!  The hotel is really luxurus and very adapted for Business stay specially!

Taking into consideration all the factors (infraestructure, area, resources) this is a very good hotel to stay in Lagos. Water was never clean but it is what it is. Food was good, laundry service great and the personnel were very nice.

It had a great reputation. I was there during a renovation of the restaurant (granted no ones fault) but the air-conditioning was not working in the rooms. Our group reported temperatures of 26 (79) at full AC blast.
