Although the hotel is in a beautiful setting and very beautifully decorated and located, it has really been run down. The hotel smells like a fish market and the corridor carpets are soiled, usually wet and smelly. Some of the rooms are this way too.  Highly not recoomended.

Review Title: First Impression of the Radisson Blu VI Lagos.
Review Text: I found the Hotel very comfortable and the service was friendly and efficient.  I travel extensively and am used to an International standard of Hotel. Therefor I am using a pretty high standard to bench mark the Radisson Blu against.
Review Text

In short, stay at the Four Points by Sheraton if you're looking at the same hotel tier. Or somewhere else. This hotel is really a piece of work. The lobby is very nicely decorated and that gives the illusion that the rooms would be of the same quality. Not really. It's overpriced for what you get.

The location by the water is a plus. Relaxing evenings with live band or other forms of entertainment a welcome addition. Great internet experience for business traveller.  If the power supply could be stabilised then the experience would be much better. Warm hospitable staff. Great food.

Review Title: Regular Business Visitors don’t get appreciation from Anchorage Hotel
Review Text: I stay at the Radisson Blu Anchorage, roughly once a month, for a couple of days in order to do carry out my business in Lagos and the surrounding areas.  On average it is cheerful and acceptable hotel, with the usual painfully high rates due to demand in Lagos, but my last visit was simply awful.  The hotel had a problem with the air-conditioning and instead of being transparent about it on check in they failed to mention it.  On the first night of my stay my hotel room got down to 26.3%, as I assume the central compressor was damaged; only damp smelly air came through the aircon unit, the other three people whom I had recommended the hotel too that met me for breakfast confirmed similar trouble.  The least they could have done is supply some additional bottled water for $500 a

will never stay here .No A/C and No Hot water which are basic needs of person staying in any hotel > room are good . Location is fantastic, Food is great. Staff is Good  but without any authority I guess. Complaints made no difference in improvements  We stayed for  7 nights

this hotel has the best lagoon view at lagos, but somehow maybe 70% of my stays i had been faced with minor problems. The employees starting from entrance are very nice and friendly and always working with a full smile but maintenance of the hotel is poor, and on my last stay there was an AC problem and it was terrible for 3 days. i hope it will be solved very soon because i will be going again this weekend :)

Great location ruined by horrible service and broken air conditioning. waiters did not come to tables unless you begged them.  Asked for a fan that never came.  I will not return to this hotel even though I will be back to Lagos often

All good. Yes.  I didn't have the lagoon view....and the room was very quiet. AC worked well and the staff were friendly, especially Glory at the Front Desk. A very expensive hotel in a surprisingly very expensive city. I used the infinity pool every day I was there, lovely!

One of the better business stop over hotels in Lagos. OK quality and not too much fuss for some one who doesn't like to be hassled by bag carriers and car door openers. Stayed in room 125 and the bathroom ceiling could do with a little work from a previous leak.

...and would stay again. Its nothing special but beyond a Radisson Blu but I do like the bar and resto on the terrace even if the food is nothing special. Internet can be a problem for some but worked fine for me so depends on the room/device. Very quiet and lagoon views an option. Gym is popular with locals. Front office do have a tendency to mess-up bills so worth checking that carefully though they are by no means unique in this regard in Lagos!

I am always amazed how international hotels struggle to achieve consistency - between hotels and even inside a single hotel! Great location, pockets of good service but the place feels run down: aircon struggles and the service at the Front Desk an utter frustration!
Review Text

Better to choose another international hotel. The attitude in front desk people is far below of international level and not worth to pay with such high rate. In addition, the fitness club access is not good. I understand from safety point of view, but user should use stars from own fllow to -1 level - no elevator. And most of  locker ley was broken and no shampoo in the shower booth. I should go back to my room and took shower. Not recommend at all.

I was surprised to see this hotel listed at a relatively lowly 13th on the TA list of Lagos hotels! I   honestly think it deserves to be better ranked than this. I enjoy the sense of space that the waterfront location gives one. That coupled with a large, bright foyer area with adjoining lounge, bar and restaurant make for a pleasant introduction. The location on Victoria Island is a excellent if you are doing business in Lekki, VI and/or Ikoyi. The rooms I have stayed in have all been large well appointed units with river views.  Having a soak in the rim-flow pool overlooking the river with cocktail in hand is a great tonic after a hot day in the city. The restaurant is good but not great but that's not necessarily an issue as the ever-popular Lagoon restaurant/s are just down

Good level of quality but a little bit problem with one touch service in the room to call room service; fortunately reception can take your order.  a part of this, good environment with lagoon and quality service.  I recommend

I've reviewed this hotel on a previous visit and in general, I like the place.  Last time I had trouble with Wi-Fi access but this time it was the air conditioning unit in the bedroom.  The hotel is generally too warm for my liking, but the chiller unit in the room wasn't working and it took me two days to convince anyone that there was a problem.  I would like to thank Paschal who, once on the case, tried another room and when that was no better, searched around the hotel for a cooler room and eventually found one and arranged my transfer, so at least I could sleep for the remainder of my trip. The people make this hotel acceptable, but it needs money spending on it to reach an acceptable standard to be a credit to the Radisson chain. Regretfully, I'll be looking for somewhere

Review Title: Excellent 5 star hotel next to the river
Review Text: Excellent hotel on the island next to Lagos. Helpful staff and nice choice of food. Rooms are clean, personnel is friendly and fitness and swimming pool are more than OK. Received a welcome party from the hotel direction, thanks.

I have stayed at the hotel on a number of occasions the last being about a year ago. The hotel is declining for sure. From the outside it looks great. The deck area is really nice. But.. The rooms are not good the tv doesn't work despite it being fixed it stops again, the shower taps are broken and only work with some really inventive fiddling. The biggest thing for me on this trip is the smell of what I think is paint but not sure. It's a constant smell coming through the vents leading to a huge headache and nausea by the time morning came. The solution was for me to sit outside and grab fresh air. Very disappointing. It's really a pity because this is the best location in Lagos.

Came or drinks at the Radisson Blu on a Thursday night. The hotel offers a lounge bar just past the entrance/ reception space. You can also have drinks on a terrace outside (the backside of) the hotel. The terrace overlooks the waterfront. Unfortunately there is an unpleasant smell that comes off the water - which dampens the experience. There is live music played on the terrace. The ambience is decent, service is not bad, but not good either as staff are sometimes slow & it is often difficult to get services (pretty much all the times I've visited). Pricey (even for Lagos).

This hotel is safe, clean, and in a nice neighborhood. Service is excellent when compared with the expected standards. The best part is the attitude of the staff: wonderful. There are a few sharp edges, including slow internet and blackouts a couple of times day (fortunately lasting only a couple of minutes). Excellent breakfast.  Regarding cost, extremely expensive, but this reflects the fact that Lagos is ridiculously expensive.  My first time in Lagos, nothing to complain about.

I've been putting off this review as I wait for Radisson to respond to a serious security incident that took place at the hotel. Sadly, that has yet to happen, so here goes!   It's a very nice hotel, but I cannot recommend this place because it simply is not safe. Their driving service put me in serious danger with drivers leaving the car in traffic, only to have other drivers take over. This took place several times over several minutes on my way from the hotel to the airport. I insisted several times that only one man be in the car with me and several times, that request wasn't met. I insisted several times that the drivers turn around, and multiple times they refused. The fourth and final driver- an older gentlemen, finally turned around when I started crying. He looked in

Stayed in the Radisson on my first trip to Nigeria and thus little to compare it to.   This is a hotel in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world. There are 17m people in Lagos and thus very important to make sure your hotel is well placed as traffic is a nightmare.  It can take 3 hours to go from the hotel to the airport and it is 40 km away. If your business is in Victoria Island then good choice.  Rooms are decent size and well appointed. All amenities amid good internet connectivity. Nothing to complain about . Try and get a room overlooking the river and should upgrade you if you ask.  Breakfast is good and well presented. Staff are attentive and polite  Gym is OK but nothing special. You need to go through the gRage to get there and you cannot catch the lift
Review Text

Review Title: Great for short business trips to Lagos
Review Text: As with most hotels in Lagos, this is very expensive so don't have expectations of getting what you pay for comparing prices with say Europe or the US. But I guess if you're in Lagos you're probably on business and the hotel is a business expense... if you're looking for value probably look elsewhere. Rating this hotel is therefore relative to other hotels in Lagos!  The hotel is well run, with slick check-in. The a/c in the lobby is under spec'd which means that it's noisy and you have to talk loud over it to be heard, but it looks nice though!  The rooms are a good size, clean enough and the bathroom layout is even a little trendy. The rooms are already starting to smell damp though which I guess is inevitable in Nigeria. The a/c in my room was not working when I checked-in

Review Title: An oasis at the end of a hard day
Review Text: I enjoyed my stay at the Radisson Blu and was always pleased to return after spending my days in the open markets, consumer homes etc. The staff & surroundings were very pleasant, the room comfortable and most times, the food enjoyable.

Very nice hotel, modern, good service. Rooms are very nice, bathrooms are quite flash. Good choice at breakfast and great burgers from the bar. The 'no money laundering' sign in the reception made me laugh.

Went to this hotel in Lagos for drinks and dinner with our Lagos agency after a long day of business reviews.   Location of the hotel is on the water (not the sea), but it's not a pleasant experience sitting outside in the bar area as it smells. The service from the bar is also exceptionally slow.   Moving inside to the Voyage restaurant, it was nice and clean but the food experience (a buffet) was very average and not really enjoyable. You may differ if you like everything with chilli or so well done that it's dry.   Having stated and experienced a few Radisson Blu hotels across the continent, I'm not sure I'll be asking to stay at this hotel in Lagos, in the future, after this introductory experience.

Review Title: The Worst Experience I have Ever Had.
Review Text: It is in the interest of everyone that I write this review. I had a terrible accident on 15th May 2014 in room 106. I slipped in the shower, hit the door then it broke and almost amputated me. The hotel lacked any emergency medical care facilities. The hospital they had wanted to take me to in a car was over an hour away in bad traffic. I had to insist on being taken to a hospital nearby. I saw officials from the hospital only the first couple of days and they have abandoned me here to my fate. I have been in hospital ever since and nobody has bothered to confirm if things got worse or if I have lost my leg. I am a Concierge level Club Carlson member, Sheraton Starpoint Gold Member, Accor Platinum, and Marriott Silver Elite. This is the worst hotel I have ever been in anywhere.

Review Title: Nicely situated rooms need some tender loving care
Review Text: This is the third Radisson Blu I am staying in at this trip. The Hotel as such is very nice, but the room was not as I had expected. I stayed in room G24. The furniture could need a replacement. I could hardly open the cupboard door because it got stuck on the loose wood panel at the bottom. The bathroom was in places rusty and the shower was very slow. From the position the hotel has got I would stay there again, but hope Radisson will renew the furniture in the rooms. The staff on the other hand was very friendly and helpful.

I had to ask to be changed room because of the genset noise right outside of my room. The first night they could not change as the hotel was overbooked, and second night I woke up at 3am and asked them they needed to me move otherwise I would have checked out. Poor internet, and fitness room not up to standard with other hotel on the same price range.

Stayed for 6 nights in Lagoon view room, at 390USD incl. BF.  Lagos in general very expensive, and the value at extreme low level comparing to e.g. Asia (or even  Europe). Checkin fast and friendly. Nice location on VI, next to Lagoon. Rooms nice, but with some issues:  Safe didn't work and took 4 hours to get a staff to come look at the problem. Internet extremely unstable. Shower drain and cubicle poorly designed - lots of water all over the floor after showering. Light in bathroom broke - took 36hrs before they came to replace the bulb.  Breakfast okay. Bad "burnt" coffee, but the food spread fine. Very nice pool. Gym small, but good quality with some weight machines and cardio machines. Different classes in the evening outside (beware mosquitoes and Malaria). Spa in hotel,

Great hotel - great service. Staff feels like family and treats you like royalty. have stayed here a couple of times.  Great view and best swimmingpool for sure. The outdoor area is great for relaxing and client meetings.  There is entertainment 4 nights a week.

I always stay here when I'm in town on business - it's a lovely hotel.  Staff are polite and courteous (apart from the front desk staff who are very curt and dismissive at times), and the rooms on the 3rd floor overlooking the Lagoon are superb.  Security is good, and I always feel safe.  My only gripe is with the choice of food on the menu - where are the local dishes? Chips, burgers, sandwiches and chicken wings I can get anywhere, so more local fare is needed, and imagination! That said, the buffet breakfast is fantastic, and saves the day.  I love the pool, and it has to be seen and experienced. It almost looks as if it continues into the lagoon when you're lounging on the sun beds! Brilliant design.  Will certainly stay again on my next trip to Lagos.
Review Text

only one night stay but one of the most comfortable hotels I have stayed in for ages/ staff could not do enough for our party . meeting room well set out and all requests see too Menu was great choice and quality 2nd to none ...

Review Title: Not bad, but a few issues to report
Review Text: Stayed at the Radisson Blu for 3 nights in March as part of a business trip to Lagos.  This hotel is one of the US embassy recommended properties and there were obvious governmental and other VIP guests in the hotel during my short stay there.  I had a pleasant stay and thought the rooms, the common areas, restaurant and food were all fine.  However we did have significant issues with wireless internet at one point which makes it a little difficult to do your job when you rely on 100% up-time.  I also wanted to mention that the checkout process left a definitely bad impression with me.  As their wireless was out for a significant amount of time, they sent up a LAN cable to my room to see if a hard-wire connection would help (it didn't).  At check out they asked if I had the

I must say that this hotel and its staff have upped their game over the last year.  Staff attentive and professional, location great, food delicious. It is clean, feels safe and friendly and if the band would play less commercial music it would be absolutely perfect!

Review Title: Beautiful grounds but customer service needs improvement!
Review Text: I recently stayed at the Radisson Blu Anchorage Hotel in Lagos for business for a couple of weeks.   The Pros: The hotel itself, including the location, decor, views, cleanliness and atmosphere are really nice.  The gym is also nice and well-equipped.  The pool, even though I didn't use it, was nice.  As for the concierge, Douglas and Yusuf really stood apart and made my stay very pleasant, as they were helpful and accommodating!  A couple of the View Bar staff were very nice as well (I don't remember their names, though).   The Cons: First, the receptionists need to be trained on proper customer service!  They didn't return phone calls when they said "I'll call you right back", and I felt that I was bothering them. Check-in and check-out also took longer than expected.

The hotel is located in a nice environment within the Victorial Island with ease of commuting to other part of the island.  WIth other hotels around, Radisson blu stand tall.  The staffs are excellent and corteous in services couple with the cleaness and serene environment

Wanted to try the Radisson in another country, nicely surprised, hôtel has got nice rooms with bath and shower place, free wifi, swimming pool, fitness, the restaurant is quite diversified and good, they have a la carte menu or a buffet. I tried the buffet, there was a lot of choices between continental and local food. The Best way to try another cuisine which I did, the buffet change, first day I was not very attempted and eat from the menu card, got the famous Nigerian snails, worth trying it and some seafood linguine, but the second day was quite good. There is also an outdoor restaurant if you like to enjoy the view. So I would recommended this hôtel.

I have stayed at the Anchorage a few times in the past two years and rate it highly for the standards of service, cleanliness and the comfort of the room.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is in an excellent location by the river.

Review Title: Reasonable place, just make sure you eat out
Review Text: I've stayed at the Radisson Anchorage several times, the hotel itself is very smart, the rooms are clean and spacious and the deck out the back overlooking the lagoon is fantastic for relaxing after a tough day with a cold beer and some live music. I would however suggest avoiding the food, the menu is very limited, with average quality Western style cuisine and a handful of local specialities that are best avoided if you plan to do anything the following day.  The location fit for me due to the nature of my business, but VI isn't the most accessible place and although the road in front of the hotel has now been fully opened, traffic snarling around just outside can make it problematic to get in/out.

Not very impressed with the water situation.  I am sure water was not as clean as it is supposed to be and also they had no water on my first day of arrival.  Internet connection is not the greatest and as a muslim I am not bring able to get a straight answer from the stuff if the meat and chicken are halal.

While the rooms are huge and clean as per Radisson standards the hotel location is terrible and service absolutely appalling. The service at the reception from was bad with the gentleman there being very brush and arrogant.  The hooting on the road outside can be clearly heard from within the front facing rooms and if you happen to be as 'lucky' as I was to be given the room next to the elevators and vehicle drive through you'll end up having a terrible time.  Frankly for a loyal club Carlson customer to be treated this way then something must be very wrong.  No way am staying here again.
Review Text

Excellent Hotel. Great deck and ambiance. Very good restuarant food and friendly staff. Has a good gym facility with Spa and a stunning pool. Good bar with live music entertainment. Spa facilities and taxi's to take you to any external facilities.

Review Title: Brown water, internet not working in the room
Review Text: When thinking about my stay there, I feel dirty. This is the first time I had to take a shower into a water full of mud or... Hope I did not catch anything there. Really awful. When you consider that I paid about USD400 a night... To add to the misery, the internet was not working from my room, and I had to connect in the lobby. But the water issue is really not acceptable for any hotel of that star rating. What a disgusting place... The only thing that seemed nice was the breakfast. I am not coming back, even for free!

Review Title: Great hotel but work is needed
Review Text: This was my second stay at the hotel and it was great. The rooms are huge, well equipped and secure.   The bathrooms are well stocked with amenities and towels provided are of a good quality and white :-)   The common areas are a sanctuary from Lagos however there are just too many prostitutes hanging around who are not scared to walk up to guest - tip, don't dine alone :-)   The bar area and restaurants on the deck overlooking the lagoon is the hotels draw card. Amazing views and very relaxing.   All in all a good stay and would return again.

Totally disorganised as one would expect in this chaotic grim city but a hidden jewel really as the waterside deck and pool area is very decent.The service is, of course, embarrassing but the setting makes up for everything.

Not a real 5 Star hotel, but tastefully decorated in line with other Radisson Hotels globally. Very pleasant foyer with a classy and stylish entrance leading to lovely restaurant and outside deck seating. Overlooks the lagoon, which gives it a lovely setting and pleasant atmosphere for evening sundowners. Wi-fi free for guests but on the slow side and connectivity a little annoying at times. Rooms are large and spacious, elegant with plush carpets and a large bath area with great shower and bath. Very comfortable bed. Smoking rooms available. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was full continental with a great selection that one is accustomed to in a Radisson Hotel. Earned myself some points with my club card...

Review Title: Blocked out funds which still haven't been released ten days later
Review Text: I have stayed here 6 times now. It's still a good hotel (typically expensive but welcome to Lagos) BUT this time I am extremely angry. I checked in for 2 nights and they 'blocked out' NGN 200,000 (about USD1,300) on my card. I asked them why as there was no way I was going to spend that much for a 2 night stay. I got a feeble excuse. When I paid the bill 2 days later (30th January) it was NGN 169,000 (smug face). They said the original funds would immediately be unblocked. The transaction number is even the same. It's now 10th February and the funds are still blocked so effectively they have close on USD2,460 of mine - for 2 nights. I have Radisson Customer Service on to this but if this is the way I am going to be treated by Radisson (as a Club Carlson member too) then I am

I visited the hotel twice to have lunch and dinner. I have not stayed at this hotel. However the look and feel is modern. It has a lovely terrace for sundowners and atmosphere is always welcoming. The cuisine caters for European and local taste buds. The reception area is well organized. The finishes are tasteful through the public areas. I will recommended lunch or dinner at this hotel

Although not really a five star hotel, it is still one of the best places to stay in Lagos. Very friendly and helpful service, clean and well-kept rooms with comfortable beds. Good modern AC in the rooms. The breakfast buffet is very good even if the room it is served in is a bit on the small side. Enjoying dinner on the terrace overlooking the lagoon is almost worth the price.

The kind and willing staff make up for the hotel's rooms and facilities which are not really a 5 star level. The location is  convenient for business and leisure in the areas of VI, Lekki and Ikoyi . A highlight of the hotel is no doubt the outside bar overlooking the lagood where live music is performed a few times a week.

checked in on the evening of the 15th January..... No water in the pipes..... Called reception, was told they were working on the problem.... Called again at 23h55 was told water would be back on in 10 minutes, next morning 16th, 6am.... Still working on it, will definitely be turned on in 10 minutes, at 8.45am I had to leave the hotel , to attend meetings.... Still no water.....12 hours in Lagos with no shower, no toilet, thank you Radison blu Lagos!!
Review Text

The staff at RB were very accommodating and the hotel was clean at first sight.  Of course, it was a bit pricey given the type of people who work in Lagos. However, I enjoyed my stay.  The breakfast buffet had lots of options to choose from as well as dinner. I enjoyed the fact that the theme of the restaurant changed from seafood one day to something else the next.  The rooms were very clean and I slept comfortably, nevertheless, a view away from the power generator would have been nice. :)  Thanks for your hospitality RB, hope to be back again.

Rooms fine.  Nothing special, but big enough, clean enough, and laid out well enough.   A bit noisy on the top floor though.  I'd ask for one on level 1 or 2 next time.  Aircon unit was quite noisy on top floor (as it is in the reception area).  I enjoyed the back decking area, with bar, restaurant and great place to sit and enjoy some outside time with a view over the water.  Good breakfast and ok menu for dinner - not a bad t-bone steak.   Not cheap though, surprised at the price.  Good Gym.

High standard of facilities and above average service in the hotel. Food is great and the rooms are very clean and spacious. The service staff are attentive enough and don't have to wait ages at the check in or out counter  Overall stay was a pleasant experience

Review Title: Excellent hotel with fantastic lagoon view
Review Text: Its right in the heart of Victoria Island, Lagos. No doubt on cleanliness and service, but it got fantastic chill-out place with seating area beside the lagoon. Also, with infinite swimming pool you will feel amazed. Dinner inside the hotel is ok, but other amenities are excellent.

Very secure hotel with good compound security at gates,  Hotel is very modern, with infinity pool by the water with amazing views, bar and restaurant with patio on the water, band and music at night, awesome variety for breakfast, etc.   Promos, including bathrooms, are very modern, clean  with all needed amenities. Delivery of iron and board on request. Quick room service.

Stayed for two nights on business.  Good facilities, clean and secure.  Food was good (breakfast buffet - very enjoyable).  Plenty of space to hold meetings in the lobby lounge area.  Arranged cars without any issues.

Excellent for business and relaxation. Great rooms, safe and secure, fine food and drinks and a serene location by the river. Very high standards all around. Negatives would be surly staff at reception, lack of non-smoking rooms and very few international (UK and US) TV channels. Too many 'ladies' in the bar also make guests feel uncomfortable at times - management should sort this out. That said, I would highly recommend this place.

Its been 2 years now I have been regularly staying at this hotel during my visits to Lagos. In a city where star hotels are most expensive, Radisson Blu offers the best value for money in all respects. Location is excellent to get in and out of the bustling Victoria Island, good rooms, warm hospitality and the view from the rooms lagoon side.   They have a decent spa and gym. The swimming pool is awesome.

My first trip to Lagos - I only stayed a night.  Most liked the design/layout of the hotel, the infinity pool, the outdoor restaurant and breakfast. I really enjoyed the 'sweet' bread and the omelette. Think at busy times they should have two omelette chefs on duty.  I was approached by two spa ladies and handed their brochures but didn't stay long enough to take advantage of a massage! Rooms were very clean and quiet; staff were obliging and very pleasant. A  I will be back next month and will definitely stay here again, and recommend in. I hope the new Radisson in Freetown, Sierra Leone will be of similar standard.

This was my first trip to Nigeria  The airport experience was unique and eye opening.   Happy to check into a familiar western branded hotel.  This is a relatively new hotel but the state of the hotel suggests it is older.   Strengths  1. Felt safe 2. Nice view right on the waterfront.  3. Close to business district   Areas for improvement 1. Check in lady looked and sounded irritated to welcome guests. Not a good way to form an impression.  2. Breakfast and buffet spreads do not change. I was  already getting tired of the meal choices by the second day.   3.  This is not particular to the hotel but frequent power outage not reassuring even though auxiliary power kicked in straight afterwards.  4.  Held meetings but getting things delivered and executed in the function room was
Review Text

In my several stays @ Radisson Blu Anchorage, the front desk staff has always treated me as if I were interrupting their day by checking in. Last 3 stays, they insisted that the only available room was one next to the generator. The melamine around the jambs of the hallway doors is chipped on this relatively new hotel. The bath water is the color of weak tea. The room service food selection is limited and what they bring is low quality.   On the bright side, the terrace over the lagoon is pleasant, often has good music. The breakfast buffet is sumptuous.

Review Title: A few hectic nights at Radisson Blu
Review Text: As always in Nigeria you live through power outages, funny phone and Internet Connections etc. At Radisson where they have improved both the water and power since I was last here in November 2012 you still get a relaxed time with alot of interesting guests willing to connect.  Enjoying your Star beer over looking the river you can have good Food and endless conversations. Not to mention the faboulus buffet at the evenings and live bands playing.  For me though its on the upperscale of the Price Segment.  Try it and lets see your Review...

Review Title: Fine place to stay in Lagos
Review Text: This is an average hotel, but for Lagos it is definitely a fine place to stay. You can have business meetings in the lounge or terrace. The venue is well known among local business people so you can have business meetings in the lounge. At some evenings there is an entertainment program on the terrace. What I definitely recommenв is to hire boat and have an hour tour around Victoria Island and to the ocean. You will see some amazing views over Lagos. Food is below average - but there is a cool restaurant, popular among expatriates, in 500 meters down the street.

Lagos is quite a hurly burly place, so the hotel offers a bit of a respite. It is expensive but that's to be expected. Room was big, bed comfortable, clean and tidy. Shower ok, only lukewarm water at the sink. Bar terrace overlooks the water, good spot for cold beer at the end of the day. Food a bit dull, breakfast uninspiring.....HOWEVER, when you see the rest of the city, the hotel seems like a miracle. Nice friendly staff. Some 'interesting' clients in the bar. The power outages and connectivity interruptions are a city wide phenomenon. Just be glad you're in here, not out there with the 20million+ residents.

Review Title: Pleasant niche, uber priced for gaps in service
Review Text: Lagos is teaming so a pleasant niche by the water with a cool terrace offered respite for 10 day business stay. Gym and pool are definite assets. But internet was hit and miss - as another reviewer noted - notwithstanding the uber priced room rate...my colleague's dysfunctional safe was never changed, after promises; my side of 1st floor had only adjoining rooms so the fun and games next door over the weekend were ever so present. The menu is reasonable when ordered at the restaurant; though the morning buffet with canned fruit and apparently instant coffee did not fly high. Warm staff, must be said.

Getting rather concerned with Radisson. This is the 2nd hotel in the last few weeks which has had significant internet problems (the last one was in Delhi). This is a business hotel and carries the 'free high speed internet' messaging everywhere - including my key card holder. I am not expecting the 'high speed', but the minimum has to be a consistent constant service. It's the second day now the service is at best intermittent - we had a meeting here at the hotel today and all the presenters had to avoid using internet in their demos. At $350+ a night it's the most expensive Radisson I've stayed in - for that you expect the basics and as a business traveller, after water and electricity internet is a must.   I think I may have to employ the 'three strikes' rule - next Radisson

Review Title: Good place to be for a few days
Review Text: I spent 5 days in the Radisson Blu, for meetings and a workshop.  Didn't see much else of Lagos except the airport, but have to say I did enjoy the stay at the Radisson.  Rooms were quite comfortable and spacious, and staff generally tried hard and were certainly very nice.  I got a little tired of the buffet food, but ordering from the menu seemed better.  Drinks and music in the Surface Bar was a great way to round out the day!  Also, the pool was lovely.  Be prepared, though, for periodic power outages, spotty wifi connectivity, high prices for just about everything, and sometimes slightly inattentive staff - all things that seem to be quite normal in Lagos.

I had a lovely experience at this hotel. The service & amenities were very good. The food was decent and the shower/bathroom was superb. It was a get away from all the hustle & bustle of life in Lagos with my wife. Yes its a bit expensive but which decent hotel in Lagos isn't? All in all, a great hotel experience for me and my wife. Certainly recommend the hotel.

Anywhere in the world this would be a tired 3 star property, in Lagos, it is one of the better options to stay. Room was clean and everything worked, including the wifi (up to 3 devices) however the outages can be a nuisance although to be fair the on-site gen set kicks in right away. Service is good, attentive and eager to please. A lot of staff in the restaurants dressed like waiters but not necessarily waiting tables - seemed like they employ as many waiters as there are tables. Nice terrasse / patio restaurant, the smell from the canal requires some getting used to. An annoying detail is that none of the European-issue credit cards with a chip worked at checkout. An older chip-less debit card did the trick...

The price is too much and not correspondant to the service prsented. I visit this hotel several times during last 2 years and obviouslly you can note that hotel didn't become so good as it was before.
Review Text

Review Title: Things are not as good as they seem
Review Text: Attractive looking hotel inside and outside; low rise building next to the Lagoon, well located and decent brand. All the facilities are there and often things go well, but not all of the time.  I had 6 nights and issues included - no wifi on the first day; television that didnt work on 2 mornings and then had to be replaced; phone call from reception on the last night after midnight that woke me up, asking if I am extending my stay; wi-fi not working on the last morning; issues over the room price on the last night.  The food in the restaurant was fine and in fact much better than previous times when IO had eaten here. The staff in the bars and restaurants were very attentive and keen to please - far more than the reception staff.  The room size was more than adequate and

Review Title: Everything one would expect - at a price!
Review Text: Its a Radisson inside and out and one could be in any city perched on the lagoon and well away from the hustle and bustle that make Lagos what it is. This could be taken as dissapointing but as any business or frequent traveller to Lagos will attest, it's great to get back to a hotel where things work with predictability. The rates are serious (approx £300/night) but don't expect to get value-for-money at those rates, the Radisson and its local competitors are exploiting the lack of serious competition and the growing foreign demand. Nice lagoon-side pool and with the sunset one can imagine being almost anywhere BUT Lagos!

Attractive hotel in a good location (overlooking the lagoon) with generally nice facilities (pool, gym, spa, outside bar/restaurant) and nightly entertainment (at least on the nights I was there). Staff were attentive and eager to please and friendly, so not problems there. Key issue is how the facilities work.  The hotel advertises its free Wi-Fi for guests, but don't stay in the room I had because there was little or no coverage (had to place iPad by the basin to get a connection and couldn't connect the iPhone at all). Despite reporting this to the front desk, there was no improvement.  The hotel has just opened its Golf Bar and there is no coverage there.  When traveling in such locations, the facilities in the hotel become very important to stay on top of communications and

Review Title: A very efficient and comfortable hotel
Review Text: I had dinner here last time I was in Lagos but this was my first stay at the hotel. It is a very efficient hotel - except that the printers didn't work when I was checking out!  Staff are very friendly and the hotel has all of the usual amenities of a business hotel. There is a bar outside that sits on the banks of the river and at this time of year the weather was very pleasant....as was the traffic because the schools are in holiday!  Good value and a hotel that I would recommend.

Review Title: 4-star at least considering you are in Africa
Review Text: One night stay at this relatively safe haven in the wild west African city of Lagos. In fact, didn't find it as bad as the media will make you believe but make sure you know what you are doing here, or at least head out with someone who knows what he is doing. You dont belong to be out there after dark, and the pool has a nice bar and terrace looking over the lagoon for entertainment in the evening. Room was clean with nice bed and bathroom. Location at one of the best and most expensive neighborhoods of the city. Expensive though.

I stayed at the Radisson for a few nights in July and found the service, attitude of the staff and rooms all of a high standard.  The food on the pool deck was good (a little pricey) but allowed for an enjoyable experience.  The hotel gym is okay.  They offer other services like outdoor aerobics but don't advertise this well.  Loved the pool...

I had the opportunity to spend time at the poolside, service was good. I will surely visit the poolside again. Though I  am not sure the live music is a good idea reason being the noise for guests. That's only reason I would not lodge in the hotel. The bathroom was very clean, the swimming pool was very nice

I spent 1 night at the hotel and it was surprisingly pleasant.. The decor, the vibe, and the location were all top-notch. The views of the lagoon were very nice, although the smell sometimes made sitting outside a tad bit uncomfortable.  Service was adequate, staff were friendly, but the building appears to be deteriorating slowly; probably from a lack of maintenance.  I had no got water to take a shower in the morning, and for done strange reason the water from the taps was brownish.    Breakfast was a well-laid out buffet, and it's free for a single guest.  This is a really good hotel; it isn't great yet.

I have traveled to Lagos since the mid seventies and I have seen the city grow in both size and choice of accommodation. The choice is, now, exsensive although it comes at a price. During my most recent visit I was lucky enough to stay at the Radisson Anchorage on Victoria Island. The hotel is close to the business center of Lagos and close to a few good restaurants and expat bars.  Driving time to and from the airport can vary, greatly, depending on what time you depart. The hotel itself is a modern design and has a number of eateries and bars. The riverside bar is particularly good and they serve a number of different local and import beers. The menu of spirits is quite impressive. Service is good but I fold the bar menu food to be disappoint with the food being bland and, at

Review Title: Great place to spend a day by the pool
Review Text: If you're in Lagos for work or pleasure then the Radisson is a great place to spend the day at the pool. The staff are great and very friendly, the food is good and consistent and the view and pool are lovely. The chicken burger is a particular favourite.
Review Text

Ave been coming to Lagos now for some time and stayed at various hotels, but the radisson is now my best choice, check in was smooth, smoking room as requested, perfectly sized room, breakfast was good and included in the rate, the hotel tends to get festive on the weekends with a band and a dj till late, dinner -the buffet was well priced and of very good quality, I would recommend this hotel safety wise and being very close to all major restaurants / shopping areas around Victoria Island. One note please stick to your Visa Card as Mastercards work off and on and Amex is unheard off.

I stayed 4 nights and had a good experience overall. It is safe, the rooms are spacious, The bathroom too with separated shower, bath and toilet behind a wall within the bathroom, that gave good privacy.  My room was very clean, and I had a good desk to work and a good closet for the cothes as well as a safetycase.  Internet worked well most of the time. Occasionnally there were too many trying tinconnect and slowed down. The Fitness club is small but sufficient for my needs.  Breakfast was good, and with plenty of choices.  At night, we could eat by the pool and lake and this was too very nice. Just that the menu was really limited.  They did not accept AMEX which made it complicated for me, also it is quite expensive.  Unfortunately, the view of my window was facing the

Nothing super special but good quality overall. Great location, Good service. All good hotels in Lagos are rather pricey compared to equivalents in other global cities. However, pricing is about average for local comparable hotels.  Nice view of the bay, with window seats in the room. Large bathroom, separate tub and shower, though water did not get very hot. Nice indoor/outdoor bar. Breakfast was good, lots of hot and cold selections.

I guess this is a kind of hotel that brings the Radisson Blu chain to disrepute.  I had organised a meeting for almost 50 people and the service I received was disgusting. All the hotel staff care about is money. The hotel too is only focused on filling the coffers vs. offering service.  The hotels location is great but given the  security concerns and restriction in movement the hotel offers little in terms of extras to kill time. The setting is idyllic just by the water front. Security nice, Rooms are super, especially the water facing ones.   Upon checking in I was given a twin bed room despite the fact I had a request for a double bed. Upon being polite and nice I was told that there was one room with double bed available which was water facing . I was later informed after I

As a matter of fact, I have been back here twice in the last three months, and that much I love this hotel. The major reason been the closeness to the area where my attention is required, Lagos VI. However, this platform does not allow one to effect a review until a period of three months have elapsed.  The last time around within the month had involved the need to have a suite for my 'Principal', as well as a business one for myself. All was ok on the 300 level. However, when he arrived to check into his room, there was these not so pleasant odour from wherever. An immediate request was made to the Hotel Management, and another suite on the ground floor was sorted out at a jet speed, and with some apologies for the inconviniences. That was what the service encapsulated in

Review Title: Bliss, or something close to it.
Review Text: I just came back from a fun weekend with friends/colleagues and yes, Radisson Blu ticked most of the right marks.   Check-in was smooth, but please if you are hoping for an early check-in, speak with the supervisors and be sure it is complimentary, else they might charge your account! Then the fast Internet connection, which was complimentary, will count as another big plus.   Breakfast was cool, the ambience by the pool-side was worth every minute, and the live band, and his video DJ effects was top class.   The scoop of the trip was actually having to book online! The rates are much cheaper and do make sure you go for a Business room, with lagoon view, which gives you access to the Business Lounge. Not as if there's much in there, though.

We stayed in a room facing the water and the pool, the live band played the loud music by the pool all night long. The windows were not well isolated.  Sleeping with earplugs is not what you'd expect to do at a good hotel.  The room was clean and spacious - large king size beds and marble floor throughout. Separate bath tub and shower stall in the bathroom, but running water turned yellow.  Complimentary Wifi, bottles of water, nespresso machine are big pluses; the staff were generally friendly and helpful.   The breakfast lacks selections and the serving staff not too enthusiastic.   Extra fees for airport transfers which was contracted to a 3rd party.  Make sure you confirm the airport pickup time prior to arrival or have someone waits for you as it gets very chaotic when

In my time spent in Lagos, I visited the bar and the restaurant of this hotel with friends several times. The bar area and the restaurant are of a high standard, busy with a good atmosphere. On each occasion I went were in the evenings; sitting outside for drinks just before we went into the restaurant to eat was great. As I state in the title I have not stayed at the Radisson Blu but the hotel lobby looks pretty impressive with its elaborate art work and as you walk in, you are hit with its real interesting vibe.

I have stayed at this hotel on a regular basis and it is excellent,the staff and management are friendly and helpful,the ambience is relaxed but businesslike and the terrace is a haven with world class live music some evenings.The standards of cleanliness and housekeeping are high and security is discreet but ever present.The rooms are bright and airy with the front ones having fine views,however they could do with more wardrobe,cupboard and drawer space. The restaurant is good for Lagos with a wide choice. I have great respect for the management for consistently maintaining high standards in the challenging environment of Nigeria.

This hotel has a very welcoming ambience. Love the outdoor/terrace bar and the live band too. Very clean rooms and excellent service. I have stayed at this hotel more than three times and will definitely go back.
Review Text

Nice outdoor hotel bar overlooking the sea. Loud music when the live band is on but that's pretty standard for Africa. Good clean rooms and good service. Hotel restaurant staff are excellent but food is alright (good by normal Nigerian standards though).

Review Title: Nice and Friendly Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: This hotel have nice team @ reception and very friendly enviroment. The outdoor bar is amazing place to have a drink or food on the beach side. I have enjoyed my 3 days stay and for sure I will stay again at this hotel.  This hotel is good for business stay specially when you travel alone.

I checked in at the Radisson Blu Hotel because I had heard good things about the hotel. I was there partly for business, and partly for pleasure and needed to ensure my time away from home was comfortable.  I arrived early, and so was checked in immediately. I thought that was quite kind of the. Until I was informed AFTER checking me in that they had charged an extra 50% to my bill. I was tired after a long flight so didn't make too much of a fuss.  The room was lovely and so was breakfast, however there was no Hot water to have showers in the building!!! I called all day and kept being promised that it was being fixed Now. 24 hours later there was no improvement. It suddenly dawned on me they were aware of the situation but didn't want to confess to it. The amazing thing was

i was staying at Radisson Blu, Lagos for 5 nights in April 2013. The Hotel was very well maintained, the security was good and the break fast was a good spread. The hotel is on the lake front and has a fantastic view. There is an infinity pool, which  is also nice. The house keeping is good and the staff are pleasant and well trained.

Review Title: Not good value for money and starting to get run down
Review Text: I've been going to this hotel for a while.  It's difficult to complain about the price because all of the hotels in Lagos are pricey.  However, the rooms over the last two years have increasingly shown a lot of wear and tear and is starting to look run down.  The surface bar is a nice place to grab a drink, but watch out for the smell of the river at certain times of the day/year.

It is difficult to go to places where you know the majority of the population are living in dire poverty, and you catch yourself thinking; wonder what the housing of the people serving you is like?  In order to procure the kind of services and amenities that are taken for granted in other parts of the world, a high price has to be paid by the service provider.  So all the amenities of a 5 star hotel are provided and to a high standard in a difficult operating environment.  That said - don't put me (an asthmatic) in a smoking room and claim that is what I ordered!  Don't tell me there are no other rooms, only when you are really pushed you find a suite.  OK, it stank of cat pee... but as there were no cats I assume it was ammonia based cleaning products.  The hallway in that wing

Review Title: Flashy and good service but room for improvement
Review Text: It looks good and the location is good.   A few niggles: as a vegetarian the food options are very limited and the standard is average - no wow factor. The shower was not always hot.  Having said that the staff were great and helpful, and a good place to relax in the evening after a long day at the client.  The rooms were light with great bed/ linen. I'd recommend anchorage view/ side.

I spent five nights in Radisson. it is very small and cosy hotel with good security close to the water. Food is good and hotel service is as well. Live music is great and crowd is sort of upper class local and expat crowd.

The pros: -Good location -Nicely decorated and relatively clean (only two years old) -Great view from the rooms  Cons: -Service is very slow and most of the time you do not get what you ask for -Very small gym -Food generally less than average

Review Title: Good location, nice facilities, excellent service!
Review Text: We stayed at the Radison Blu Anchorage for 5 days during our family vacation to Lagos.    Although we are accustomed to the overpriced hotel market in Africa, Lagos' was certainly unreasonably expensive by far.     So by Lagos' standard, the Radison Blu Anchorage was a good value.    The staff was consistently courteous, attentive, friendly, and professional.  The hotel is located right on the river bank and in a fairly low traffic area.    Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the river, and on the far end away from the bar that is noisy at night.  (We suggest you ask for similar room location).   The room was spacious, has a floor-to-ceiling wrapped around glass window with nice seating bench and comfy cushion.     The bathroom has good facility, but dark and has rather poor
Review Text

Review Title: Good but overprices and not up to the Radisson standard...
Review Text: Being  a Club carlson Gold Member i decided to try out this property which is a little under 2 years old... The Property is beautiful, the location was a bit difficult to get to because of a. Usual Victoria Island traffic and b. Current road works going on in the area.  The check in was smooth without any problems, i had requested for a non smoking room but nothing was available, i have always been upgraded in Radisson hotels in the past which is probably the reason i kept going back however it was not the case at this property as they claimed to be completely full... They were however kind enough to have the room refreshed for me to avoid the cigarette smell however it could not be avoided as soon as you walk into a smoking room. Usualy at other hotels they would easily

All mod cons, great river fronting terrace. Food is OK, not great and yes it is quite expensive but then you pay for good security and a prime location in Nigeria. I was there on business and all my local contacts wanted to come to the hotel which is normally a good sign...and saved me having to sit in endless traffic jams! Only one gripe, the wifi is weak and you have to keep logging in...

On the positive side, the hotel is well located and the location by the river is good for a few drinks outside. However, my experience was not great. I booked a no-smoking room but there were none available. The first room I was in was right next to the security door that connects the room landings with the main atrium area - this door slams shut every time someone goes through it and after a while it drives you nuts. I moved rooms but if you are on the road side of the building you end up looking out on to the building where they house the generator. When the generator gets going the whole room vibrates and the noise, despite the double glazing, is pretty disruptive.  Having said that, the room was reasonably clean and well appointed. Breakfast is OK but nothing special  There

Hotel was really an oasis in Lagos. Very well located, very nice and very clean. Breakfast was quite acceptable and service was very good. Security was OK. A bit too expensive but all good hotels are expensive in west African countries.

Spent a week at a business conference. Attentive staff. Good food; well-managed service in restaurant covering needs of several meetings. Room service arrived quickly and hot. Beautiful view of lagoon from ground-floor meeting room. Would have been nice to have had opportunity to view lagoon from room—will request water view next time. Nicely-sized rooms. Comfortable beds. Hallway carpets could stand being replaced.

Review Title: Bussiness Trip Experience at the Raddisson
Review Text: I stayed at the Radissons  during a Bussiness Trip to Lagos  at the above stated period which was the second time. The hotel location and structure is superb with outdoor Lagoon view pool and Spa, the furnishing however have started to depreciate considering it wasn't long in existence with international affiliation. The staff attitude is mixed at the reception with tendency to be more hospitable only with ..... which I observed on my two visits. The check in time duration can be unnecessary lengthy. The hotel prices also seem to go up every six months which makes it somewhat overpriced compare to staying in same class of hotel abroad.  On the positive, the hotel is well located and ideal for Bussiness situated on the Island and close proximity to Heart of Lagos Bussiness

Review Title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service
Review Text: Having had a nasty experience at the Lagos Airport Hotel where the Room Cleaner stole my Wallet, I have vowed NEVER to stay at just any hotel again but the best. Just what I had with my staying in the wonderful hotel over the weekend.  Everything about the hotel was great, and with no complaint whatsoever. Thanks to the management for provisioning such an enabling environment. I love great bathrooms, and there was one ! Just a note though, and that is with the internet service provision. I had to rely on my MiFi, and which was even operating at 2G.

Probably the best regular full service hotel in Lagos until the new Intercontinental opens (supposed to be April 2013)  The hotel tries- the rooms are ok, comfortable enough beds.  No Irons or boards in room, rooms do have refrigerators with some food, no stationery in the rooms. The water has a strong scent of Iron in it.  Located in a safer area - Victoria Island.

Review Title: Radisson Anchorage: Good Business Hotel in Lagos
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel several times during the last 2 years.  It is in a very nice location, the rooms are good designed & equipped and clean. Facilities such as the gym, pool & several bars are really nice. Breakfast is good and offering everything you need (for Western style). Service is ok, they helped me once getting some clothes for the gym within a few hours. The price is (as usual for Nigeria) very high, but compared to other hotels worthy.

Review Title: More interested in money than good service
Review Text: I came to the hotel on business, having read the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Our experience was the exact opposite of those highlighted here.  My colleague and I arrived for check-in at around 10.30 am and needed to quickly change into our work clothes for a meeting. We were told by a quite abrasive lady at the reception named Julie that in order to use the room for those 5 minutes, we would have to pay half the room rate, as official check-in was at 2pm! I pleaded with the lady to at least offer me another viable alternative in which to change clothes, but she kept repeating that I either had to pay those rates, or wait until 2pm. She proceeded to lecture us about how it was obvious that no hotel in the world would allow us to check in 'early' without charging us, citing
Review Text

A very nice brand new hotel close to the river on Victoria island ! Very acceptable price for Lagos and nice service . The only bad thing is quality of food in global and poor breakfast I will come back next time for sure

I used to live in Lagos the last few years and radisson blu, was my regular stop over on weekends, the outside bar and inside bar was excellent. the food was one of its best in Lagos... the ambiance excellent.. would highly recommend this place to everyone..

Review Title: This is one of the best hotels in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed here a few times now and highly recommend it.  You can pay the same price in Lagos and get something that is not as nice.  It is a business hotel, keeps power even during the rolling blackouts, decent internet, good hotels and a nice deck looking over the river to have a beer after work.

Review Title: Good for business trips in Lagos
Review Text: As many have noted, there are no great hotels in Lagos, but the Radisson Blu is decent.  Close to many of Lagos' business destinations.  Modern and up up to date, it doesn't have the level of services one might expect from a first class hotel, but most of the necessities are there (but no gift shop, spa, gym, etc) and the staff are OK.  Not a rave review, perhaps, except when compared to the rest of the hotels in Lagos.

Review Title: Looks good from the outside, but a little disappointing overall
Review Text: In my previous trips I have always come for drinks outside on the deck and have always wished I had stayed there instead of the Federal Palace. This time I was booked at the Radisson Blu and have to say I was a little disappointed. While the reception area is quite impressive, the rooms I felt were really below the average of what I would expect in a Radisson - with the only highlight being the daybed that they have near the window, and was nice to relax it. When you walk down the corridors they have an industrial feel that you would not associate with a high end hotel like the Radisson Blu.  The food at the hotel is really dreadful. There was barely ever a meal that I could finish- and I do not exaggerate when I say this. The cocktails that they make at the bar area are sub-par

Review Title: Ultra-modern property, like a W hotel
Review Text: Flat screen tvs in a console purpose-made for it. Attractively appointed, spacious room. Power goes out frequently, then comes right back on.  Can't be good for electrical devices, or for the generators upon which the property, like most of this modern, energy-producing, wealthy country, depends.  Upscale amenities, even in regular room. Public areas are trendy, like a W hotel.

the rooms are very nice and clean, BF is ok but not extra ordinary, coffee is desgusting. The dinner buffet is good, with a good variation of food, also a la carte is nice and honest food. The service is terrible, 30minutes waiting for your drink at the bar is normal and there where almost no people at the bar, check-in takes more then half an our even i arrived alone, pool is very well located, with a good view and nice chairs, the only problem is that you can't use it before 12 o 'clock(cleaning men starts cleaning around 9 and it takes hours to finish), overal the hotel was good.

If you are frightened of going to Nigeria, this is the place for you! Don't get me wrong, it's a fine hotel - the waterside location and indoor/outdoor bar are great - there is an adequate pool and the views on the water-side are very nice, especially early in the morning. However, you are in a complete international bubble here from the Nespresso machine in the rooms to CNBC on the TV.   Good internet - super clean and very safe environment. You could be in Stockholm!  Check your bill carefully though - I was charged for an extra night and had a hell of a job getting it corrected even after the conference organizer intervened.

Review Title: Nice new place to stay with set-backs
Review Text: Although less than two years old, fittings start to get loose in the room, a/c not cooling sufficiently and hallways to the rooms are already smelly. The bar area in- and outside are perfect and service is good. Breakfast is expensive for what you get and far from 4 star standard. Good place to stay when you make a trip by boat, as you can be picked up directly at the hotel.

Review Title: I dunno there is just something that didn't do it for me
Review Text: I don't know if its the ambience or the services it just seem rather off. I didn't feel the hotely excitement. Clean fresh but there us something little off about t that I can't place my hand on. Sorry
Review Text

I have stayed in this hotel four times in the past 8 months. Its costly, originally it was worth the money. Standards do appear to be dropping though, the aircon is really starting to bug me, you can't really adjust the temp control in the rooms so its always ever so slightly too warm. The food is okay but the menu rarely varies and is also pricey. The gym is superb and the pool is large. What really grips is the uttter chaos and very poor service at breakfast. No control, forgetful staff, failure to keep buffet area stcoked with food. 15 minutes to get a coffee with breakfast

Review Title: great place to be when in Lagos Nigeria
Review Text: staff is very polite, everyone is smiling......the room all you need to make your stay comfertable. a beer at the bar or on the water front is a perfect ending for a hard day's work try the local beer (STAR) Note thsat rates for food are very exspensive....be sure to use the SPA ...the massage is great Be sure to book on line....get a muc cheaper rate

I stayed at the Radisson Blu, Lagos in September 2012, for 4 nights on a business trip.  The check in procedure was very long, so the waite took about 30 min.  I got a ground floor room, which is furnished very nicely.  The rooms are clean and spacious, however due to the outside noise, I would not recommend a ground floor room.  I ate at the restuarant in the hotel, the prices are very steep, so if possible do not eat there, but the food was good.  The hotel has a lovely deck overlooking the lagoon, just need to put mosquito repellant.  The breakfast was a good selection with the hotel making eggs etc.  Nothing missing there.  They had a wide selection of tea.  The only issue I had was that someone walked into my room one morning without indicating that he/she (housekeeping)

Review Title: One of the top hotels in Lagos but expensive
Review Text: I stayed here on business in September for 3 nights. On the first night I was upgraded to the presidential suite as they were fully booked. This was great although the room is actually too big, and the staff were clear that I should not get used to it. On the second and third nights I moved to a normal deluxe room which is perfectly appointed and the standards are high for Lagos. The overall hotel is well kitted out with a good gym, nice restaurant and bar area overlooking the water. Wifi is free and works well. The service is friendly and efficient. My only concern with this hotel is the rate per night. Lagos is an expensive city for quality accommodation and so cannot be compared to other cities or countries in Africa. However there is now a lot more choice for very similar

Rating is much about expectations, I came to Lagos and had to stay one night in a guest house that wasn't that nice due to unavailability of other hotels. Moving to the Radisson was a blessing. The hotel was actually very good and from an ambience perspective it was very pleasant. It was very relaxing to come back to the hotel after spending a day in the hectic Lagos. The standard is high, the rooms clean and modern. The restaurant by the river was nice but very expensive.

Review Title: Ok hotel, great for socialising not so good to stay
Review Text: The hotel is lovely to look at, big glass windows make it light however also have the effect of turning the lobby into a bit of a greenhouse/ sauna.  They have historically had issues with airconditioning and the rooms are, for me, always too hot.  The decor in the rooms is a bit hit and miss.  Some rooms seem to have been refurbished, others not at all.  The food is good, especially the snacks on the terrace (calamari are a must have!).  Not a bad hotel but not the best by a long way...  I would prefer to stay elsewhere and come for drinks/ snacks here.

This establisment is certainly a gem in the Victoria Island section of Lagos. After staying at a dive in Apapa, i checked out to come here. The service has been exeptional and, as for the view, breathtaking. I have met some amazing people that will go the extra mile to ensure that your stay is exceptional. Johan and his team strive for excellence. The days in Lagos are tiring but, once you get back to the hotel, the weight of the day lifts. I disagree with most of the reviews posted disputing this. Perspective is always a good guide and, if you are looking for something cheap and nasty, check in at The Rockview Hotel Apapa. Make sure that you have medication to curb the fever and stomach disorders.. Look out for Yoyo. A waitress that goes the distance and takes ownership of the

Review Title: Potential to be a great hotel
Review Text: Understand that to be fair, you have to judge this hotel amongst its peers; i.e. other luxury hotels in Lagos, not amongst other hotels of the same brand.   Features of Lagos hotels are:  1. Bad service and extremely slow check in/out 2. Brown/yellow smelly water 3. Credit cards that get mysteriously declined  All of this is true of the Radisson. The breakfast is average, check in drove us mad, 3 of my 6 colleagues travelling with me had their identical corporate credit cards "declined" and nobody seemed much interested. A/C was far too feeble to make a difference.  BUT. The property is new, security is good, rooms and bathrooms are quite nice and the terrace is a great meeting place. And the fact is, other hotels in Lagos have the same problems without the benefit of a new

This is a nicely appointed hotel in a great location, but already somewhat worn and slightly declining in service.  Rooms are good, the outdoor bar excellent (unless the river smells), the gym OK and easy access and parking.  But, food is limited in choice, not very good, and much too pricey.  Service is OK but a touch of faulty towers.  Still, probably one of the best hotels in Lagos but we are still waiting for a five star.  This is not it.

Review Title: This seems to be the place to be in Lagos.
Review Text: Short review after spending 5 nights at Radisson Blue in Lagos.  It's not pretty visible but the hotel offer a splendid taxi service. Order in advance and a driver will meet you at the airport. Do not be stressed he's if you don't see him immediate, he's waiting outside. A lot of the drivers are in one way or another able to get into the arrival area of the airport. Meaning before immigration and passport control.)  Also check and double check if you order return transportation. Things seems easily forgotten.   The front desk have some work to do. This took too long. Should be pretty easy these days to register and leave over the room key as all information is written into your reservation already.   What made me some upset were to find out that the hotel is only a little more
Review Text

I stay regularly in Lagos.  Complaints abound about the costs - if you have to visit, it is expensive but then so is everywhere else in Lagos! BUT - this is the best hotel I have stayed in in the city! Rooms are good, especially if you have a lagoon view, contain everything you would normally expect of a western hotel. The bathrooms, showers and toilets are more than adequate.  Wifi is good throughout the hotel. The food is very good with a choice from full dinner to bar snacks served outside. The selection of wines is also quite comprehensive, as are the western beers. Breakfast buffet is very very comprehensive and the standard is good.  Staff are polite attentive and NOT intrusive - I had absolutely no problems with any of them. They were discrete and efficient to any of my

Review Title: New and beautiful, but bad service and brown water
Review Text: After 1 week at Radisson my team did a “hotel crawl” to check out the other top hotels from Tripadvisor. We had some incidents with ignorant staff, brown water in the shower, frequent power failures and a smell of sewer outside. We ended up moving to Four Points.   It turns out that even though rooms, food and beverages are extremely overpriced at Radisson, it is the same price level everywhere, so it is still the most liveable hotel in Lagos.   Rooms are new and beautiful, the common area and pool terrace is lively and full of people. Safety is good and the breakfast buffet is reasonable. And it is still cheaper than most comparable hotels in Lagos.

Did not stay here but popped in for Breakfast. Usual fare probably not as wide a selection as other Radisson's I have breakfasted in but still very good , nicely cooked mixed omelette, cereals, fruit etc etc and speciality coffees at no extra cost. Breakfast was about N5000 (£20) which is Ok for Lagos. Best to eat indoors as there is an odour from the lagoon in the breakfast seating area outdoors.  Afterwards went out for a further cappuccino on the outdoor terrace which was comfortable and elegant overlooking the lagoon.  And you can mostly avoid the stench if you sit on the left hand side overlooking the lagoon. A nice place to while away a morning.

In oppressive Lagos, this hotel provides a very agreeable experience.  Staff (particularly female staff) do not always spring to and seem sometimes to regard sewrvice of any sort as beneath them, and the executive Floor is disappointing relative to the rest, but the rooms throughout are very nice, those over the water particularly so.  And breakfast is excellent.  I recommend it highly if you can afford the (very) steep rates.

Check in was chaos 8pm, 10 people checking in and 2 of the 4 counters manned. Each check in takes approximate 15 mins. No credit card machine is working but staff are adamant that every guest's card is 'declined'. Hotel does not take Amex - have you ever? Rooms are ok for Lagos standards but towels are thin and yellowish! Seems like someone has made an effort at panel beating the bath...how on earth does a relative new bath have so many chip and rust marks? Cherry on top are the two prostitutes confronting guests in the lift. The dinner buffet looked tragic with no one making an effort to tidy up the food presentation or close the lids, just leaving the food to dry out. Visible management is clearly lacking. Sad that after opening with such high expectations the Radisson has

Review Title: Ok, not more - but is there any alternative...?
Review Text: I have been here twice in the meantime, and once in the 4Points Sheraton. They are pretty even.  It is all ok with the Radisson Blu, but not more. For what one receives the prices are far too high, similar to the 4Points. But does one wants to go lower for cheaper? Not really. So, we continue paying the price.   If to compare, it depends what one expects. The breakfast is better at the Radisson Blu. The dinner is better at the 4Points. The rooms are ok in both, the beds are also. The staff is more friendly at the 4Points. Security is good in both. Limo service is bad and expensive in both. Spa is much better in 4Points.   As for me, I will go for the Radisson Blu again. Why? The bar is non-smoking.

Review Title: Poor quality motel style hotel.  Overpriced.
Review Text: Stayed a night in a ground floor room.  Had to wait to check in as room not ready.  Small room with no frills.  Towels paper thin. Overall a 2/3 star experience but amazingly priced at $364 for a night!  Total rip off.

Review Title: Hotel painfully average, worst front desk ever
Review Text: I have stayed in this hotel 5+ times recently on business trip. The Radisson Blu is a relatively new addition to the Lagos hotel scene and has developed into the "standard" for short-term business travellers in Lagos.  +Excellent location +Nice terrace for evening drinks and meetings +good "image" in Lagos -Rooms not really international standard (but then again, what can you expect) -Food is ok-ish (not a lot of international choices, taste pale) -The absolutely and positively most horrendous front desk I have experienced in my life: check-in and check-out in slow motion, huge queues in the morning and evening, every time some issues with rate, booking, invoice etc., very unfriendly/aggressive, arrogant behavior and attitude; only good thing: credit cards work 90% (very rare in

Review Title: Mostly good but room for improvements
Review Text: This hotel is about a year old and my stay was very pleasant. The new rooms, with walk-in showers in the bathroom made a welcome change from other hotels I've stayed at in Lagos - although the room and corridors still seemed to smell of a combination of aircon damp and old tramp. Considering other hotels smell of urinal cakes, I considered this to be an improvement. The gym is adequate and the pool is small but a welcome facility, overlooking the lagoon. Sitting on the outside deck of the hotel after a long day's work is a great way to unwind, although the occasional smell of sewage (or more correctly, refuse floating in the water) did take the edge of this.  The service in the bar area could occasionally have a tendency to be languid, but generally it was fine. The food menu is

It is just a regular Radisson, nothing special , although it feels different in the middle of the Nigerian reality. It actually feels a little bit like a jail, with a 2 meters fence all around, tight security and close neighborhood to embassy area. All basic services are in place inc. standard free wireless like in all Radisson hotels, small buff breakfast, nicely equipped gym and outdoor swimming pool. The only thing that does not fit is high price (over 320 USD per night). I guess this is due to lack of competition, but one car stay cheaper in Tokyo or New Year and I don't think you should compare Lagos with those citites.
Review Text

You book Radisson for consistent standard, but not present here.. Room had heavy drone of chiller unit on the roof, stained window seats and carpet plus chipped veneers.Had to swap to another room beside generator, but smelly and no a/c. Eventually got another with A/C that refused to go below 25C. Plus points: complimentary buffet breakfast good, (not amazing) whole site safe and main atrium area quite attractive lagoon deck patio nice bathrooms well fitted beds very comfy near to Mega plaza mins away with shop to buy snack foods to avoid punishing restaurant costs, easy to walk to. wi-fi ok, and could stream video  down side: gormless management recurrent power failures brown water from sink A/C paralytic customer service very patchy and service desk sloppy and poorly run pool

Wow. Despite having an army of people behind the front desk and no line, check-in took 30 minutes. I'm not sure why. They were arguing about several things -- right in front of me. I've gone down to the front desk for a few times since, and no matter what, it always seems to take more than 20 minutes! There's never an "I'll be right with you". The staff seem to be unable to prioritize or multitask. Further, they often argue with each other, right in front of customers. Also, the man who was checking me in actually stepped away from the desk to chat / flirt with some good looking female patrons -- amazing!  After my sloppy check-in experience, I went to the restaurant to grab food. I had to get up and ask for a waiter to come serve me. I did so two times. Still no service. In
Quite new, but looks unfinished. Trouble with checking in and maybe it was a busy day it lacks the customer service needed, however it is the best choice in Lagos for now.

Review Title: Fancy looks, but not great otherwise
Review Text: This hotel is new and looks great, but I don't think I would stay here again. - The receptionist played us right when we came in: "We don't have any rooms". We just wanted to complain he says "Here me out, I only have smoking rooms." "How bad is it?" "I will be honest with you, it smells like cigarette". "Actually, as another option, I might have one accessible room and one lagoon view, both on the ground floor". Sounds great given what was expected now, right?
