The "lagoon view" room, was right next to the party on the patio, not great if you want to sleep or just have a bit of privacy. My "accessible room" had little quirks too. No bathtub obviously, the shower didn't drain so the whole bathroom was flooded every morning, not great for a new $300 hotel. And it was looking

Review Title: A very acceptable hotel in Lagos
Review Text: Not the best value by world standards, but for Lagos, a reasonable price.  The hotel lives up to its 4 stars which is saying something for Lagos, where you never know what you are hoing to get.  A great gym, secure enviroment, and decent rooms.  The wifi was excellent which is important to me, and when I had an issue with my wifi the guys were attentive and quick to resolve.  I had two challenges with my room.  1. safe battery was flat and water pressure was low.  Both issues were resolved speedily.

I stayed at the Radisson Blue for 6 days during a recent business trip. The staff is extremely attentive and ensured that I had all I needed. The wifi access is excellent. The rooms are clean and comfortable. They offer everything that you would expect from a great hotel. Their dinners and breakfast are good which removes the worry of trying to find a decent place to eat.  I recommend the radisson blu for any trip to Lagos. The presence of the pool and outside bar area make it a great place to relax after a long hot Lagos work day!

Stayed here on business in November 2011 with a colleague. We were impressed with the quality, cleanliness, security and atmosphere. Fairly expensive (everything is in Lagos) but worthwhile and for a first trip to Lagos (from the UK) we chose well. Good outside bar with reasonable (mostly European) food and friendly staff, but with the wind in the wrong direction there can be a bit of a whiff from the creek sometimes. Pool was clean and serviced from the outside bar. Own boat jetty which was useful to avoid the ghastly Lagos traffic. Would stay here again.

Had a very pleasant stay at the Radisson Blu on my visit to Lagos.  The rooms are very nice but the highlight are the great beds! Made for a great night's sleep. The morning breakfast is also very generous and I tried not to miss it.  Make sure to request a room with a Lagoon view as the noise coming from the very busy main road can be at times unbearable. Honking horns seems to be a national pastime in Nigeria.  Unfortunately the hotel's road is a main thoroughfare leading out of Victoria Island and it can quite congested during rush hour. This can mean some patience in getting back to your hotel between 5pm and 7pm.  The outdoor terrace is a great place to meet for after work drinks or to conduct meetings. The food is quite good and it is very convenient for hotel guests to

Review Title: Nice Hotel but a few Operational Hiccups
Review Text: Stayed at the Radisson for 2 nights from the 31st December 2011 to the 2nd February 2012.  We asked for a Standard Room with 2 beds as we were 2 adults and 3 kids. On checking in we were told there were no double bed rooms available and even suggested the kids could sleep on the floor with a duvet. I gave them a piece of my mind about that and it seemed to wake them up. After a 2 hour wait, I was upgraded to a lagoon facing executive double room and was asked to pay half the price on my intial bill for the entire stay. Not bad for compensation I must say.  The hotel has a very good buffet and breakfast was very filling. Room also had lots of space for the kids to run around. The kids also enjoyed playing in the kiddies pool and the hotel made a fair attempt to entertain them on

If there is one thing i will not forget about this hotel in a while, is the bed.  It was big and extremely comfortable. i particularly liked the interior and the view. i am not much of a food person but Breakfast during my stay was elaborate enough. this is one hotel i can actually just stay in. No hurry to go elsewhere. They were having a festive promo rate when i visited and it was good Value for the price>
Review Text

Without doubt the best of the hotels I've stayed at in Lagos. Location next to the lagoon and on VI is very good, rooms are also excellent, but food is fairly average, although no worse than anywhere else. Would be best to book a room located away from the power plant, that would be very noisy and I imagine was an afterthought.

It's a fantastic location on 5 Cowrie Creek nice rooms and cool decor. The place to hang out after a tough Lagos week.service is ordinary and the food very uninspiring.prices are typically high In Lagos as it's costly to run those generators.The car park is too small  The food is a real let down. The kids did not finish their burgers and the breakfast buffet is dire with poor fare and sweaty cheese perhaps the sight of seeing on duty chefs smoking and drinking beer sums it up......

Rooms are OK, if nothing special (which I guess can mean quite good for Lagos).  Although the food is a little bland, the outdoor restaurant is a nice place to kill time with nice seating/setting.  Indoor buffet restaurant a little disappointing with a very limited non-Nigerian spread.  Overall OK, if it wasnt for the useless front desk and reservation office, but rates vary a lot and at USD 280 found it just about OK but wouldnt pay a $ more (even for Lagos).
This is a very nice hotel with excellent service and in very good condition. Clean and bright. Good food and bar areas. Excellent wifi in all areas of the hotel.

I really had a great time in Radisson hotel, wonderful time inside and outside. Very good restaurant, and I even met the German Chief Cook who took care of all the guests. Wonderful atmosphere outside during sunset, and the people who go there are the best in Lagos

Visited in August for about 15 days with my family and we were floored by the level of service. The staff are really friendly and there is nothing too difficult for them. They go the extra mile at all times. Its a safe hotel, we were not robbed, plundered or conned as we were led to believe. The infinity pool was great and they do serve great non-alcoholic cocktails. The food was always to a high standard. We also ate out at other places in Lagos but we always found the banqueting staff welcoming, open to suggestions etc. The gym facilities are of a very high standard and the staff are available to give you towels or a quick induction on the machines. They can draw up a programme for you whilst you are on your holiday as well.

A nice enough hotel but staff members are a little jaded.  I wrote (and was charged) a 500 Naira tip onto the room-service bill but was pestered by the staff to leave it in cash...  Water from the taps is brown and it seems impossible to get water warmer than lukewarm.  But the swimming pool is excellent (about 30 metres long) and the hotel is much cheaper and nicer than the Federal Palace where I've stayed previously.  Will be interested to see how it compares with the Intercontinental when that opens.  Breakfasts are a joy - includng the nicest chicken sausages that I've ever had.

Review Title: Excellent hotel, newest place in Victoria Island
Review Text: Nice rooms, friendly staff, nice outside terrace, covered and non-covered, great cocktails. Only the lunch menu could be a little larger. One of the best hotel beds I've slept in this year (over 30 hotels this year)

This is great addition if Lagos, relatively stylish with great bar and infinity swimming pool next to the river.  Good rooms, stylish bathrooms. A few teething problems, like brown water from the bathtaps, no hot water function in my shower, half an hour for wifi to accept you after checking in, slow waiter service in the busy evenings, doesn't take Amex, ..but overall I'd make this first choice for Lagos for now.

Review Title: Best hotel I have stayed at in Lagos
Review Text: The Radisson Blu Anchorage hotel is head and shoulders above the Eko, where I stayed on my last trip.  The Radisson rooms are modern, sleek, and clean with great air conditioning--no musty smell, no dampness in the room, and tons of cold air.  Nespresso coffee machines with lots of name brand bottled water, great bathroom with walk in shower with hot water and lots of water pressure, nice clean fluffy towels.  The bed was very comfortable and the bedding crisply white and clean.  Lobby areas are modern and clean.  Staff was helpful and more or less competent.  Restaurant food was pretty lousy, and restaurant service was poor.  However, I didn't get sick, so that is a big plus.  Wifi worked great for me.
Review Text

I stayed 3 nights in a club room for business in July 2011. It’s a new hotel with modern rooms and facilities and full WiFi coverage (with weakened signal as you go further from the corridor into the room and from the lobby out to the outdoor bar). My room included a good work area. The shower was good and the bed was comfortable with standard amenities. In-room cleaning standard was consistently lower than expected.  The club lounge is in a lower standard then in most similar hotels I visited with very basic variety of snacks and beverages and with no service manager / butler / concierge presence.    Good breakfast, very nice outdoor bar for evening meetings or relaxation, professional team in front desk. Everything you need for a successful business trip.

This hotel ticked all the boxes for me as;- It’s well located on Victoria Island Lagos, it’s new, modern, and light and bright, the rooms and the bathroom areas are reasonably sized.  It has a stylish main reception and bar area, with the latter full of lively locals at the weekends. Best of all is the timber decked terrace bar with its comfy sofas and an infinity pool overlooking the lagoon. This is definitely the place to relax after a hard day of Lagos traffic and a good place for meetings too.  I found all the staff attentive and friendly.

Review Title: Good new hotel for business travellers in Lagos
Review Text: I stayed here for two nights in August and it was a very pleasant and nice addition to a city that could use more world class hotels. The rooms are well appointed and clean. The bar, restaurant and terrace are very nice at least when it isn't sweltering, which it often is. There is free Wi Fi throughout the building which is a nice touch. I thought the gym was a bit of a let down. You would think that any hotel that is frequented by business travelers and is bothers to invest in an infinity pool would make the gym a priority. But it is a small, cramped, has old machines and no free weights. Also ask for a river side view or you will be looking out on a dusty, traffic clogged road and some noisy power generators.

Stayed here as the sponsor company gets preferential rates so pre booked Dinner, Bed & Breakfast and paid in advance to avoid surprises. Arrived and discovered payment had not been processed - i left my company and the hotel to sort without me and it only took a whole day. The staff are all courteous and polite, all cant seem to do enough for you, but i am amazed there are SO many staff - it seems it takes 3 bell hops to get you out of you vehicle and in the door and no one will take no for an answer, i guess it must be illegal for guests to touch their own luggage inside the hotel?  The hotel is in a good location for where i was working, the bed was amazingly comfortable - tempur memory foam mattress or similar.  The rooms were well appointed and spacious - i had a superior
